jobDescription:
Position: Video Editor + Content CreatorReports to: Senior Video EditorLocation: Hybrid
Ritual is a personal health brand that is building the future of daily essentials. Our mission is simple: we help turn healthy habits into a Ritual. We started by creating the first visible supply chain of its kind and reinventing the daily multivitamin from the ground up. Now, together with some of the world’s leading scientists, researchers and advisors, we’re developing a new standard of high-quality, traceable daily products across new categories. Hundreds of thousands of customers across generations trust us, and we are growing quickly.
We’ve built a team of over 120 (and counting) curious skeptics, world-class scientists, unconventional artists, expert marketers, and strategists. We’re venture-backed and based in sunny Los Angeles. If you’re looking to challenge the status quo and be challenged to do the best work of your career, join us.
EssentialRitual is looking for an accomplished Video Editor + Content Creator to help bring ideas to life, collaborating across the creative team and company. You should get excited about implementing and finding unique solutions to creative challenges. You will work with the Studio team on acquisition-focused projects, partnering with the Director of Motion & Video, the Senior Video Editor, and the Manager of Paid Social & Growth Creative. This work will directly influence our growth and the evolution of the brand's creative identity.
 What You'll Do:Edit short-form ads for paid social, using influencer content, UGC, motion graphics, and audio – and improve for multiple platforms (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and Amazon)Shoot UGC photo and video content at home, in the office, and on set, featuring product, models, or employeesWork with the Growth Marketing team to brainstorm creative concepts, create and test ads, and identify iteration opportunities based on performance dataCollaborate with the larger Creative team on brand assets that live across social, site, email, and more.
Who You Are:Growth-minded. You understand growth marketing and how to create branded content that performs and feels native to its platform without compromising brand identityResourceful. You're looking for an environment where you can get creative and experiment, whether that's shooting UGC at home or finding new ways to re-package existing contentPlugged-in. You're up-to-date on social media platforms, trends, and best practicesSelf-starter. You're comfortable working with a remote team
What You"ll Need:3+ years of experience in Adobe PremiereSome experience with Adobe After Effects and Adobe Photoshop, incorporating & modifying graphics from templatesExperience shooting product UGC and creating content for brandsStorytell ability to find or create narrativesA working knowledge of media management, encoding, audio mastering, color correctionExperience working with a legal or regulatory teamSome experience with lighting or prop/product stylingWillingness to be featured in social or ad contentExperience with an acquisition environment and an understanding of direct-to-consumer (D2C) business metrics (CPA, KPI, etc.)
Compensation and Benefits:PAY RANGE: $70,000 - $110,000Your base salary is one part of your total compensation package. The salary range represents the entire compensation range for this position. Exact compensation will depend on several factors, which may include your skills, level, years of experience, technical expertise, and other qualifications. You will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. You will be also eligible for equity and great benefits + 401k + unlimited PTO etc - see our list of perks/ benefits below.

Why Ritual?Since launching in October 2016, Ritual has grown to be a cultural revolution in the health industry. We’re not about pseudoscience, half-truths or health fads. We are simple, effective, and backed by real science. We have some pretty great benefits & perks for full-time employees related to our office environment, however, they have been limited due to the global health situation. See below for our adjusted available perks until we can get back into the office together!
List of our benefits and perks:Medical/Dental/Vision/Life InsuranceHealthcare & Dependent Care FSAEquity participation401k Match - Up to 4%Pet InsuranceFree Ritual ForeverUnlimited PTO - 10 days minimum to keep you fresh18 paid holidaysBi-Annual Performance Reviews“Ritual First Fridays” - Entire company takes off the first Friday of each month5 months paid maternity/paternity leave and we cover health insurance during any additional time taken under-protected baby bonding time offFlex time for returning to work birth-parentsChildcare stipend (monthly expense)Work from Home stipendMaven Clinic, a family planning platform for all Ritual and employees and dependents.Periodic group workouts with trainers on ZoomWellness stipend

Ritual is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together.
companyDescription:
Based in sunny Los Angeles, Ritual is a direct-to-consumer health brand that believes it’s crucial to know not just what you’re putting into your body, but why you need it in the first place. 

We’re transparent about our ingredients, where they're sourced from, and have spent years conducting extensive research behind each of the premium nutrient forms we use. Our products are simple, effective, and backed by science. Our mission is simple: to empower people to feel their best by turning healthy habits into a ritual.

We have built a team of curious skeptics, world-class scientists, unconventional artists, expert marketers and analytical strategists that are on a mission to reinvent an entire industry. We’re well-funded, growing quickly, and committed to our mission. If you’re a team player who refuses to settle for the status quo, we want you. Welcome to your new daily Ritual.

Ritual is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are are committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together.

jobDescription:
About Us:

Live experiences help people cross today’s digital divide and focus on what truly connects us – the here, the new, this once-in-a-lifetime moment that’s bringing us together. To fulfill Gametime’s mission of uniting the world through shared experiences, we make it easy for people to discover and access the live experiences that matter most.

With platforms on iOS, Android, mobile web and desktop supporting more than 25,000 events across the US and Canada, we are reimagining the event ticket industry in order to move at the speed of life.

Position:

Gametime is looking for an uber-organized Creative Producer with their finger on the pulse of social media advertising trends to join the creative team. This role will assist in producing in-house social shoots, user generated content, and operations support for the Greater Creative Team.

This role requires the ability to travel occasionally for production.

What you'll do / own:
Support the UGC pipeline Organize and track deliverables and performance data for the Greater Creative Team Logistics, scheduling, tracking expenses, and invoicing for in-house productions Manage casting and relationships with creators, talent, agents, and vendorsBasic editing of templatized UGC videos when necessary (i.e. – “Tips”) File and media asset organization

A little more about you:
Excellent organizational & communication skillsExperience producing “mobile first” advertising content for social mediaDeep understanding of platform specific best practices & trends (particularly TikTok & IG). On set experience; managing talent, crew, equipment, contracts, permits, etc. Basic working knowledge of Adobe Premiere (or other professional editing software)Experience with data-driven performance creative on social mediaThe confidence to communicate your ideas and sell them to peers and leadership. 

Nice To Haves:
Agency and/or in-house experience with e-commerce brands or apps. Experience with basic marketing related data analysisExperience working at least partially remoteExperience working with influencers and celebrities

Education and Experience:
3+ years experience working in advertising at either an agency or in-house for a company doing data driven performance marketing. Bachelors or above in Video Production, Advertising, Communications, Marketing, or related fields. Equivalent professional experience will be considered. 

Base Salary Range:
$65,000 - $100,000

At Gametime pay ranges are subject to change and assigned to a job based on specific market median of similar jobs according to 3rd party salary benchmark surveys. Individual pay within that range can vary for several reasons including skills/capabilities, experience, and available budget.

What we can offer:
Flexible PTOEquityMedical, dental, & vision insuranceLife insurance and disability benefits401K, HSA, pre-tax savings programsNew equipment setup providedDiverse Family-forming benefits through Carrot FertilityWellness programsTenure recognition

Gametime is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.
companyDescription:
Gametime sells last-minute tickets to the most popular events in sports, music, and theater in more than 50 cities across the U.S. and Canada. We’re passionate about enabling incredible shared experiences, so we build technology that gets people out into the real world together. 

With a bias for spontaneity, we’re focused on making the process simple and smooth while you’re on the move. We eliminated the need for printing tickets and built a better way to access the best live experiences right from your phone – so you can skip the hassle and enjoy the moment.

jobDescription:
Job Description:
At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:
Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.
We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.
Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.
A little bit about our team:
ADA is the independent distribution and label services arm of Warner Music Group, breaking brand new artists and supporting industry legends. We bring the full passion and power of our people to every engagement, magnifying artists’ impact and helping them build the career of their dreams.
ADA’s Digital Marketing team is the heartbeat of its label services offering, partnering directly with artists, managers, and labels -- as well as cross-functional ADA and Warner teams -- to bring artist campaigns life and grow audience across social, streaming, CRM, and beyond. We are both creative cultural experts and meticulous digital operators, driven by a passion to optimize, innovate, educate, and empower in harmony with our indie partners.
Your role:
ADA is looking for a strategic digital marketer with expertise in social content strategy to join the digital marketing team as Manager, Digital Marketing. The Manager, Digital Marketing will be responsible for developing comprehensive digital strategies for marketing releases from Label Services artists and distributed partners across genres and career stages. The position will manage a roster of projects and develop campaigns that create cultural conversation, build artist social followings and engagement, and drive music consumption. They will be both creatively-minded and analytically-driven, serving as experts in industry standards digital marketing music.
Here you’ll get to:
Develop digital marketing rollouts & campaign strategies to successfully grow music streams, video views, UGC, social media engagement, CRM/fan acquisition, and an overall digital creative vision for ADA Label Services partnersPartner with artists and management to craft a social narrative and content strategy for each artist that elevates their brands and drives fandom, cultural conversation and music consumptionCraft, commission, and manage digital campaign budgets and plans for Label Services releases including content creation, advertising, influencer marketing, AR and custom web developmentBuild and manage new and ongoing relationships with online partners, third-party marketing agencies, content creators, and influencersMonitor campaigns in real-time, making recommendations for continuous improvement. Create post-mortem analyses to quantify the impact of each campaign and measure effectiveness of each tactic.Assist with the development and optimization of online artist properties and communities (eg YouTube, TikTok, Discord, microsites) as applicableWork in conjunction with department head and ADA Digital Commerce team to develop marketing drivers to support opportunities with streaming services. Analyze consumption patterns on a track or artist level to inform tailored social campaigns to drive streamingCollaborate with internal teams including ADA Commerce, Label Management/Marketing, Publicity, andn Sync to build cohesive cross-platform campaignsSecure artist promotional opportunities via internal WMX O&O media and IMGN digital outletsMaintain expert level knowledge of social platforms and social content strategies with a deep understanding of how to use each platform to drive engagement and consumption. Define engagement and audience growth goals and create a roadmap to reach those goalsRecommend new digital tools and partnerships for Label Services artists and label clients, including both platforms, insights, and marketing tools, as well as partnerships with upcoming sites/services.Communicate product updates and best practices to artists, managers. and internal stakeholdersBuild and maintain relationships with social media platform representatives and participate in regular update meetings as led by department headConceive and manage campaign strategies for ADA’s social and digital brand presence
About you:You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferredYou have a minimum of 3+ years professional experience in digital/social media marketing in the music industryYou have outstanding organizational and communication skills and expertise in social media content strategyYou have a passion for technology, socials, music, and fan-focused digital strategiesYou have your finger on the pulse of current social media and pop culture trends and values, especially amongst Gen Z consumersYou build and maintain relationshipsA problem-solving attitude to get it done, no matter the challengeThe ability to excel in a fast-paced, team-oriented environmentStrong background in digital strategy, with duties at previous employers that included day-to-day work in this areaAbility to work on tight timeframes and move projects forward with limited assetsDemonstrate leadership in team discussions and client meetingsA deep understanding of interactive technologies and communication tools, including:TikTokFacebookInstagramTwitterYouTubeSnapchatBeRealDiscordWebsite strategyEmail/CRM strategy
We’d love it if you also had:
Graphic design (eg. Canva, Photoshop) and video editing skills (eg. FinalCut, Premiere, Capcut)Familiarity with file sharing applications, rippers, converters, encoders, etcExperience using project management software (eg Airtable or Asana)Experience analyzing and communicating data and insights trends (eg Chartmetric, CrowdTangle, Spotify for Artists)Knowledge of web3, NFT’s and cryptocurrency marketing
About us: 
As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.
Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.
Salary Range
$60,000 - $75,000 Annually
Salary Ranges are included for all NY, California job postings and 100% remote roles where talent can be located. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as work experience and business needs. The pay range is subject to change at any time dependent on a variety of internal and external factors.
WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
Copyright © 2023 Warner Music Inc.
companyDescription: With a legacy extending back over 200 years, Warner Music Group (WMG) today brings together artists, songwriters, and entrepreneurs that are moving entertainment culture across the globe. Operating in more than 70 countries through a network of affiliates and licensees, WMG’s Recorded Music division includes renowned labels such as Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, Elektra, Erato, First Night, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville. WMG’s music publishing arm, Warner Chappell Music, has a catalog of over one million copyrights spanning every musical genre, from the standards of the Great American Songbook to the biggest hits of the 21st century. Warner Music Group is also home to ADA, the independent artist and label services company, as well as consumer brands such as Songkick, the live music app; EMP, the merchandise e-tailer; and UPROXX, the youth culture destination.

jobDescription:
The Position:The Temporary Manager, Social Media reports into the VP, Marketing and will develop and execute the organic social media content strategy for Topic Streaming service. The ideal team member will have an insatiable curiosity for audience behaviors, and expert knowledge of engagement marketing strategies and tactics across social media channels, partnerships, video platforms and the overall media landscape.This position is a one month assignment with the possibility of extending month to month. 
Responsibilities:Develop and execute the engagement strategy for Topic streaming service, ensuring it aligns with our business goals, voice, and individual brand sensibilities to maximize engagement and grow audience visibilityWork closely with the different Topic departments to understand priorities and challengesOversee and run Topic’s monthly content strategy session, and implement agreed upon ideasCollaborate and partner with the Media Community Manager, Growth Manager and Engagement Manager on marketing strategies, content planning and outputAttend all required team meetingsAdvise Topic Studios social media managers to provide audience development and engagement expertise and support, as needed.Solid knowledge of UGC landscape, building out campaigns, CTA, and monitoring deadlines in a timely manner.Activate promotional partnerships with external partners, talent and events, when needed.Other appropriately related projects/duties as assigned.
Social Media SpecificsManage the content calendar, story selection, frequency and creative expression with an eye toward growing audience, engagement and advocacy.Ensure that all social campaigns are structured based on goals and KPIsParticipate in paid media budget allocation and boosting strategyLead the testing strategy with the goal of constant iteration and optimizationWork closely with the Topic Analytics team to understand and optimize performanceMaintain an understanding of who our audiences are on social, the differences by platform and brand, and develop strategies to grow and deepen our relationship with those audiencesMonitor the latest media, social trends, and tools and incorporate these into Topic’s social strategy; regularly provide internal teams with updated best practices and recommendationsIn collaboration with Media Community Manager, monitor user comments across platforms and develop macros and strategies for implementationWrite creative briefs for internal creative team as well as external creators; provide turnkey storyboards for referenceDevelop and present frequent performance reporting
Background & Qualifications:4- 6 years of specific and/or combined experience in social media strategy/marketing, influencer media, content execution, and overall audience engagement.Experience building audience engagement, ideally with a media organization and/or driving direct-to-consumer subscription-based brands.Deep knowledge of social platforms best practices and an endless passion for innovation and experimentation in the social space.Knowledge of tools such as Social Flow, Facebook Insights, Twitter Analytics, Buffer, GA4, Canva, TikTok Spark, Gorgias, #paidAbility to combine data and creative intuition to create social strategies and content recommendations that will attract and engage fans, build communities and drive growth.Expert knowledge of organic and paid social strategies and tactics on FB, IG, TW, YT, TT, Reddit, etc.Adept at interpreting data and shaping it into actionable strategies and recommendationsComfortable managing and collaborating with freelancers, external agencies and influencersStrong writing / copy creation skillsStrong project management skillsStrong presentation skillsCollaborative work-styleCustomer-first mindset, with the ability to identify and understand audiences, how to reach them for maximum engagement.
Additional Qualifications:Strong interpersonal skills with the proven ability to collaborate, build consensus and work across teams.Ability to self-manage and prioritize work appropriatelyExperience in a start-up environment a plus
Compensation (NYC Only): The salary range for this role is prorated monthly based on $77,000 - $82,000 annually. The salary offered will be determined based on relative experience, skillset, and other job-related factors.
About FIRST LOOK MEDIAFirst Look Media is a new-model media company devoted to supporting independent voices, from fearless investigative journalism and documentary filmmaking to smart, provocative entertainment. Launched in 2013 by eBay founder and philanthropist Pierre Omidyar, FLM was founded on the fundamental belief that freedom of expression and of the press, and the power of storytelling, are vital to both a vibrant culture and a thriving democracy. First Look Media’s flagship brands include the award-winning entertainment studio, Topic Studios and the “criminally-good” streaming service, Topic. FLM continues to expand its mission of supporting independent voices via a variety of new brands, formats and platforms, as well as through foundational technology, helping creators and audiences develop, distribute, discover and connect with meaningful stories.
 About TOPICTopic is the boundary-pushing streaming service from First Look Entertainment for thrillers, mysteries, dramas and documentaries from around the world, serving viewers who crave entertainment beyond the mainstream. Whether it’s a Nordic-noir crime thriller (The Killing), an Italian supernatural political drama (The Miracle), or a haunting true crime docu-series from the UK (The Missing Children), Topic expands your view of the world.Featuring North American premieres, exclusive TV series and film, and programming from more than 40 countries, Topic showcases an unparalleled collection of creators, perspectives and experiences. Complemented by our Topic Originals, we prioritize bold storytelling and champion underrepresented voices. Topic Originals and exclusives include Oscar® nominee The Letter Room (starring Oscar Isaac), Lambs of God (starring Ann Dowd), BAFTA® nominee The Virtues (starring Stephen Graham), Emmy® nominee The Accidental Wolf (starring Kelli O’Hara), Dark Woods, Gotham Award winning Philly D.A., and Soul City (directed by Coodie & Chike).Topic is available to US and Canadian audiences on topic.com, AppleTV & iOS, Roku, Amazon Fire TV, Android & Android TV, Samsung, Apple TV Channels, Roku Premium Channels, Bell Fibe, Amazon Prime Video Channels, and Comcast (Xfinity X1, Xfinity Flex and XClass TV). Topic is part of First Look Entertainment which also includes Topic Studios, the award-winning entertainment studio which develops, finances, and produces content for all platforms.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer - People of color, people with disabilities, women, and LGBT candidates are strongly encouraged to apply; we are committed to a diverse workplace, and to supporting our staff with ongoing career development opportunities.
companyDescription:
First Look Media is a new-model media company devoted to supporting independent voices, from fearless investigative journalism and documentary filmmaking to smart, provocative entertainment. Launched in 2013 by eBay founder and philanthropist Pierre Omidyar, First Look Media was created with the belief that independent perspectives are vital to both a vibrant culture and a thriving democracy. 

First Look Media is currently in the market with its flagship properties, The Intercept, Field of Vision, The Press Freedom Defense Fund, Topic Studios, and the recently launched Topic streaming service, and plans to continue expanding its mission of supporting independent voices via a variety of new brands, formats and platforms as well as through foundational technology helping creators and audiences develop, distribute, discover and connect with meaningful stories.

jobDescription:
Welcome to the MILK MAKEUP FAM:At Milk Makeup, we believe in good ingredients + epic payoff. We’re cruelty-free, paraben-free, and 100% vegan.
We were born at Milk, a creative studio in downtown New York City. Our community and culture have always been our inspiration.
We see personal style and experimentation as the ultimate form of self-expression. It’s not just about how you create your look; it’s what you do in it that matters.
#LiveYourLook

Your VIBE:Naturally progressive: You’re curious and always thinking about how to improve your and your community’s future. You value a forward-thinking space that encourages you to move the needle and take risks.Confident but chill: You’re flexible and ready to get the job done, but you’re humble and make moves thoughtfully. You go after what you want, but always have your team and the greater good of the brand in mind.Rule breaker: You’re not afraid of the unknown. You’re down to disrupt the status quo and believe that an open mind is always a good place to start.Inclusive + mindful of community: You embrace differences and help foster a safe working environment for yourself and your peers.Champion of self-expression: You’re genuinely you. You live your look and want to grow with people who champion self-expression.

The Role:Responsible for building and maintaining Milk Makeup social brand experience. Supports Chief Creative Officer and Director of Social in developing creative strategy to support business goals for organic and paid social, from concept to execution across all platforms.

How you’ll THRIVEBrand Builder: Partners with Senior Art Director to develop and build strong visual brand to support brand positioning. Supports in execution to ensure consistency across all channels with a focus on digital and social. Develops visual design standards for brand. (including 360 templates and best practices).Functions as brand manager to ensure consistency across all social platforms. Develops visual standards/codes (including art direction, tone and manner, graphics, typography, video, curated UGC, commissioned and organic content).Strategic Thinker: Partners with Senior Art Director to support 360 creative and marketing strategy to achieve social-focused business objectives. Deep understanding of social landscape, data, analytics, trends and social best practices within beauty. Work very closely with Social and Marketing teams to drive integration of marketing goals and brand expression across all channels to foster and grow our online community, expand our reach and convert clients.
Creative Collaborator: Partners closely with Editorial, Campaign and Product Development teams to develop creative concepts for robust 360 client experience. Partners with Creative Operations to align on appropriate creative production strategy and content creators to ensure accurate execution of creative vision. Including but not limited to art direction across still and motion beauty shoots, product shoots, tiktok content, how-to’s)
Social Expert: Passionate and proficient in all things social. Speaks language of social media and understands how to drive business and achieve results in the social space. Ahead of the curve in terms of social ideation and best-in-class creativity across each platform. Knows how to win in the space.
Cross-functional Partner: Builds and maintains relationships with cross-functional partners to ensure strategic objectives are met. Regularly meets and collaborates with various cross-functional teams including Brand & Product Marketing, Influencers, Social Marketing, Retail & EDU. Will be directly connected to Director of Social Marketing and Influencer teams to align on social goals and build robust UGC/Creative partner content model across organic and paid.
External Partner: Partners with outside agency and vendors when appropriate including: Socially-focused strategic and production agencies (i.e. tiktok strategic agency). Manages agency relationship to ensure work is aligned with brand and agency is leveraged in effective manner.
Inspirational Mentor: Leads with creative vision and inspires team to think strategically and create exciting elevated creative solutions that function for the business. Educates team in creative expertise and knowledge including social-first content and best practices, creative direction, art direction, photography, video, design and typography.
Thoughtful Manager: Manages direct reports to ensure projects track to schedule, creative adheres to vision and executes properly. Assigns workload and responsibilities to team in thoughtful manner to develop direct reports and build effective creative team.
Skilled Presenter: Represents creative team in a variety of settings: large/small groups, direct reports, managers, formal presentations. 
We’d like YOU to have:5-6+ years of creative experience.College degree; BA or BFA preferred in Graphic Design or Communication Design.Passion for social creative, art direction, photography, video and design.Knowledge and experience in social space.Understanding of beauty and fashion.Understanding of photography and knowledge of relevant industry talent.Understanding of current industry related trends.Understanding of design, typography and layout principles, graphics, digital/social best practices and production process.Management experience.Strong leadership, negotiation and consensus-building skills.Strong relationship-building skills; ability to work with a variety of people in various disciplines.Team player: Enjoys working with others and collaborating with positive attitude.Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.Excellent presentation skills at both team and leadership levels.Solid organizational skills, detail-oriented; time management skills, ability to juggle priorities.Proficient knowledge of Adobe programs: Indesign, Illustrator, Photoshop After Effects and Premiere..Ability to work in a very fast paced environment and meet very tight deadlines.The drive to excel and succeed; self-motivated.Passion for Milk Makeup, our products, programs, clients, retail and marketing.Some travel may be required.
companyDescription: Driven by creativity and designed by industry insiders, Milk Makeup is inspired by our home; Milk. A cultural hub in NY and LA, that sits at the crossroads of fashion, music, photography, art and film. A place where trends are born and a platform for the next generation. Milk Makeup is fun, eco-conscious and cool. Our multifunctional, high-tech formulas are built for the girl on the go who spends less time getting done up, more time getting stuff done.

jobDescription:
The PositionThe main focus of this role is to lead creative direction, outline storyboards, and write messaging for paid social and other digital ad placements. In this role, you’ll be a part of a fast-growing team and help scale some of the most promising direct-to-consumer brands. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of performance marketing for direct-to-consumer brands, how to structure a customer journey from awareness to purchase, and is looking to own responsibility for creative performance across clients that range from early-stage startups to growing brands.
Our number one focus is to drive growth and ROI for our clients. You will be expected to manage needs internally while providing insight and roadmaps for clients on where and how to scale through creative. You will use your experience to make decisions and make choices of risks worth testing in order to drive growth. You will be in charge of driving constant team and client communication to make sure that the account has a sense of urgency to find creative winners and scale budgets whenever possible.
Required SkillsExperience working with design teams from brief through creative executionData-oriented thinking to understand how certain metrics impact performance and how to act upon data when things are and are not workingAttention to detail to provide thorough briefs and a rigid approval process before client reviewsDeep understanding of a customer sales journey and how it relates to storytellingExpert copywriting skills to deepen brand stories and creativesExperience with tools such as Facebook Ads, Google Ads/Analytics Suite, Figma, Motion, Klaviyo, Slack/Asana/Notion (or project management tools), and Shopify is a bonusClient-facing experience is an added bonus
ResponsibilitiesHandle brand research and data mining to understand value propositions, customer reviews, and market opportunities.Ideate hypotheses and manage testing roadmaps to drive a structured creative testing processGathering inspiration and competitor building competitor boardsCreate informed briefs for the internal design team to execute performance-driven creative for paid social advertisingBuild shot lists and decks for UGC content shootsFind and manage content-creator relationshipsLead copy across paid ads for in-ad and headline copyAssist with landing pages and email copy, outlines, and optimizations to improve conversion ratesTracking performance metrics and key KPIs of each creative to understand what is working, improve, and report back to internal and external parties
Company OverviewLilo Social is a growth marketing agency focused on full-funnel marketing delivering best-in-class paid media and creative services for a wide range of eCommerce brands focused on scaling. We work across the entire life-cycle of the customer journey covering content creation, ad production, paid media, conversion rate optimization, and email/sms marketing. Select clients include Cheribundi, NYC FC, BAUER, Spcy, Bear Mountain BBQ, and Toynk.
companyDescription: A Full-Funnel Ecommerce Agency

jobDescription:
At Beautycounter, we go beyond clean to get safer beauty into the hands of everyone. Launched in 2013 as a direct-to-consumer beauty brand and acquired by the Carlyle Group in April 2021, we develop and distribute roughly 100 beauty products across skin care, makeup, and personal care, serving both the United States and Canada.
In addition to our Never List™, which excludes over 1,800 questionable ingredients from our formulations, we’ve established a rigorous set of safety standards for both our products and our manufacturing partners. And, through our advocacy efforts, we’ve helped introduce more health-protective legislation to the beauty industry.
Beautycounter is proud to be a Certified B Corporation that’s committed to more sustainable packaging, responsible sourcing, and a policy of total transparency. Awards include Fast Company's Most Innovative, Allure's Best of Beauty, Glamour's Beauty Awards, Refinery29's Innovators List, WWD's 2019 Best-Performing Beauty Company, and CNBC's Disruptor 50.
As a Manager, Influencer & User-Generated Content (UGC), you will play a critical role in executing our brand's influencer and UGC strategy, while leveraging your strong knowledge of social media ( in Beauty) and the digital landscape to maximize impact. You will report to the VP of PR & Integrated Communications and work closely with cross-functional teams to build and maintain relationships with key influencers from our community and for our community, curate and publish UGC, and measure the success of campaigns and initiatives.
In This Role You Will
Propose & execute a comprehensive influencer and UGC strategy that supports our brand's overall marketing, mission and communications goals.Identify and engage with key influencers in our target audience, build and maintain strong relationships with them, and negotiate influencer partnerships and campaigns.Curate, in partnership with the social team, UGC across our social media channels and other digital platforms.Manage influencer and UGC campaigns from start to finish, including briefing influencers, tracking deliverables, and analyzing performance data.Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, creative, and communications, to ensure cohesive and effective execution of influencer and UGC initiatives.Stay up-to-date on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to influencer marketing and UGC.Develop and implement influencer and UGC metrics and KPIs to measure the success of campaigns and initiatives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.5+ years of experience in influencer marketing and/or UGC, with a proven track record of success in executing effective campaigns and initiatives – ideally in Beauty.Strong understanding of social media and the digital landscape, including influencer platforms, content creation tools, and measurement technologies.Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills, with the ability to effectively engage with key influencers and cross-functional teams.Strong analytical skills, with the ability to use data to drive strategic decisions and optimize campaign performance.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to diverse audiences.Proven project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Pay: $68,000 - $110,000 for work locations in the United States, with individual pay determined by several factors including, but not limited to, job-related skills, experience, education, and training. Salary ranges are determined in good faith by role, level, and location. As a remote-eligible job, a narrower salary range for a candidate's preferred location may be available.
Bonus: Additional compensation includes an annual discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance.
Benefits At Beautycounter
Medical, dental, vision insurance effective the 1st of the month following hire dateBc paid and supplemental life and AD&D insuranceBc contribution to HSA plan (if enrolled in HSA compatible plan)Healthcare and dependent care FSAHealth & Wellness support for all employees (at no cost!) through Modern Health401(k) plan with company match following 90 days of employmentUnlimited Vacation for Exempt Associates (or 15 days Paid Time Off for Non-Exempt Associates)14 Company Paid Holidays per year20 hours of Paid Volunteer Time off per year

jobDescription:
About the Company:Power Digital is a leading, data-driven marketing company that is nationally recognized for its ability to combine the best of art and science. As a full-service firm, the company offers best-in-class services including: SEO, Content Marketing, Paid Media, Social Media Marketing, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Email + SMS, Conversion Rate Optimization, Amazon Marketing, Creative, and Web Development. Power Digital is hyper-focused on helping brands scale revenue and increase profits by using data and analytics to guide strategy, ultimately driving irrefutable value for clients. Unique to Power Digital is their proprietary, machine-learning platform SPRnova™ that can analyze any business’s growth opportunities with a corresponding roadmap of how to execute and track progress across every marketing channel. Leveraging their team of the nation’s leading consumer strategists, creatives and data scientists, Power Digital provides scalable and tangible marketing solutions for each stage of the funnel and for every milestone of the consumer journey.
About the Role: 
Freelance Casting Coordinator (Content Creators)
Job Summary of the Role
The Casting Coordinator will cast content creators and manage the delivery of video and photos for Power Digital Marketing’s creative team. They are required to have a robust knowledge of digital casting processes, an understanding of what makes a good performer, and exceptional organizational skills.
The Casting Coordinator will work directly with Producers and Production Coordinators to ensure the right content creators are considered and cast by posting casting calls, communicating and liaising with talent, and proposing previously-hired performers.
This role largely entails casting remote content creators to record UGC footage for use in paid media by using our internal employee network, TikTok Creator Marketplace, and services such as Backstage, Casting Network, Boast.io and Billo. For this responsibility, the capacity to communicate and identify basic video production skills such as proper lighting, camera coverage, and appropriate art direction is essential.
ResponsibilitiesOversee the casting of content creators for remote productions.Work closely with producers to find the right talent for each remote production.Draft and post casting calls on online platforms such as Backstage, Casting Networks, Facebook and Craigslist.Act as a liaison between talent and production stakeholders.Lead the sourcing of remote content creators.Use platforms such as Boast.io, Billo, TikTok Creator Marketplace, social media outreach and our internal database to cast content creators.Communicate between content creators and producers to make sure the right footage is produced on time for each ad set.Collect, organize and maintain talent paperwork and releases in our database.Collect reviews and data from directors and producers to keep track of how well talent performs and how they influence the effectiveness of the content they’re featured in.
Requirements 2+ years of casting experience with an agency, media, TV network, or production company.
QualificationsUnderstanding of professional casting processes, payment scopes, contracts and project coordination.Strong eye for what makes a performer compelling and the ability to cast one that conforms to specific brand guidelines.Have a pulse on trends in social media and the talent that perform well on them.Experience casting outside the typical content creator, ie “real people”, VO artists, micro-influencers, small businesses, families, children, animals, etc.Be a self-starter with exceptional organizational skills.Basic understanding of good UGC video production skills such as proper lighting choices, camera coverage, and art direction.

Power Digital’s people and culture are at the core of our success, which is why diversity in our team’s backgrounds and experiences are paramount. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences, and backgrounds, who strive to make an impact inside and outside of the workplace. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one’s identity. All of our employees' points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.
companyDescription:
Power Digital is a growth marketing firm fueled by technology and driven by a talented team of consultative marketers, creatives, analysts and technologists. We ignite revenue growth and brand recognition for leading and emerging brands around the world.

Marketing is no longer about a singular offer or what your brand presents visually. It’s a sprawling journey with countless touch points. 

Consumers shop with their values and gravitate towards brands they trust. They want to be a part of a tribe. A story. What’s more, the path to purchase needs to be fast, frictionless and personable.

The media landscape is vastly different, too. Measurement is smarter but also harder than ever. 

Marketing should be a strategic business driver, a road that leads to profitable revenue growth and brand lift.

We take the guesswork out of marketing, making the most from your investment so you get what you really care about: growth, handled from planning to execution.

Our experienced team develops custom marketing playbooks fueled by your data, market trends and industry insights to set you apart from the competition, designed to drive revenue and brand lift.

Our proprietary technology, nova, analyzes a company’s digital ecosystem using multiple first-party data sources to build informed and custom marketing plans. And, nova de-risks investments by optimizing capital allocation––putting marketers, operators and the investment community in a strategic seat at the table.

When you know the customer journey, singular channels don’t matter because you’re building a strategic program. That’s what we are in the business of: igniting growth and brand recognition for the brands we are lucky to call our clients.

jobDescription:
At Beautycounter, we go beyond clean to get safer beauty into the hands of everyone. Launched in 2013 as a direct-to-consumer beauty brand and acquired by the Carlyle Group in April 2021, we develop and distribute roughly 100 beauty products across skin care, makeup, and personal care, serving both the United States and Canada.
In addition to our Never List™, which excludes over 1,800 questionable ingredients from our formulations, we’ve established a rigorous set of safety standards for both our products and our manufacturing partners. And, through our advocacy efforts, we’ve helped introduce more health-protective legislation to the beauty industry.
Beautycounter is proud to be a Certified B Corporation that’s committed to more sustainable packaging, responsible sourcing, and a policy of total transparency. Awards include Fast Company's Most Innovative, Allure's Best of Beauty, Glamour's Beauty Awards, Refinery29's Innovators List, WWD's 2019 Best-Performing Beauty Company, and CNBC's Disruptor 50.
Join our team as the Director of Social (organic) and drive visionary brand storytelling that captivates and engages our existing audience and new audiences! We are seeking a seasoned social media expert with a passion for beauty brands and a proven track record of success in integrated marketing. In this key role within the Marketing organization, you will lead the charge in defining strategy, executing cross-functional initiatives, and monitoring performance against KPIs in social media.
You have a natural talent for bringing brands to life and obsessed for innovation on social channels, staying ahead of the curve with new trends and platforms that are authentic to the Beautycounter brand.
In This Role You Will
Define and implement the vision and strategy for Organic Social, specifically Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.Create and execute innovative marketing initiatives that drive brand love and meet business objectivesWork in lock steps with paid media team to ensure a 360-degree approach to marketingServe as a thought leader and work closely with internal teams including creative, product, e-commerce, and digitalDrive growth, engagement, and performance through social mediaStay ahead of the curve by monitoring new trends and testing emerging platformsOversee content pillars and content calendar Bring our brand and mission to life through native channel/ platform strategy & assetsBe a key partner to the Communications team on the influencer and UGC strategy and content implementationsManage and mentor a talented team of marketers who bring the vision to lifeConduct market and industry research to inform social media strategiesDevelop and manage social media budgets, resources and timelinesReport and analyze social media performance and make recommendations for optimization
Qualifications
10+ years of experience in integrated marketing with a focus on Organic socialA passion for beauty brands and the digital/social landscape, including emerging platformsExpertise in managing social media on platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTubeA natural ability to use data, intuition, and creativity to make business decisionsForward-thinking with a trend-hunting mindsetExcellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skillsStrong collaborator and team playerAbility to manage multiple teams and juggle multiple projects and priorities with ease
Pay: $121,000 - $143,000 for work locations in the United States, with individual pay determined by several factors including, but not limited to, job-related skills, experience, education, and training. jobDescription:
Do you love developing native UGC-style content for TikTok, Facebook & Instagram?
Are you on the cutting edge of what's trending in the world of social media content?
Future Kontent seeks a superstar to lead Creative Strategy for our Ecommerce clients.
A day in the life of a Creative Strategist:Meet with the advertising team weekly to gather insight on what ad creative, hooks & headlines are driving salesCollaborate with creators to give direction for developing the next round of UGC assetsAnalyze the ad creative data with clients to determine strategies to improve ad creative performanceDevelop creative briefs for creators to produce new assetsMeet with clients weekly to discuss new ad creative concepts & ideasManage the client relationship to a high-level of customer satisfaction
This opportunity might be for you if you:You are a creator yourself and/or have experience developing UGC creative for brandsHave account management experience in the digital marketing industryWere previously a media buyer or Creative Strategist for an agency or brandHave experience creating video content for TikTok, Facebook & Instagram AdsYou love all things social mediaYou have experience with Tiktok, Facebook or Instagram Ad CreativeHave an average to above average understanding of Tiktok Ads, Facebook Ads or Instagram AdsYou consider yourself to be very creativeYou consider copywriting to be a strengthHave experience managing / working with social media creators / influencersWant the ability to work remoteYou desire a strong culture fit + team dynamic that is fun to be aroundAre persistent, organized and a go-getter
If this sounds like you…
The Creative Strategist role with Future Kontent is going to expose to the rapidly-developing world of digital marketing with clients spending 6-figure budgets on Tiktok and Facebook Ads.
Your technical know-how of offers, ads, funnels and compelling content is sure to 10X in just a short amount of time.
Compensation Details:Employment Type: Contract (1099)Contract Type: SalaryCompensation Range: $40k to $50kFull-TimeBenefits: Health Insurance (After 90 days)Paid Time Off: 19 days with holidays & sick time
About Future KontentFuture Kontent offers groundbreaking UGC creative solutions for brands & agencies that achieve massive results in a metric that you care about most: real customers.
We primarily work with brands in the Ecommerce niche who are positioned in the Health & Wellness, Apparel & Fashion and Personal Care industry and have a 7-year plus track record of results.
https://futurekontent.com/
