jobDescription:
At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.
Do you dare to make an impact?
 Your Role
We are looking for a talented Social Media and Content Manager to work across all Henkel Consumer Brands contributing to the social media strategy and development of digital content for our owned channels. The Manager will lead the organic social media strategy and collaborate with Brand Marketing on the influencer marketing strategy that is aligned to our overall digital strategy and maturity. The Manager will regularly assess our channels to identify content gaps where new content can enhance the consumer experience as well as working with existing content from various internal and external sources to modify for our various owned channels including the website and social accounts. We are seeking an individual that has the skills to create and maintain a strong digital presence for our beauty and laundry and home care brands and grow online communities of brand fans, current customers and new consumers. In the role, you will be responsible for implementing social media and influencer strategies and content through social media accounts. You will manage various digital platforms that encourage consumer engagement and play a role in the consumer decision journey: Awareness, Consideration, Conversion and Loyalty. You will manage the relationship with external social media agencies of record and collaborate with all cross-functional partners to drive key social media KPIS.
Manage organic social media content development across all active social media channels by briefing the agencies on business objectives, product priorities, key category and culture trends and content which will drive top engagement.Collaborate with the social media agency and Global SMU teams to develop the annual and long-term channel strategy that meets the needs of the brand’s awareness goals and matches the resources available between internal and external teams.Oversee the agencies that manage Community Management across all channels to ensure the brands are attentive and responsive to fans, followers and customers and communicate with helpful and engaging responses. Partner with Customer Service to ensure all customer service-related inquiries are being addressed by the internal team in a timely manner.Collaborate with the Brand Marketing team to develop campaign content for Paid Social Campaigns and identify KPIs that may require the implementation of digital tools for engagement or conversion.Collaborate with Brand Marketing and IAT agencies on Influencer Marketing programs providing recommendations for content themes, content trends and analytics on best performing content across brand channels. Review influencer content for execution that meets the brand equity, brand tagging and strategic linking to owned channels or retailers.Manage the social media agencies in providing monthly content and channel analytics that share performance, insights, content recommendations and opportunities for improvement to meet KPIs.Play a key role in all IAT strategy and meetings as part of the Advanced Capabilities team representing social media.Aligning and collaborating with Global counterparts on strategic priorities, campaign development and opportunities for efficiency in product and campaign photo shoots to meet US content needs.Lead the partnership with Bazaarvoice to oversee the Ratings & Reviews for all Beauty brands and manage the product catalog within the system to ensure proper syndication. Partner with Brand Marketing in Beauty to execute efficient consumer sampling programs to drive trial, UGC and ratings and reviews.Accountable for a clearly defined organic social and channel strategy.Contribute to the selection of influencers across brands that will develop content for brand campaigns and ensure content follows all Henkel brand guidelines and legal requirements.Oversee Community Management excellence and share all learnings with internal and external teams for awareness and opportunities to meet brand objectives.Daily contact for all Social Media agencies of record.Management of Ratings & Reviews program for Beauty Brands and make recommendations for ongoing consumer sampling to support product performance.Identify content opportunities that contribute to consumer education and consideration and follow best practices for the channel.

 YOUR SKILLS
Bachelor’s Degree in Digital Marketing, Communications or related field, with 5-8 years of CPG experience within Social Media, Brand Communications, or a related Digital Marketing function.Ability to analyze data and make sound recommendations that effect the Social Media KPIs as well as the total business.Ability to discover current trends and respond to cultural moments appropriately and efficiently.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, like marketing, media, digital marketing, sales, global SMU, consumer call center and all agency partners to ensure brand consistency. Experience in CPG and better yet the Beauty category is preferred, especially with knowledge of the Hair or Body product categories.
The salary for this role is $89,000.00 - $131,700.00. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range. This salary range may also be modified in the future.
Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.
Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.
All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.
companyDescription:
Henkel operates worldwide with leading innovations, brands and technologies in two business areas: Adhesive Technologies and Consumer Brands.

Founded in 1876, Henkel looks back on more than 145 years of success. The company holds leading positions with its two business units in both industrial and consumer businesses thanks to strong brands, innovations and technologies such as Persil, Schwarzkopf and Loctite. Henkel, headquartered in Düsseldorf / Germany, counts among the most internationally aligned German-based companies in the global marketplace.

Our company purpose expresses what unites us all at Henkel: Pioneers at heart for the good of generations. We are a diverse team of more than 50,000 colleagues worldwide, striving to enrich and improve life every day through our products, services, and solutions. Our Purpose is built from our roots and carries a long-standing legacy of innovation, responsibility, and sustainability into the future. Our shared values and Leadership Commitments guide our decisions and actions every day.

Imprint: http://www.henkel.com/imprint
Data Privacy: https://www.henkel.com/data-protection-statement-social-media

jobDescription:
Who We AreBabylist is the leading vertical marketplace and commerce destination for baby, driving purchase decisions for more than 8 million people each year. Utilizing robust proprietary data, patented technology, and unbiased editorial guidance, Babylist recommends expert-tested products to those starting their parenting journey so loved ones can offer their support. Babylist registries connect new parents and their community of family and friends who help plan, prepare, and shop for a child's arrival. Babylist is the generational brand in baby, leading the $67 billion baby products market as the trusted go-to solution for growing families. To learn about Babylist’s registry options, editorial content, and more, visit www.babylist.com.
Our Ways of WorkingWe have team members located across the United States spanning multiple time zones. This means we put in extra effort to make sure we connect and collaborate in ways that make sense for us. We know how valuable the flexibility of remote work is for our employees. Due to the nature of this role, we would expect someone to be onsite in our Los Angeles location 2-3 times per week to host influencers and celebrities, as well as to create social content.
We know that personal connection is the foundation for the great work we do together. In order to build those relationships with team members in other cities, we meet with coworkers in person two times a year at a full company offsite and a departmental offsite. These are great opportunities to meet the people you work with every day and to do some of the work that is much more difficult to do virtually.
What the Role IsBabylist’s social media work is already winning awards and recognized by media. We’re doing great work and looking to do even more- especially in the areas of Instagram and partnering with influencers and celebrities. This role will lead Babylist’s upper-funnel marketing via social media to drive brand awareness. Reporting to the Senior Manager of PR & Communications, you will have an immediate impact in a highly visible and rewarding role. You will own influencer and celebrity marketing, drive UGC, develop creative social campaigns, and spearhead social growth. This is an opportunity to be creative, take risks, try new ideas, and make big things happen.
Our Social Media Manager must reside in the greater Los Angeles area, and will work 2-3 days per week from our location in Los Angeles.
Who You AreYou have at least 5-8 years of experience focused on social media managementYou’ve led strategy and content for major B2C social media accounts (500k+ followers), and have a proven record driving follower and engagement growthYou have a history of building relationships and hosting celebrities and influencers, driving ROIYou have proven success in driving high quantities of social media brand mentionsYou’re on top of pop culture and trends, understanding what appeals to people (and algorithms)You’re a content creation wiz, including Reels and TikTok videosYou’re a storyteller who can captivate and engage an audienceYou think outside the boxYou have a knack for evaluating social media analytics and adapting strategies and tactics based on insightsUnderstand and love our usersYou are successful at managing and optimizing a paid social media budget
How You Will Make an ImpactYou will be a crucial part of ensuring Babylist is the #1 most followed brand in babyYou will identify, negotiate with, and host influencers and celebritiesYou will own the strategy for encouraging and tracking user mentions on social, including social listeningYou will concept and plan owned IG and TikTok campaigns to drive UGC, followers, and engagement, including giveaways, work with partners, promoting events, and moreYou will develop original short-form social media videosYou will exponentially drive growth on Instagram, leading strategy and content, and support efforts across all other social channelsYou’ll track and measure performance to guide strategic decisions
Why You Will Love Working At BabylistWe invest in the infrastructure you’ll need to be supported and successful: tools, opportunities to connect with colleagues, and a stipend to help you set up your officeWe build products that have a positive impact on millions of people’s livesWe work at a sustainable pace which means work/life balance is a real thing hereWe believe technology and data can solve hard problemsWe believe in exceptional managementWe are an antiracist organization and doing the work to support differences of all kindsWe offer competitive pay and meaningful opportunities for career advancementWe have great benefits like company paid medical, dental, and vision, a generous paid parental leave policy, and 401k with company matchWe care about employee wellbeing with perks for physical, mental and emotional health, parenting, childcare, and financial planning
Babylist takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. 
A wide range of factors are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; and other business and organizational needs. Exact starting pay will be determined based on skills and experience as well as location. We hold two compensation reviews annually to review pay for performance and market and run an equity analysis to ensure our pay practices are fair and unbiased.
A reasonable estimate for the current range in each zone is:Zone 1 $109,000-$157,000Zone 2 $99,000-$143,000Zone 3 $92,000-$134,000
These ranges may be modified in the future.
In addition to the base compensation listed above, we offer a number of other benefits as part of your total compensation at Babylist, such as:Company performance bonusMedical, dental and vision, covered at 100% for employees. Unlimited fertility coverage with no infertility diagnosis requiredPaid Life insurance, AD&D, and disability benefits Retirement savings accounts (401k) with a 3.5% company match and immediate vestingCompetitive employee stock options Up to 12 weeks of paid leave, optional additional unpaid leave, and a flexible return to work policy to welcome a new child through any of the ways to form a family, for all gendersPaid time off including 15 vacation days, 9 wellness days, and 10 paid holidaysAn initial work from home stipend to optimize your workspaceMental wellness programs, including access to four sessions with licensed providers and unlimited access to Expectful and Headspace meditation appsOther perks include Babylist store discount, childcare stipend, referral bonuses, twice-yearly in-person events with the team and more
If your experience is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.
companyDescription:
Babylist is the leading vertical marketplace and commerce destination for baby, driving purchase decisions for more than 8 million people each year. Utilizing robust proprietary data, patented technology, and unbiased editorial guidance, we recommend expert-tested products to those starting their parenting journey so loved ones can offer their support. Babylist registries connect new parents and their community of family and friends who help plan, prepare, and shop for a child's arrival. 

Founder Natalie Gordon started Babylist in 2011 when she was pregnant with her first child after realizing the limitations of existing baby registry options. She launched it two weeks before her son was born. What began as a side project has become the generational brand in baby, leading the $67 billion baby products market as the trusted go-to solution for growing families. 

See for yourself at www.babylist.com.  

You can also see a list of open positions at www.babylist.com/jobs.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity
Our Affiliate and Influencer team is on the search for a customer and business-oriented marketer to join our team. Our everyday priority is to ensure our influencer partners, our vendor partners, and our internal partners are supported in our efforts to build lasting and happy relationships with each other, and most importantly our customers. Our Zulily corporate headquarters is in Seattle, WA. You will report to the Manager of Group Customer Marketing and be a hybrid role.
Who We Are
Zulily is an online superstore committed to delivering a fun shopping experience for moms everywhere, without breaking the bank. Through exclusive daily deals, brand names and on-trend styles, and everyday value on a wide selection of daily essentials across clothing, footwear, homewares and more, Zulily helps moms discover great deals, create special moments for the family, and find the perfect unique items, guilt-free. At Zulily, shopping is a little different, a little better, and a lot more fun.
As part of Zulily's Influencer Marketing Team, this Senior Marketing Partner, Affiliates and Influencers will be a part owner of our influencer marketing strategy and execution or regular efforts. You will be a main contact for new Influencers in our program. Their role is to recruit, engage, monitor, train, and report on influencers in our program and develop them into long lasting, engaging, and fiscally viable partnerships. These partnerships will grow customer engagement through social media outlets to build our customers and brand recognition. You will partner with Merchandising, Analytics, Technology, and the broader Marketing organization.
Your Impact 
Recruit new influencer partnerships to grow our goalsEngage with influencers daily as their main support contactMonitor influencer's metrics to provide feedback and improve their performanceTrain influencer and help develop training material to cultivate a program of progressProvide insight into the current activities and observations of other programsMaintain, and spend within, an annual offers budget for a given set of customer groupsDemonstrate a testing mindset to improve how we communicate and activate influencersPartner with Tech teams to improve tools and functionalityPartner with the Creative team to develop engaging concepts and UGC for internal requestsOther ad hoc projects as determined by the marketing leadership team
What You Bring
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, PR or other related fieldMinimum 2 year of related experience or comparable educational backgroundExperience in targeted offers strategy, eCommerce or Lifecycle MarketingExperience with SQL and/or managing large data setsUnderstanding of MS excel (can perform complex functions)Experience analyzing data to make decisions
Remote work is not permitted in NYC at this time
Salary: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00
Join us as we enrich life’s everyday moments – including yours. Apply today! 
If you enjoy being a part of a team, creating experiences and delighting customers, you’ll love it here. If you’re excited about retail, fashion, media, social, live streaming, technology, customer service, design and more, you’ll find amazing projects to work on. If you want to grow professionally and learn every day, you’ll thrive with us. If you appreciate flexible working options, our Qurated community, where intentional connections matter and a company committed to diversity, equity and inclusion, you’ll be amazed at what’s available for our team members! We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package including competitive compensation, health care benefits starting on day 1, 401(k), paid time off, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance program, parental leave, paid volunteer hours, company discounts and much more. Best of all, working with Qurate Retail Group means friendly teams, ambitious projects and fast-moving careers!
For Qurate Retail Group, our focus on diversity, equity and inclusion is deeply rooted in Our Principles. They call on us to Drive Progress, Act With Empathy, Be Brave, Embrace the Future, and Do What’s Right so that everyone can thrive. We are committed to ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, Qurate Retail Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at workwithus@qurateretail.com for assistance.
Click Apply and log in with your existing account or create an account. This will allow you to check the status of your application at any time and receive the most up to date communications from our Talent Acquisition team.
companyDescription:
Zulily was founded on a common spirit of scrappiness, creativity, collaboration, and quirk. From our very beginnings, moms have been the center of our universe. And, our aim has been to deliver the best online shopping experience for them. 
 
With exclusive daily deals, brand names and on-trend styles, and everyday value on a wide selection for all occasions, Zulily is an online superstore for moms that gives them permission to go fun shopping without breaking the bank.

jobDescription:
About the Agency: We’re a full-service creative agency born out of ATTN:’s purpose-driven mission to bring attention to the things that matter. We exist to help brands find their lane in culture and connect with audiences to drive action and meaningful change through advertising, entertainment and experiences. We are a diverse group of entrepreneurial spirits, creative minds and makers. We’re lucky enough to work with some of the world’s most innovative brands including Google, Spotify, TikTok and Amazon
About the Position:We are looking for a rockstar Social Strategist to join our rapidly growing team. This person will be responsible for developing strategies and communications plans across a number of channels, focusing primarily on TikTok but supporting others like Meta, YouTube, and Twitter. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker who has an understanding of both paid/organic strategy & channel planning, and can develop strategic insights and briefs to bring content to life. This person will oversee a community manager and report to the Social Strategy Director, working closely with internal creative and account teams to plan, execute and report on campaign performance. While you’re a social expert, the ideal candidate also knows enough about other channels (OLV, streaming audio, etc.) to be dangerous.
Core Responsibilities: Act as a thought leader and social expert for internal and client teams, with a specific emphasis on organic TikTokInform campaign planning projects from inception to completion, developing strategy decks that are inspired by brand objectives, audience insights and competitive landscapeDevelop campaign briefs, collaborating with creative to inspire content and guide with best practicesCraft communication frameworks, channel recommendations, content ecosystems, and go-to market strategies for a variety of different campaigns (organic and paid) on and off social mediaOversee and give constructive POVs when it comes to UGC practices across social platformsDevelop playbooks and POVs to inform how brands should come to life across social media, with a focus on TikTokStay up to date on trends, culture, and social media platforms, translating them into actionable, data-supported recommendations or creative opportunitiesParticipate in regular creative and strategy team brainstorming sessions to ensure best practices for platform are taken into account in creative content productionCollaborate with analytic teams to track and communicate measurement/performance with wider team and support the implementation of new practices informed by learningsWork with analytics teams to translate performance data into actionable insights for our clientsHelp inform and educate clients when it comes to platform specific best practices (including music/trending sounds, influencer strategy, new product features, etc.)Guide the development and publishing of high-quality content across social platforms with a focus on TikTok and Meta.Oversee and manage community manager when it comes to process as well as day-to-day responsibilitiesWork with account and client teams, and continue to see the project through across all its subsequent phases
Who You Are:4+ years of professional Creative Agency experience in briefing creative teams, creating and implementing social media strategies (organic and paid), understanding audiences, and executing communications plansMust possess demonstrated success at growing and engaging social media audiencesExcel at creating and implementing a successful social strategy for a variety of social platforms, with a focus on TikTokPracticed in briefing creative teams with an ability to mine for insights and trends–inspiring creative teams and clients to do big thingsAble to think from multicultural perspective–understanding the importance of acknowledging different lived experiences and incorporating them into your workSelf-starter with attention to detail and ability to work across multiple projects at oncePassion for great storytelling that is related to Gen Z and Millennial audiencesAble to partner closely with Client Services and Creative leads to define the vision and tone of the brand’s presence across Experience using social listening and reporting tools and ability to cull insights from data from online/social sources to inform creative Strong understanding of key performance drivers and ability to execute against findingsStrong interpersonal skills are required, and the ability to effectively interact with individuals across all levels, backgrounds and perspectivesComfortable presenting and providing strategic guidance to client teams
companyDescription: ATTN: is a media company, production studio, and creative agency that offers best-in-class storytelling, audience insights, and social video. We call attention to the inspiring, the innovative, and the untold, through meaningful stories with macro impact.

jobDescription:
Job details:Salary $25 - $50 an hour or $50 - $100 per video
Job Type – UGC content creator 
Qualifications: Creator with 2 years of UGC content creation. 
We are Pennakool and we are an Ecommerce private label brand that focuses on kitchen gadget products. Our main sales channel is Amazon US.
We are looking for positive, reliable, creative and outgoing candidates who can provide great work and value to our company. We are going to be adding a bunch of new products and want to be able to have some UGC creators we can grow with and count on for consistent content. BEFORE YOU APPLY
1) Must be able to provide samples of your work and provide links to your socials. 
2) Looking for highly engaged and medium sized audiences and above – 50,000 plus followers and 3% plus engagement rates on TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, Amazon Live and other platforms.
3) Preferably, you should have experience in video editing, professional film locations, script writing, product promotion and an understanding of the Amazon seller landscape. 
4) This would be remote work from home. 
5) We offer a safe, accepting and flexible work environment. We want you to feel passionate about producing content and not forced. Creativity and quality can’t be forced. 
6) Experience with big known brands is highly encouraged. 
7) We will pay you when we need content. This is a temporary job, but could turn into consistent work. 
8) Being able to repurpose content on multiple platforms is a plus. 
A big deciding factor of being accepted is your portfolio of work.
companyDescription: Pennakool is a privately held import eCommerce private label brand that sells primarily online.

jobDescription:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $40 – $50/hrESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term

THE OPPORTUNITY
This hybrid role must be available to work out of Brooklyn office as needed (minimum 1x per week) 

Our client is seeking a Social Video Editor to support their global social video efforts, with a special focus on vertical video formats such as TikTok, Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts.

The Social Video Editor will work under the direction of their Sr. Manager, Social Video Lead to edit short form content from a variety of sources including seller creators, content creators, influencers, and UGC content that will help to define our client’s social voice across multiple channels and markets.

Availability

40 hours per week

12 month contract, with potential to extend

Qualifications

The Social Video Editor will be responsible for: 
Working with channel owners (Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, international teams) to edit social video content for distributionEdit multiple video formats including scripted and unscripted content from raw footage to final product in a way that is native to the intended platformManage multiple projects on tight and shifting deadlines, as well as multiple feedback rounds with notes from social channel owners and outside teamsKeeping up with latest platform video and cultural trends to ensure shows up authentically to each platform, including optimizing content for different platformsMaintaining the integrity of the brand, ensuring that their content is uplifting and inspiring to sellers and buyers alike, amplifying our client’s mission of keeping commerce human

The Social Video Editor will demonstrate:
2+ years of experience editing social media video for a large brand or publisherAn innate knowledge of the ways in which social video content comes to life and how it is different from traditional video formatsDeep knowledge of the social video landscape and social trends, possess a keen awareness of the difference between successful consumer and brand contentPassion about supporting small businesses, creativity and craftsmanship and care deeply about building the brand for key audiencesUnderstanding of in-platform editing and creation tools on social platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube

To be successful in this role, the Social Video Editor, will:
Work closely and collaboratively with multiple stakeholders across the organization, both inside and outside of the social media team. Able to balance multiple projects and priorities, while acting nimbly to support emerging trends and opportunitiesWork with Sr. Manager, Social Video Lead, to help scale video production across our client’s social media team

Apply Now!

Braintrust Job ID: 6250

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
companyDescription:
Braintrust is the first decentralized Web3 talent network that connects skilled, vetted knowledge workers with the world’s leading companies. The community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it, ensuring the network always serves the needs of its users, instead of a centrally-controlled corporation. And because the community of knowledge workers and contributors earns ownership and control of Braintrust through its native BTRST token for their contributions to the network and its growth, new Talent and jobs have participated in the network at record speeds. 

Braintrust has over 700,000+ community members, with knowledge workers and project contributors across the world. Braintrust is trusted by hundreds of Fortune 1000 global enterprises including Nestlé, Porsche, Atlassian, Goldman Sachs, and Nike. For more information, visit: www.braintrust.com.

BTRST is available on Coinbase.com and in the Coinbase Android and iOS apps. Coinbase customers can trade, send, receive, or store BTRST in most Coinbase-supported regions. For more information on Braintrust and the BTRST token, read the “Braintrust: The Decentralized Talent Network” whitepaper.

jobDescription:
Summary
The Director of Digital Communications is a creative and strategic leader, responsible for developing and executing Workiva’s digital communications strategy. This leader understands content integration and leverages insights to create campaigns that promote Workiva, its brand, its innovative solutions and its thought leaders across multiple channels. As an essential member of the Global Communications Department, the Director of Digital Communications will integrate digital content such as social media into the Company’s overarching marketing and communications strategies to help drive stakeholder engagement and business growth.
Responsibilities
Develop an earned, owned and paid communications content strategy across multiple platforms and channels and lead execution through creative development, targeting and production.Work in partnership with the communications and marketing teams to manage Workiva’s digital reputation and brand as well as to ensure alignment with the overarching narrative, goals and execution.Identify new capabilities to improve content performance and regularly educate the team on digital trends that are pertinent to our business (i.e. algorithm changes, mobile update implications, competitor campaigns)Assist in creating copy for a variety of multimedia content; including web-based articles, emails, social posts, videos and podcasts.Help make content successful by working with other teams to promote content, optimize conversion paths, and build links.Set measurable objectives and key performance indicators based on business needsPlan for and lead the development of organic social media campaigns by overseeing the day-to-day management of social media communities, adhering to the overarching communications strategy, social strategy and best practice, and tone of voice.Manage ongoing optimization of the social strategy, playbook, community management, content creation and UGC to improve delivery and enhance results.Assess campaign performance, measuring against campaign goals (ROI and KPIs), and helping teams optimize via insightful actions and recommendations for further impact.Develop, optimize, and maintain paid social advertising campaigns, including coordination of assets between agencies and internal teams and budget management.
What You'll Need
Education
Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field.
Experience
10+ years of experience in digital media, marketing, or digital communications
Skills
Successful track record of developing and executing large, cross-channel digital communication activations with measurable results.Deep understanding of content strategy, social media platforms and their respective audiences and deployment scenarios, as well as each platform’s business standards and best practices.Proven experience with editorial SEO and creating content that ranks and converts, both written and video.Proven results building social followings that drive demandDemonstrated passion for driving big, creative ideas that drive Workiva’s business and platform strategy, and award-winning culture.Strong interpersonal skills demonstrated through working cross-functionally with key global stakeholders to achieve stated goals.Ability to simultaneously manage, coordinate, and execute a number of complex projects within stringent timelines and budget parameters.Big picture thinker who is passionate about storytelling.Strong written and verbal communication skills
Travel
Less than 10%
Working Conditions & Physical Requirements
Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.
How You’ll Be Rewarded:
Salary range in the US: 

$173,000.00 - $235,000.00 Annually
A discretionary bonus typically paid annuallyRestricted Stock Units granted at time of hire401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package
The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
Customer Success: Always delight our customers.Trust: Rely on each other. Integrity: Do the right thing, every time. Collaboration: Share resources and work together. Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways. Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong. Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.
We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:
Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and moreWork-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.
Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits:  https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits
Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.
companyDescription:
Workiva’s mission is to power transparent reporting for a better world. We believe that consumers, employees, shareholders, and other stakeholders today expect more from business – more action, transparency, and disclosure of financial and non-financial information. We build solutions to meet that demand and streamline processes, connect data and teams, and ensure consistency – all within a controlled, secure, audit-ready cloud platform. 

Workiva delivers the world’s leading cloud platform for regulatory, financial and environmental, social and governance (“ESG”) reporting. Workiva provides more than 4,300 organizations with software-as-a-service solutions to help solve some of the most complex reporting and disclosure challenges. People all over the world use our connected, cloud platform to seamlessly enable collaboration and deep integration into existing work streams to simplify their most complex reporting challenges.

jobDescription:
At Five Below our growth is a result of the people who embrace our purpose: We know life is way better when you are free to Let Go & Have Fun in an amazing experience, filled with unlimited possibilities, priced so low, you can always say yes to the newest, coolest stuff! Just ask any of our over 17,000 associates who work at Five Below and they’ll tell you there’s no other place like it. It all starts with our purpose and then, The Five Below Way, which is our values and behaviors that each and every associate believes in.
It’s all about culture at Five Below, making this a place that can inspire you as much as you inspire us with big ideas, super energy, passion, and the ability to make the workplace a WOWplace!
Five Below Summer Internship Program is ON! Our limited open positions for Summer 2022 focus on company strategic initiatives in the exciting environment of value driven, fun-focused retail. We are seeking energetic, responsible go-getters with innovative ideas, ready to actively participate in company initiatives.
We LOVE our interns! Our internship is curated to deliver a rich learning experience for both personal and professional growth. Our program is hands on, participating in meaningful work that directly effects the company’s success. You are an active contributor and valued as a part of your team!
This intern will play a valuable role in helping the digital marketing social team to ideate, elevate and dive deeper into our organic social platforms and strengthen brand awareness. They will get hands on experience in reporting, facilitating engaging content and managing social platforms.
Responsibilities include:
Stay up to date on new social media tools and best practices; monitor competitors and report on happenings Assist with influencer research and relationships Assist with content ideas and tapping into trends Analyze social performance Monitor listening tools Community Management – responding to fans comments, PMs/DMs Research and evaluate emerging platforms and content trends to take our engagement strategy to the next level Collect UGC for use on Five Below social platforms Assist with influencer and fan gifting/send outs 
Location: 
In conjunction with WoWToWN’s current Ways of Working in a world that looks a bit different, we intend to offer a hybrid program for our interns, ensuring both a flexible and immersive experience. Understand that some roles may require on sight participation due to the nature of the role, such as ShipCenters.
Internship Details:
10 weeks: June 5th – August 11th Full time – 40 hours/wk Paid – $15/hrWoWToWN based roles: Greater Philadelphia location – on site/office requirements vary by internship position but should be generally considered hybrid. ShipCenter based roles: Areas surrounding each location, on site programHands on, results driven projects. No coffee fetching here! Strategic Project focused, coupled with day-to-day responsibilities
Highlights:
Interactive experiences with Senior Leadership TeamProfessional Development SessionsLunch & LearnsInsight and participation into companywide initiativesHigh exposure/small group100% intern satisfaction rateHigh intern conversion rate! (On average, we hire 2-3 of our intern alumni each year)And of course – some fun product!
Requirements:
Must be actively enrolled as a Sophomore – Senior in a relevant Bachelor’s program. Minimum 3.0 GPAMust be comfortable with Microsoft Office products & remote meeting softwareMust have availability for the full 10-week program as space is limitedMust be a self-starter, highly passionate & detail orientedActive ability to problem solve & communicate effectively 
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Five Below is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Position Type: 
Hourly
BE AWARE OF FRAUD! Please be aware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiter activity by persons that are posing as a Five Below recruiters. Please confirm that the person you are working with has an @fivebelow.com email address. Additionally, Five Below does NOT request financial information or payments from candidates at any point during the hiring process. If you suspect fraudulent activity, please visit Five Below’s Careers Site at www.fivebelow.com/info/careers to verify the posting.

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $40 – $50/hrESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term

THE OPPORTUNITY
This hybrid role must be available to work out of Brooklyn office as needed (minimum 1x per week) 

Our client is seeking a Social Video Editor to support their global social video efforts, with a special focus on vertical video formats such as TikTok, Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts.

The Social Video Editor will work under the direction of their Sr. Manager, Social Video Lead to edit short form content from a variety of sources including seller creators, content creators, influencers, and UGC content that will help to define our client’s social voice across multiple channels and markets.

Availability

40 hours per week

12 month contract, with potential to extend

Qualifications

The Social Video Editor will be responsible for: 
Working with channel owners (Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, international teams) to edit social video content for distributionEdit multiple video formats including scripted and unscripted content from raw footage to final product in a way that is native to the intended platformManage multiple projects on tight and shifting deadlines, as well as multiple feedback rounds with notes from social channel owners and outside teamsKeeping up with latest platform video and cultural trends to ensure shows up authentically to each platform, including optimizing content for different platformsMaintaining the integrity of the brand, ensuring that their content is uplifting and inspiring to sellers and buyers alike, amplifying our client’s mission of keeping commerce human

The Social Video Editor will demonstrate:
2+ years of experience editing social media video for a large brand or publisherAn innate knowledge of the ways in which social video content comes to life and how it is different from traditional video formatsDeep knowledge of the social video landscape and social trends, possess a keen awareness of the difference between successful consumer and brand contentPassion about supporting small businesses, creativity and craftsmanship and care deeply about building the brand for key audiencesUnderstanding of in-platform editing and creation tools on social platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube

To be successful in this role, the Social Video Editor, will:
Work closely and collaboratively with multiple stakeholders across the organization, both inside and outside of the social media team. Able to balance multiple projects and priorities, while acting nimbly to support emerging trends and opportunitiesWork with Sr. Manager, Social Video Lead, to help scale video production across our client’s social media team

Apply Now!

Braintrust Job ID: 6250

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

And because the community of knowledge workers and contributors earns ownership and control of Braintrust through its native BTRST token for their contributions to the network and its growth, new Talent and jobs have participated in the network at record speeds. 

Braintrust has over 700,000+ community members, with knowledge workers and project contributors across the world. Braintrust is trusted by hundreds of Fortune 1000 global enterprises including Nestlé, Porsche, Atlassian, Goldman Sachs, and Nike. For more information, visit: www.braintrust.com.

jobTitle: (USA) Senior Manager I, Brand Management, Ecomm
jobDescription:
Position Summary...
What you'll do...
Social Media Senior Manager
Bonobos is looking for a rockstar Social Media Sr. Manager to join our Marketing team and take our social media capabilities to the next level.
Founded on a better-fitting pair of pants and the best-in-class customer service around, Bonobos is one of the fastest growing digitally native apparel companies ever.
Reporting to the Senior Director of Brand, with close collaboration with the Creative Director and Chief Marketing Officer, the Social Media Sr. Manager will be a key member of the marketing team and will play a pivotal role in transforming the social media capabilities of Bonobos. The Social Media Sr. Manager will lead the development of Bonobos' social media strategy and in creating the blueprint for how Bonobos' branded social channels and landscape express the brand. This role will be responsible for leading strategic and tactical social media and influencer programs, with budget responsibility. You'll play a key part in defining the role of each branded social channel, content creation and development, community building, influencer management, and in integrating social with other marketing channels season after season. We have an all-hands-on-deck mentality where the sharing of ideas is encouraged. Are you ready to jump in?
What you'll do...
 Lead in the development of Bonobos' social media strategy, and in creating the blueprint for how Bonobos' branded social channels and corresponding landscape express the brand Drive brand awareness and introduce Bonobos to new audiences while building engagement and loyalty to our overall customer base. Define the role of each social media channel and corresponding audience, influencers, and ecosystems Build and develop content buckets aligned with integrated marketing channels and product focus / strategy Align key tent pole moments for the brand and develop social content calendar aligned with overall marketing and product calendar Collaborate with the Brand and Creative teams in developing brand-led content that align with creative seasonal productions but with more social-first lens Collaborate with the Brand team in defining and developing creator-led content: identifying strong creators for Bonobos that are plugged-in to brand-relevant trends and building a network of influencers to create strong content for both platforms Cultivate a robust network of micro- and nano-influencers to create UGC and amplify the brand in the social media space Build a strong foundation for community management with a focus on engaging and expanding on conversations with external audiences Define and manage social-relevant KPIs and metrics aligned with business and brand goals Manage social media budget
You...
 A positive "all-hands-on-deck" attitude and willingness to get the job done A bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications or relevant Liberal Arts field A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in Social and Brand or Integrated Marketing Demonstrated expertise in significantly increasing brand awareness, amplifying brand desirability, and building highly-engaged communities Effective management of social marketing budget across brand, product, community and influencer objectives Ability to develop, manage, and monitor KPIs aligned with business and brand strategic objectives; translate insights into actions Strong communication skills to unlock new and improved ways to message the brand and reach new audiences and move the needle through engaging content Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and strong in prioritizing across multiple projects "Live and breathe" social media - finger on the pulse of the cultural trends and always finding creative ways for the brand to engage authentically in key moments Excited and eager to take a lead role in building and transforming the social media capabilities of an exciting brand and collaborating with a strong brand and marketing team, as well as social content makers, influencer marketers and the broader community
Benefits & Perks
At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401 (k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave) parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, education assistance with college degrees for $1 a day, company discounts, military service pay, adoption expensive reimbursement, and more.
The annual salary range for this position is $100,000 - $130,000
Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Incentives.
Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:
 Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location) Stock equity incentives
Who We Are
Join Walmart and your work could help over 275 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you'll quickly find we're a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world's most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. You'll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. careers.walmart.com
Equal Opportunity Employer
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.
At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .
Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J .
The annual salary range for this position is $105,000.00-$195,000.00
Additional Compensation For Certain Positions May Also Include
 Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location) Stock equity incentives
Minimum Qualifications...
Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field and 3 years' experience in brand development and
management, developing creative briefs, marketing, or related area OR 5 years' experience in brand development and management, developing
creative briefs, marketing, or related area.
Preferred Qualifications...
Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.
Leading a cross-functional team, Managing Vendor Contracts and Relationships, Working on multi-national teams, Working with advanced functionality of Excel
Masters: Business Administration
Primary Location...
45 W. 25TH STREET FLOOR 5, NEW YORK, NY 10010-2003, United States of America
companyDescription:
Starting with a great fit and personalized experience, Bonobos gives people the confidence to express their style and personality with joy and irreverence. Launched online in 2007 with its signature line of chinos, Bonobos now offers a full wardrobe of better-fitting clothing for every body and occasion, with styles available to order online and to try on at any one of their 60+ Guideshop locations — IRL stores that deliver one-on-one service and expert fit advice. And in 2012, Bonobos expanded its distribution partnering with Nordstrom, bringing apparel into all doors nationwide and to Nordstrom.com.

Named “One of America’s Hottest Brands” by Advertising Age, and twice awarded Crain’s “Best Places to Work in New York City”, Bonobos is a name found on many impressive résumés. The Bonobos team is vibrant, collaborative, and inclusive. We value self-awareness, empathy, intellectual honesty, positive energy, and judgment, often over experience. We’ve created a culture where collaboration and communication are paramount, all while making time for fun and celebrating extraordinary efforts.

To view and apply to jobs available at Bonobos, please visit our website and job board: http://www.bonobos.com/jobs

jobDescription:
Summary
The Director of Digital Communications is a creative and strategic leader, responsible for developing and executing Workiva’s digital communications strategy. This leader understands content integration and leverages insights to create campaigns that promote Workiva, its brand, its innovative solutions and its thought leaders across multiple channels. As an essential member of the Global Communications Department, the Director of Digital Communications will integrate digital content such as social media into the Company’s overarching marketing and communications strategies to help drive stakeholder engagement and business growth.
Responsibilities
Develop an earned, owned and paid communications content strategy across multiple platforms and channels and lead execution through creative development, targeting and production.Work in partnership with the communications and marketing teams to manage Workiva’s digital reputation and brand as well as to ensure alignment with the overarching narrative, goals and execution.Identify new capabilities to improve content performance and regularly educate the team on digital trends that are pertinent to our business (i.e. algorithm changes, mobile update implications, competitor campaigns)Assist in creating copy for a variety of multimedia content; including web-based articles, emails, social posts, videos and podcasts.Help make content successful by working with other teams to promote content, optimize conversion paths, and build links.Set measurable objectives and key performance indicators based on business needsPlan for and lead the development of organic social media campaigns by overseeing the day-to-day management of social media communities, adhering to the overarching communications strategy, social strategy and best practice, and tone of voice.Manage ongoing optimization of the social strategy, playbook, community management, content creation and UGC to improve delivery and enhance results.Assess campaign performance, measuring against campaign goals (ROI and KPIs), and helping teams optimize via insightful actions and recommendations for further impact.Develop, optimize, and maintain paid social advertising campaigns, including coordination of assets between agencies and internal teams and budget management.
What You'll Need
Education
Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field.
Experience
10+ years of experience in digital media, marketing, or digital communications
Skills
Successful track record of developing and executing large, cross-channel digital communication activations with measurable results.Deep understanding of content strategy, social media platforms and their respective audiences and deployment scenarios, as well as each platform’s business standards and best practices.Proven experience with editorial SEO and creating content that ranks and converts, both written and video.Proven results building social followings that drive demandDemonstrated passion for driving big, creative ideas that drive Workiva’s business and platform strategy, and award-winning culture.Strong interpersonal skills demonstrated through working cross-functionally with key global stakeholders to achieve stated goals.Ability to simultaneously manage, coordinate, and execute a number of complex projects within stringent timelines and budget parameters.Big picture thinker who is passionate about storytelling.Strong written and verbal communication skills
Travel
Less than 10%
Working Conditions & Physical Requirements
Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.
How You’ll Be Rewarded:
Salary range in the US: 

$173,000.00 - $235,000.00 Annually
A discretionary bonus typically paid annuallyRestricted Stock Units granted at time of hire401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package
The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
Customer Success: Always delight our customers.Trust: Rely on each other. Integrity: Do the right thing, every time. Collaboration: Share resources and work together. Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways. Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong. Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.
We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:
Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and moreWork-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.
Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits:  https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits
Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.
companyDescription:
Workiva’s mission is to power transparent reporting for a better world. We believe that consumers, employees, shareholders, and other stakeholders today expect more from business – more action, transparency, and disclosure of financial and non-financial information. We build solutions to meet that demand and streamline processes, connect data and teams, and ensure consistency – all within a controlled, secure, audit-ready cloud platform. 

Workiva delivers the world’s leading cloud platform for regulatory, financial and environmental, social and governance (“ESG”) reporting. Workiva provides more than 4,300 organizations with software-as-a-service solutions to help solve some of the most complex reporting and disclosure challenges. People all over the world use our connected, cloud platform to seamlessly enable collaboration and deep integration into existing work streams to simplify their most complex reporting challenges.

Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. companyDescription:
Workiva’s mission is to power transparent reporting for a better world. We believe that consumers, employees, shareholders, and other stakeholders today expect more from business – more action, transparency, and disclosure of financial and non-financial information. We build solutions to meet that demand and streamline processes, connect data and teams, and ensure consistency – all within a controlled, secure, audit-ready cloud platform. 

Workiva delivers the world’s leading cloud platform for regulatory, financial and environmental, social and governance (“ESG”) reporting. Workiva provides more than 4,300 organizations with software-as-a-service solutions to help solve some of the most complex reporting and disclosure challenges. People all over the world use our connected, cloud platform to seamlessly enable collaboration and deep integration into existing work streams to simplify their most complex reporting challenges.

jobDescription:
Job Title: Assistant Manager, eRetail Consumer Experience

Division: ACD

Location: New York

Reports To: Senior Manager, eRetail Consumer Experience

Who We Are

For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted its energy, innovation, and scientific excellence solely to one business: Beauty. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

At L’Oréal Active Cosmetics, our mission is to help everyone in their quest for healthy and beautiful skin. Our division is the world leader in dermo-cosmetics by adding health to beauty. Our brands portfolio includes CeraVe, La Roche-Possay, Vichy, SkinCeuticals offering a range of skincare and haircare products to respond to all expectations linked to beauty and health of the skin.

What You Will Learn

The Active Cosmetics Division (ACD) is looking for a passionate, pro-active and detail-oriented candidate to join the Digital Consumer Experience team responsible for the eRetail.com Skincare business (includes Walmart, Target, Ulta, Walgreens, CVS, and other up-and-coming food/drug accounts).

As a member of the DCX team you will be customer obsessed, focused on delivering digital experiences that enhance our customers’ lives across various touchpoints; Curious and pro-active about specific retailer capabilities, leveraging data and customer insights to strategize how content is used across multiple channels/audiences & develop custom playbooks; Results-oriented and excited to build measurable impact with our retail partners and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams.

The role will be responsible for ACD consumer centric content strategy creation, execution, merchandising and other consumer experience projects to meet ACD’s objectives and drive best-in-class user experience & business growth. The candidate must have marketing, analytical, digital, writing and research skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and manage internal and external resources to effectively bring projects to life.

Responsibilities
Accountable for the quality of all consumer experiences on specific eRetail businessesIdentify opportunities to optimize or fulfill new customer & partner needs across journeys, to drive customer loyalty, business results, and improve the retailer online and in-store experienceIdentify content needs and opportunities. Develop, manage, syndicate, audit & optimize all content: images, videos, enhanced content, product description, attributes, UGC, Ratings & Reviews, diagnostic tools, brand stores, and device optimization. Ensure the establishment of clear goals and objectives through a content brief for content creators & graphic designers.Maintain all created content in internal digital asset management system (Opera)Collaborate with Brand liaisons in the US and international teams to ensure alignment and that all content needs are met. Share best practices within ACD & L’Oreal USA. Develop and manage a content and merchandising calendar, ensure deadlines are met.Collaborate with Sales & Media teams to ensure your content strategy and media/promo plans are working together for optimal sale and conversion and identify opportunities to increase awareness and visibility for ACD Brands.Collaborate with internal teams to ensure PDP copy (above the fold & below the fold) are optimized for SEO to achieve ranking and visibilityProduct catalog management for internal and external tools (OPERA, Edge, and other systems as needed)Have ambition to pursue new projects and drive new ideas to evolve responsibilities
Data & Reporting
Track, analyze, and communicate program performance; recommend action plans to address variances in performance against annual planAnalyze retailer reporting dashboards, run relevant reports, and measure & present findings on content performance, sales, conversion, engagement, consumer sentiment, AB tests and competitors in the beauty category. Identify and monitor the latest trends in content marketing and consumer insights. Analyze & translate consumer insights into meaningful actions and data-driven plansPublish reports summarizing your CX Wins, Opportunities, & Initiatives to senior management on a weekly basis.
Requirements

What We Are Looking For:
2+ years of digital, marketing, or content creation experienceStrong understanding of the Digital Industry. Beauty/skincare and content experience a plusHigh proficiency in MS Office: Excel and PowerPoint are a must have skill. Ability to create high impact presentations and proficiency in telling a cohesive storyMust be skilled at executing within tight timeframes with excellent attention to detail, accuracy, and a sense of urgency.Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet multiple, competing deadlinesStrong Communication skillsMust demonstrate strong analytical, organizational, critical thinking, and problem-solving skillsAble to pull, mine, and synthesize across multiple data sources to formulate insightsPromotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork across organizational functionsA no task is too small attitudeProcess-oriented mindset along with high level of curiosityAbility to take initiative, act proactively & drive projects to the finish lineMust be comfortable with high degree of virtual ways of working
What’s In It For You
Salary Range: $81,300-$113,800 (The actual compensation will depend on a variety of job-related factors which may include geographic location, work experience, education, and skill level)(Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Pension Plan)(Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Vacation Buy Program, Volunteer Time, Summer Fridays & More!)VIP Access to L’Oréal’s Internal Shop for Discounted Products, Monthly Mobile Allowance)(Unlimited Access to E-learnings, Lunch & Learn Sessions, Mentorship Programs, & More!)(Think Tanks and Innovation Squads)Access to Mental Health & Wellness Programs
Don’t meet every single requirement? At L'Oréal, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and innovative workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the qualifications listed in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways! You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by contacting USApplicationAccommodation@support.lorealusa.com. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time.

Our Safe Together Plan: Your safety is our highest priority. We will proceed with caution and adhere to enhanced protection standards to ensure our sites are safe for all employees. We must all operate with the shared responsibility for each other’s health & safety in mind.
companyDescription:
Leading the world in beauty and pioneering the world of beauty tech; we are 86K employees across 150 countries on five continents. 

Our 36 international brands are divided into four unique Divisions: Luxe, Consumer Products, Active Cosmetics, and Professional Products. Our 36 international brands include Kiehl’s, Lancôme, Giorgio Armani Beauty, Yves Saint Laurent Beauté, Ralph Lauren, Clarisonic, Maybelline New York, Essie, Kérastase, IT Cosmetics, Prada Beauty, Biotherm, Shu Uemura, Viktor&Rolf, Maison Martin Margiela, Urban Decay, Redken, Vichy, La Roche-Posay, Diesel, Garnier, L’Oréal Paris, and more. 

For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted itself solely to one business: beauty. We want to bring beauty to all people. Our goal is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by innovating and creating cosmetic and skincare products that meet the infinite diversity of their beauty needs and desires.

That’s about us… now what about you? You are driven and up for a challenge! You’re passionate about putting your best foot forward, but you’re not afraid to fail either. You love to learn, grow and make an impact on the world. You can be an intern, or at a senior level position, we’re always looking for new people to join our teams.

If you are ready to take charge of your career and join us, you’re one click away: https://careers.loreal.com/en_US/content

Interested about our quest to the next billion consumers, follow us here to get the insider scoop on our business, culture, and tips on how to join us to shape the future of beauty.

Freedom to go beyond, that’s the beauty of L’Oréal.
