This is a contract position with competitive compensation and benefits. If you're a creative self-starter with a passion for sports and video production, we'd love to hear from you. Please apply with your resume, a link to your portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for this role.

Company Description: Instinct® is a rapidly growing, family-owned marketer and manufacturer of natural pet foods for dogs and cats. Instinct® is the Raw Brand, with a mission to get more raw nutrition into every bowl of dogs and cats, for proven healthier and happier long life. Our company mission is to Empower people to transform the lives of pets. We are committed to hiring and developing a team of passionate, performance-oriented professionals who love to win and make a positive difference.

Position Summary: The Social Media Coordinator will be a key member of the Instinct Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) team. This individual will be detail oriented, proficient in key social media platforms, have strong communications skills, be interested in building brand/consumer relationships, and possess a collaborative spirit. The candidate must have an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be confident as a consumer-facing voice of the Instinct brand and have strong cross-functional communication skills.

 Primary Job Responsibilities: 
Scheduling and execution of social media posts across Instinct platforms as outlined in brand’s content calendarCommunity management of social channels; includes responding to all comments and messages in a timely fashion, independently reposting Instagram UGC content to Stories, and proactively engaging with brand fansRegular collaboration and communication with the Instinct IMC team, creative, and brand marketing team, plus Instinct media agency partnersExecution of giveaways on Instinct social channels or influencer/brand partner channels. Includes selecting & contacting winners and sending prizes in a timely manner.Assistance with brand ambassador and influencer programmingUsing Sprout Social to assist with social media reporting and KPI tracking, including monitoring and tracking competitor brandsMonitor and communicate trending topics/social trends to IMC teamTracking and organizing user generated social content, including obtaining user permission to repostAssistance with organizing and further developing brand social media responsesPublishing blog content to instinctpetfood.comCopywriting assistance when needed for social media, email, or blogs
Personal Attributes: 
A natural self-starter and problem solver who will own the roleEmpathetic and consumer-focused; enjoys interacting with consumers and building strong brand affinity through effective social media community managementCreative and interested in the latest social trendsHighly organized, with a strong attention to detailData-driven and able to track and analyze key KPIs (impressions, engagement, follower growth, etc.)
Required Skills and Technical Expertise:
Candidate must live in St. Louis, MO (must be in office as often as needed to ensure job functions are completed (ex. shipping samples & giveaway prizes))Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or similar fieldHigh level of knowledge and comfort within social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn & Pinterest) including utilizing tools and features within each platformStrong communication skills, written and verbalAbility to interpret social media reporting data and distill key learnings and actionable recommendationsStrong competency in Microsoft Office software (Outlook, Word, Excel etc.)Proficient in using tech tools for communication, collaboration, and content creation, such as Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, DropBox, and Canva.
Preferred Experience: 
Prior experience managing or helping manage brand social channelsHave used Sprout Social or similar social media management softwareFamiliarity with updating Wordpress sites or publishing blogs via WordPressSome copywriting experience within social content, emails, blogs, etcExperience with Adobe Creative Suite software, especially Photoshop and InDesign a plusExperience with social video editing (within social apps or video editing software such as Adobe Premiere) a plus
Compensation and BenefitsCompetitive compensation package includes health and dental insurance, life and AD&D insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, short and long-term disability, paid time off, Purpose Days off for company partner volunteer opportunities, and 401k with company match
Our Instinct is to CHAMPION Diversity
At Instinct, we are as passionate about our people as we are about the pets we call family. We are committed to inclusion, empowerment, and respect. We believe that just like our pets, what sets us apart unleashes our greatest strengths. We thrive on the ability to not only empower people to transform the lives of pets through raw nutrition, but also to empower each other to inspire a culture that celebrates our differences. Our unique approach to pet food is what makes us who we are as a company, and our individual identities are what makes us a successful, innovative, authentic team.

jobDescription:
Described as the "Uber of Content", Social Native is a marketplace technology company that empowers marketers to create, source and optimize authentic visual content in the most efficient way possible. Leveraging the world's first AI-powered creative platform, brands such as Unilever, Adidas, L'Oréal, Crocs and Nestlé Waters partner with Social Native to improve the performance of their paid and organic social strategy with a combination of Influencer Marketing, Custom Content, and Content Editing solutions.

With our acquisition of Olapic, we're changing the way marketers evaluate, refine and optimize their visual content strategy. This move solidifies our goal of delivering an all-in-one platform providing brands with data-driven insights, scales content creation, measures the impact of their work, and optimizes content and influencer strategy for even greater results.

The Creator Marketing and UGC Moderation teams are at the heart of driving value for our customers. We are looking for a customer and people first, data-driven Director who wants to lead and support a dynamic and growing division. This includes managing remote teams across various regions, ensuring the quality of our services, and developing strategies to improve our business processes and enhance our customers' experience. Director will report to the VP of Marketing & Operations and will drive the highest levels of performance and customer goal achievement. This role requires a strategic and analytical thinker who can develop processes and systems to maximize customer satisfaction and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities
Lead teams of remote creator marketing and UGC moderation professionals to ensure the highest level of performance and achievement of customer goals. Lead by example, taking on campaigns and clients to really understand the processes. Meet regularly with sales and CS leadership to forecast brands that need supportCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, customer success, product, and business analytics to ensure alignment and achieve common goals. Develop and implement ways to acquire new creators as well as engage and retain current creators. Develop and implement processes and methodology to ensure the quality and consistency of our content for our customers. Build processes that scale globally to meet the needs of the department & our strategic accountsMonitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and implement strategies to increase efficiency and quality. Work proactively to quality check and troubleshoot potential delivery issues with our highest valued customersEngage with team to build and execute on career and personal development plansAddress performance issues as needed, implement systems to monitor performance regularlyContinuously evaluate and optimize our technology and infrastructure to support our operations and ensure scalability. 

Qualifications:
At least 5 years of experience in operations management, preferably in the marketing industry. 5+ year of experience managing a teamStrong analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven & technically savvySocial media experience a plusProduct management experience a plusExcellent communication and interpersonal skills. Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. 

Perks:

One of the best perks about Social Native is working with amazing talented people! Come see what it's like to work at a fast-paced, venture-backed tech startup. We are looking for smart, driven, fun people that are eager to take ownership of exciting projects and be a part of building something great.
Attractive health, dental and vision insurance coverageCompetitive compensation structure401(k) retirement planUnlimited vacation policyFlexible work hoursCasual work environment and fun work culture
companyDescription:
Social Native is the leading global marketplace connecting brands to the creator economy. Thousands of global brands like Adidas and Airbnb use the company's software to generate the largest selection of high-quality branded content, at scale, and on-demand. Scaling content and attributable revenue for e-commerce and digital media has never been simpler.

By building a scalable content solution for commerce, we’re fulfilling our mission to grow and empower creator economies.

jobDescription:
The Horizon Team at Meta is building a social User Generated Content (UGC) platform where people can find people, places, and things they care about -- a Metaverse without constraints where people have freedom of identity and expression and can experience living virtual worlds that could not exist in the real world. Our vision is to build a global-scale UGC platform where the world’s creators, performers, and more will be able to create their place, and enable their communities to connect, engage and play in all kinds of ways. We are driven to create a safe and compelling metaverse for never-ending exploration -- our journey is just the beginning, come join us.As a Game Designer on the Meta Horizon team, you’ll be at the forefront of prototyping, designing, and shipping VR-best experiences for the ever-expanding Horizon metaverse. You will work with teams of designers, artists, engineers and more to explore innovative core mechanics and game loops for first-party content across Horizon Worlds.
Game Designer on Horizon Worlds Responsibilities:
Help establish preliminary processes to align cross-functional teamsContribute to strategic decisions, working with the Design and Product teamsDesign end-to-end experiences with satisfying and novel core mechanics and loopsGive and solicit real time feedback from other designers to continually raise the quality and craftsmanship of the productPartner with PMs, engineers, researchers, content strategist & QA, overseeing the implementation of the user experience from product conception to launch - as well as post-launch design supportQuickly solve issues with your cross-functional leads including user research, data science, and product managementClearly articulate design decisions to a vast set of internal stakeholdersAdvocate for game design and help us build a great, welcoming, and inclusive game design community within Reality Labs and throughout Meta
Minimum Qualifications:
8+ years of game design experience or a minimum of 2 shipped titles on any platform that have been successful (highly rated, critically acclaimed, award-winning, etc.)Experience using or making games with a 3D engine (Unreal, Unity, etc.)Experience leading end-to-end development efforts and designing games from concept to launchExperience coordinating and collaborating with diverse cross functional teams to bring a vision to lifeExperience inspiring teams with your vision, but also actively getting into executing - prototyping and tuning the feel of the gameA portfolio that features some games you have prototyped or shipped, and showcases your game design skills
Preferred Qualifications:
8+ years of game design experience or a minimum of 3 shipped titles in AAA or indie game spacesExperience developing or designing VR or AR gamesExperience with technical aspects of game design such as scripting in Unity, or blueprints in UnrealGeneral design knowledge across a range of design specializationsProven shipped titles as a specialist in Level Design, Systems Design, Economy Design, Gameplay Design, etc.
Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. You may view our Equal Employment Opportunity notice here. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We may use your information to maintain the safety and security of Meta, its employees, and others as required or permitted by law. companyDescription:
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.

We want to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. To do that, we ask that you help create a safe and respectful online space. These community values encourage constructive conversations on this page:

• Start with an open mind. Whether you agree or disagree, engage with empathy.
• Comments violating our Community Standards will be removed or hidden. So please treat everybody with respect. 
• Keep it constructive. Use your interactions here to learn about and grow your understanding of others.
• Our moderators are here to uphold these guidelines for the benefit of everyone, every day. 
• If you are seeking support for issues related to your Facebook account, please reference our Help Center (https://www.facebook.com/help) or Help Community (https://www.facebook.com/help/community).

For a full listing of our jobs, visit https://www.metacareers.com

jobDescription:
Danette May — Danette is the co-founder of Haseya, Mindful Health and Earth Echo Foods. Millions of people worldwide have gone through her life changing programs. Danette is a sought after VIP coach for leaders and celebrities, a renowned speaker and best selling author to 7 books, including The Rise. Danette has over 500 Million views on her motivational videos across all her brands. She is on a mission for each individual to understand their unlimited potential & show up in their divine gifts.
Mindful Health was named #48 on the Inc. 500 2018 list of the fastest-growing private companies in the US.
We seek individuals who are passionate about healthy living, are on a personal path of growth, and are committed to transforming the world around them in their own way. We believe that we are all individually empowered to change the world.
Our culture thrives on community, diversity, and inclusiveness. Individuals at Mindful Health are recognized for their contribution to the team, the culture, and the mission. It is our hope that every member of our team thrives and finds personal and professional fulfillment in their role.
100% remote position.
This is a part-time, contract to part-time position with a 20-25/hour work week.
Intent:
The Social Media Marketing & Brand Strategist will provide a high level of social media marketing support to the Danette May brand. The person in this role will develop and implement viral and data-driven strategies and tactics to grow the brand and increase awareness specifically for Instagram, TikTok, Facebook and Pinterest. You will drive email list, SMS, and podcast listenership growth as well as new customer acquisition, through intelligent, thought-out, and effective social strategies designed to drive leads and increase podcast listening, rating, and review. Constant knowledge of the latest social media trends and best practices as well as editing and approving social posts for accuracy, audience relevance and tone is paramount.
Description & Influence:
Strategy
Build audience acquisition plans and growth strategies specifically for Instagram, Facebook and TikTokLead an “always-on” social media strategy: Establish viral and data-driven strategies and tacticsSpearhead and manage Pinterest strategy and presenceDrive email list growth and new customer acquisition through intelligent and effective social strategies designed to drive leadsDrive SMS growth and new customer acquisition through thought-out and effective social strategyDrive podcast listener growth and new customer acquisition through thought-out and effective social strategy driving to podcast listening, rating and reviewMonitor social performance and translate learnings into actionable insights for growthManage the cross-platform content calendar and cadence with a strong understanding of the ongoing business needs; Be mindful of the balance between promotional, educational, storytelling and entertainmentMaintain knowledge of the latest social media trends and best practices and adapt to the Danette May brand in real-time ensuring we are always on trendWork with the marketing team on overall campaigns and promotions and develop a strategy as well as implement those campaigns into social media 
Content Creation/Post Management
Produce, edit and distribute content (visual, video, text) that is optimized for social platforms, specifically (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook and Pinterest)Edit and approve social posts for accuracy, audience relevance, and tone, including real-time decision-making at various stages of content developmentTrack and aggregate UGC across social platforms. Proactively surface this content to the team to be used in multi-purpose streams and repost on owned channelsProject manage creative timelines and execution
Background & Experience:
Prior experience in or knowledge of social media marketing Prior experience in or knowledge of brandingExperience in managing social media platforms A creative eye and understanding of aestheticsPossess excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to self manage time and tasks effectivelyPreviously exhibited a high level of confidentiality and shown to be trustworthyPreferred personal or professional experience working in the wellness/health/exercise/mindfulness industriesOrganized with strong attention to detailsSolid ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentAbility to travel 1-4 times per year Focus on continuous improvement
Performance Monitoring
Provide weekly data reporting for all social platforms & share insights with content department

Audience growthAudience engagementEmail list growthSMS growthPodcast GrowthLeads driven from social

jobDescription:
Our Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Product Designer (Social & Community) in Bellevue, WA | Boston, MA | Minneapolis, MN | Plantation, FL or potentially remote. Chewy is dedicated to being the most trusted and convenient online destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. The New Verticals Team is a newly founded start-up organization within Chewy that is tasked with building novel businesses and experiences that have the potential to drive Chewy's future growth. Our goal is to innovate from within Chewy, crafting experiences that aim to delight and connect pet parents.

We are seeking a foundational product designer to join the New Verticals team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and visionary thinker adept designing innovative, well-crafted, customer-centric mobile experiences. You know how to create large scale community powered UGC products that delight, engage, and inspire pet parents in the most elegant and enjoyable way possible. This requires thinking big, continuous innovation, a bias for action, coupled with thoughtful experimentation.

What You’ll Do
Build end to end user experiences: Discovery and concept ideation, flows and wireframes, full-fidelity prototype designs, functional specs. Transform customer and business objectives into engaging social products that are feasible to build. Innovate across a range of products, platforms, and devices with a bias for action and crisp management of multiple priorities. Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other designers.Create designs, prototypes and artifacts to facilitate user testing and apply learnings to designsChampion invention and innovation to unite a growing suite of products Clearly present your design process, inspiration, and decisions Collaborate with engineering to ensure visual quality and finesse of the product and user experienceNurture Chewy's culture and principles within the group, and set new standards for executional and operational excellence. 
Qualifications
5+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role. 1+ years of experience leading large-scale mobile initiatives Most recent 2+ years designing interactive UGC social experiences for iOS and Android A track record of designing high-quality digital products that delivered results and demonstrate the depth of your design leadership skills; illustrated in a portfolio or case studies. Achieved mastery of a core set of design skills in interaction design, information architecture, and user interface design. Demonstrated communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills that communicate complex concepts clearly A proven ability to evaluate the customer and business impact of your design decisions inside and outside of your own product area. Bachelor's degree (or an equivalent degree) in Design, HCI, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience with the design field. 
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing complex UGC mobile products and experiences Demonstrated ability to manage end to end process from discovery to delivery Thrives in fast paced, start-up environment Can flex in other areas such as IA or UX/UI or VD 
Deliver Results

As an expert in user experience design, you turn your deep knowledge of our customers into products that deliver compelling value for the customer and the business. You carefully plan and drive the creative process for large, complex products to make sure that design delivers and continuously raises the bar. You use customer outcomes and business metrics to hold yourself accountable at every step of the process.

Earn Trust

You build trust across the organization by helping others achieve their goals. Those trusted relationships help you push the boundaries of design and product innovation to benefit the customer. Your proactive communication style and openness to collaboration across the organization influences people inside and outside the design organization. The knowledge you build enables you to make effective, high-quality, high-judgment decisions.

Operate at Depth

You recognize opportunities for design to drive change, and you have the judgment to choose between evolutionary and revolutionary solutions. Your judgment allows you to make smart trade-offs and compelling arguments to ensure the best outcome for the customer. When you see an issue, you take ownership and build a plan to resolve it.

Build High-Performing Teams

You partner with leadership to develop high-performing teams through modeling and mentorship. Your work and style encourage innovation and calculated risk-taking in a safe environment to drive team learning. You build well-structured plans that ensure high-quality designs are delivered on time. You identify performance issues and help leadership address them quickly

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.

If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.

companyDescription:
At Chewy, our mission is to be the most trusted and convenient destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. We view pets and pet parents as family, and are obsessed with meeting their needs and exceeding customer expectations through every interaction. Behind the scenes, our talented teams are made up of innovators, delighters, big-thinkers and of course, passionate pet people—creating a place where you'll be empowered to build, growand unleash your fullest potential.

Launched in 2011, we offer the personalized service of a neighborhood pet store alongside the convenience and speed of e-commerce. Customers love shopping our wide selection of products of more than 100,000 products (including our Private brands and prescription Rx food and Rx medication products), which we offer at competitive prices, fast 1-2 day shipping and around-the-clock convenience that only e-commerce can offer.

Chewy’s commitment to customer service is the core of our brand, and our customers love us for it. We “WOW” pet parents through 24/7 assistance, advice and encouragement every day of the year. We make pet parenting easy with our convenient Autoship subscription program—which allows our customers to schedule their orders, so they never run out of their pet food, supplies and medication they need.

As an e-commerce company, product innovation drives our operations, and our team is constantly striving to find new and better ways to improve our customers’ experience. From an easy-­to-­navigate website and highly rated mobile apps, to detailed order tracking and personalized “Pet Profile” features, we are transforming the way pet parents shop.

jobDescription:
We seek a contract to hire Social Ambassador & Community Lead to join our team at Dragonfly, developing and overseeing our Facebook communities, Influencer and Ambassador programs, and social.

Founded in 2019, Dragonfly is an acquirer and developer of standout eCommerce brands. Our team is led by founders with extensive experience on the Amazon platform and in the eCommerce ecosystem. Since our founding, we have developed proprietary algorithms and technologies to inform our acquisition strategy as well as in-house new product development and creative capabilities to build de novo brands and products at scale. With our unique approach, we quickly identify promising brands and grow them to their full potential.

We have raised over $500M in equity and debt to pursue our vision and are backed by industry-leading consumer-focused Private Equity firm, L Catterton. We are projecting to continue adding brands and products at a rapid pace over the coming years and are looking for high-caliber and well-rounded team members with the capabilities to help us achieve our ambitious vision.

Roles and Responsibilities:
You will develop and oversee the community management for various brands, looking for ways to acquire new followers and engage our current Facebook communities more effectively. Through social listening, you will identify opportunities for engagement and share insights from the community that can inform our overall product, marketing, and customer engagement strategies. You will find innovative ways to build and scale our Ambassador programs to drive advocacy, engagement, and sales across our brands. You will be responsible for engaging the Ambassadors, optimizing the programs, and reporting on performance. You will manage the influencer partnership cycle including outreach, rate collection, negotiations, agreements, product orders, execution of deliverables, and reporting. You will own the planning, management, and execution of social posting, with a primary focus on leveraging UGC from our community and Ambassadors to drive engagement and conversionYou will generate monthly analytics report on engagement KPIs across social campaigns and affiliate sales 

Minimum Qualifications:
3+ years of experience in Community Management, Affiliate, or Influencer Marketing Prior experience building and fostering online communities and ambassadorship on social mediaMust have strong proficiency and understanding of major social platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok, and YouTube Excited by the opportunity to generate new ideas and processes where previously none existed, or optimizing on current processesStrategic, results-oriented thinker; committed to achieving and exceeding aggressive goalsAbility to create and edit social content and reels 

Dragonfly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status or genetic information.
companyDescription:
Dragonfly is an acquirer and developer of standout eCommerce businesses. Our acquisition strategy is guided by proprietary technology tools and our leadership team’s deep experience building successful eCommerce businesses. We are currently deploying our Series A funding to rapidly expand our growing portfolio of brands.

For our acquisition partners, we offer a painless selling process. We are committed to taking care of your brand and building on the momentum you have created. Most of our deals close in 30-45 days.

For our people, we foster an entrepreneurial environment and expect our members to act as true owners, driving the strategy and development of their businesses. To aid this fast-paced brand acquisition and growth we are now hiring motivated, high-caliber individuals for a variety of roles. We hope you’ll join us in helping brands reach their full potential.

jobDescription:

As a Social Media Engagement Coordinator, you’ll work closely with our content team, as well as an array of project leads to develop, execute and scale social content with a focus on social content that will define our clients. Integrating video (i.e. Reels/TikToks) into social media strategies and bringing UGC ideas to clients will be key to your success. Position Duties & Responsibilities:Incorporating video content into client social media Coordinating the production of video content (UGC) from the client while editing raw footage for different platforms (Reels, Stories, TikToks)Boosting posts/run ads across all platformsHave an understanding of the limitations business profiles have while using Reels/TikToksStaying up to date on trends on different platforms, in order to recommend video content ideas, sound usage, and moreDeveloping new types of content and offers from scratch to meet new industry demandsAdhering to processes for content delivery, including content calendar development, interacting with clients to request feedback and obtaining approvals.Work with the Social Media Manager to oversee all social media content being distributedWriting and editing copy for websites, landing pages, social posts, blog posts, content offers, and other projects when necessaryWorking with the creative team to conceptualize, plan, and execute digital marketing campaignsContributing to blogs, videos, press releases, and other digital marketing effortsUnderstanding share analytics
 Job Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in marketing/advertising or a related fieldMinimum of 1-year experience in marketing and strategies with proven experience working as a digital marketerPortfolio of TikTok & Reels you are proud ofHighly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivateMust be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining organization, strategy, and creativityUp-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurementExcellent written and oral communication skills
Benefits:Competitive salary, based on experienceFun and modern work environmentFlexible working hours Work-from-home optionsHealth Insurance401k available
companyDescription:
In a highly-commoditized world, the only differentiator is your story. To connect with your audience and empathize with their pain points, you need to craft your story through the lens of the customer. The team of strategists and storytellers at RAD can work with you to create an effective story that drives your marketing strategy.  

Every company has a story to tell, a reason as to why they are in business. We love taking that story and delivering it to where your customers are.  River Avenue will put your story in front of your prospects and clients.

jobDescription:
We are looking for a creative, detail-oriented, and skilled social media manager and content creator for a client. The ideal candidate is a top-notch social media manager with a wealth of experience creating native content across platforms including Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, and Instagram.
We are looking for someone who can come up with a consistent long-term social media strategy for the client and implement it. The ideal candidate is skilled at creating fresh content every day. We need someone who can stay on top of trends, UGC, and fan comments for this client and proactively repost, share, and engage with the client's huge community of fans.
In addition, you will be responsible for:
 Creating a content calendar for clients weekly across platforms including Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, and Twitter. You must also be able to write posts for the client's blog and manage their tour date calendar. Developing the copy and creative for posts (must be a strong copywriter, have Photoshop experience, and be able to edit videos). Explain the social media strategy to clients during one-on-one sessions. Schedule posts using tools like Hootsuite or Publer. However, you must be able to post, repost, and react to content and comments real-time, even on the weekends. Engage with fans, comment, reshare, and like posts. Look for opportunities to use user-generated content.
You must be professional and willing to go above and beyond. This is a fast-paced role, and we need someone that is available to be "on-call" always (even on the weekends) to keep up with the changing trends on social media. Someone who is passionate about music, especially hip-hop is a plus!
This is an hourly contract role. Please only apply if you are open to contract work.
Perks
 Flexible schedule and full remote. Ability to work with exciting influential clients. Support team and ample room for growth.

jobDescription:
Described as the "Uber of Content", Social Native is a marketplace technology company that empowers marketers to create, source and optimize authentic visual content in the most efficient way possible. Leveraging the world's first AI-powered creative platform, brands such as Unilever, Adidas, L'Oréal, Crocs and Nestlé Waters partner with Social Native to improve the performance of their paid and organic social strategy with a combination of Influencer Marketing, Custom Content, and Content Editing solutions.

With our acquisition of Olapic, we're changing the way marketers evaluate, refine and optimize their visual content strategy. This move solidifies our goal of delivering an all-in-one platform providing brands with data-driven insights, scales content creation, measures the impact of their work, and optimizes content and influencer strategy for even greater results.

The Creator Marketing and UGC Moderation teams are at the heart of driving value for our customers. We are looking for a customer and people first, data-driven Director who wants to lead and support a dynamic and growing division. This includes managing remote teams across various regions, ensuring the quality of our services, and developing strategies to improve our business processes and enhance our customers' experience. Director will report to the VP of Marketing & Operations and will drive the highest levels of performance and customer goal achievement. This role requires a strategic and analytical thinker who can develop processes and systems to maximize customer satisfaction and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities
Lead teams of remote creator marketing and UGC moderation professionals to ensure the highest level of performance and achievement of customer goals. Lead by example, taking on campaigns and clients to really understand the processes. Meet regularly with sales and CS leadership to forecast brands that need supportCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, customer success, product, and business analytics to ensure alignment and achieve common goals. Develop and implement ways to acquire new creators as well as engage and retain current creators. Develop and implement processes and methodology to ensure the quality and consistency of our content for our customers. Build processes that scale globally to meet the needs of the department & our strategic accountsMonitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and implement strategies to increase efficiency and quality. Work proactively to quality check and troubleshoot potential delivery issues with our highest valued customersEngage with team to build and execute on career and personal development plansAddress performance issues as needed, implement systems to monitor performance regularlyContinuously evaluate and optimize our technology and infrastructure to support our operations and ensure scalability. 

Qualifications:
At least 5 years of experience in operations management, preferably in the marketing industry. 5+ year of experience managing a teamStrong analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven & technically savvySocial media experience a plusProduct management experience a plusExcellent communication and interpersonal skills. Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. 

Perks:

One of the best perks about Social Native is working with amazing talented people! Come see what it's like to work at a fast-paced, venture-backed tech startup. We are looking for smart, driven, fun people that are eager to take ownership of exciting projects and be a part of building something great.
Attractive health, dental and vision insurance coverageCompetitive compensation structure401(k) retirement planUnlimited vacation policyFlexible work hoursCasual work environment and fun work culture

jobDescription:
All About Gabb
Gabb Wireless is a fast-growing and industry-leading technology company located within the Silicon Slopes in Lehi, Utah. We started in 2018 with the mission to provide a safe tech option for families within this digital age.
Here at Gabb, our mission is threefold: protect kids, connect families, and encourage life beyond the screen. We have created safe tech products and a cellular network all designed for children. Our products include phones, a new watch, and more products in the works.
We are a mission-driven company with a passion for people and culture. We believe in the importance of having a work-life balance and working hard and playing hard. Come join the mission!
What You'll Do
Gabb is looking for a talented Influencer Account Manager to join our team in our Lehi, UT office. In this role, you will be growing, nurturing, and building on the current Influencer program. This position will support content strategy, outreach, events, and more to continue to raise awareness and increase sales through the influencer channel. Responsibilities will include… 
Developing communication campaigns and outreach plans for growing the influencer program. Creating concepts, writing campaign briefs, pitching stories and finding/seeding media, editors, bloggers and influencers. Nurturing relationships with existing influencers and building new ones. Supporting other elements of influencer programs (e.g., campaign/mailer ideation, product seeding, social media tracking/reporting, event planning, event execution etc.)Supporting internal and external initiativesInfluencer outreach, negotiation, and contracting to ensure an optimal outcome for the brandLeads UGC/Whitelisting strategy with influencers to support paid and organic social channels. Maintains influencer database with accurate and up to date information. Performs additional duties and special projects, as required
What You’ll Need
Bachelor's degree in business, communications or related field2+ years experience working within the influencer spaceEvent planning experience a plusExperience managing influencer campaigns from concept through completionFamiliar with contracting process and various pricing structures
Why You’ll Love Gabb
Mission driven to protect kids and make a difference in the world Work-life balance with unlimited PTO, flexible/hybrid schedules, and more Generously covered insurance premiums Energetic and collaborative company culture (plus the coolest coworkers around) Fast-paced startup environment with room for career growth A fully stocked break room with endless snacks and drinks

jobTitle: Content Manager and Social Media Strategist
jobDescription:
About The Role

Typhur is hiring a skilled Content and Social Media Manager with a passion for creating compelling content and an eye for aesthetics. As the Content and Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing social media strategies, creating and curating engaging content, and managing social media content across a variety of social platforms to cultivate and deepen those relationships, with the ability to moderate online and offline conversations with our community. This position reports to the Head of Marketing and you will work closely with the marketing team to ensure consistent branding across all channels.

Our ideal candidate will have some experience in content creation, food styling, videography and photography. This is an exciting opportunity for a highly-collaborative and creative storyteller who is passionate about food, cooking, and smart kitchen appliances.

Ultimately, you should be able to act as the face and voice of our brand and manage all community communications and content.

Key Responsibilities
Develop social media strategies and content plans to engage, maintain, and grow the community across owned social and crowdfunding platforms, including managing a robust content calendar through Hootsuite. Own Typhur’s social media channels, including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tiktok, Youtube, and Pinterest, and identify opportunities with current and emerging social media platforms.Engage directly with customers, influencers and ambassadors, facilitating meaningful and authentic two-way communication and responding to questions, comments, and requests. Manage our influencer and ambassador program and UGC assets creation.Create and curate engaging content for all social media channels, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok.Create high-quality, visually appealing content for social media, website, and other marketing channels, including photography and videography.Edit and post-process photos and videos to ensure consistency and quality.Collaborate with chefs, food stylists, and other team members to develop visually stunning food content.Develop and maintain a content calendar, ensuring content is planned and scheduled in advance.Work closely with the marketing team to ensure consistency in branding across all channels.Stay up-to-date with social media trends and best practices, continuously improving content and strategies, and advise internal teams on industry best practices.Share feedback and insights from our community that can inform our overall product, marketing, and customer engagement strategies. Identify, evaluate, and report performance KPIs with a strong understanding of which measurements align with business goals.Work closely with product design to understand the details of new features/content and partner with content creation resources to ensure effective communication with consumers.

Requirements
3+ years experience in managing social media and communities, and digital marketing.Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, PR, Communications or related field, or equivalent experience.Deep knowledge of the social media landscape and functionality of social platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, and other emerging platforms.Understanding of social media metrics - ability to collect, analyze, and use social data to inform decision making to increase the effectiveness of social media campaigns.Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Lightroom, and Premiere Pro.Ability to create visually stunning content, with a strong eye for detail and aesthetics.Proficiency in social listening tools is a plus.Hyper-organized and detail-oriented. Excellent written and verbal communication, as well as copywriting skills.Motivated self-starter who is adaptable to changing priorities and able to manage multiple projects and responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.Highly-collaborative with teams and partners.Passionate about food and cooking.Experience in e-commerce/B2C business is a plus.

Benefits

Our Appetizers
Hybrid/flexible workFlexible PTOGenerous core benefits401k matchingAn engaging, food-filled work environment with a creative team of culinary enthusiasts

jobDescription:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
DESIGN
What We Do
Put your design skills to work at a cutting-edge company that challenges the norm. From character and level design to competitive gameplay and system design, help shape the future of interactive entertainment at Epic.
What You'll Do
We're looking for a Game Design Director, UGC. You’ll be responsible for directing multiple games within the Fortnite platform. From thinking about how players can experience a wide range of high quality content, to the types of activities they might participate in, to building account equity in the form of persistent gameplay systems. Ideally you’re intimately familiar with other platforms and able to speak authoritatively on their strengths/weaknesses, and use that knowledge to help guide internal development initiatives.
In This Role You Will
Work teams and design leads to direct design of experiences.Hold a high bar of quality and polish to ensure the capability of the tools are up to the challenge of making amazing experiencesDesign and guide development for game features including: inventory systems, account-wide equity (such as collection book content, achievements, and stats).Be an advocate for the broad audience of content consumers on the Fortnite platform.
What We're Looking For
Considerable amount of game design experience.Comfortable working with multiple development teams simultaneouslyUI design experience or best practices.Familiarity with the wide range of content platforms that exist across multiple mediums (games/TV/film/etc).
Nice To Have Skills
Some system design experience
EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
Pay Transparency Information
The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren’t limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic’s generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).
Washington Base Pay Range
$189,900—$291,700 USD
About Us
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.
Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.
companyDescription: Founded in 1991, Epic Games is a leading interactive entertainment company and provider of 3D engine technology. Epic operates Fortnite, one of the world’s largest games with over 350 million accounts and 2.5 billion friend connections. Epic also develops Unreal Engine, which powers the world’s leading games and is adopted across industries such as film and television, architecture, automotive, manufacturing, and simulation. Through Unreal Engine, Epic Games Store, and Epic Online Services, Epic provides an end-to-end digital ecosystem for developers and creators to build, distribute, and operate games and other content. Epic has over 40 offices worldwide with headquarters in Cary, North Carolina.

jobDescription:
Our Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Product Designer (Social & Community) in Bellevue, WA | Boston, MA | Minneapolis, MN | Plantation, FL or potentially remote. Chewy is dedicated to being the most trusted and convenient online destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. The New Verticals Team is a newly founded start-up organization within Chewy that is tasked with building novel businesses and experiences that have the potential to drive Chewy's future growth. Our goal is to innovate from within Chewy, crafting experiences that aim to delight and connect pet parents.

We are seeking a foundational product designer to join the New Verticals team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and visionary thinker adept designing innovative, well-crafted, customer-centric mobile experiences. You know how to create large scale community powered UGC products that delight, engage, and inspire pet parents in the most elegant and enjoyable way possible. This requires thinking big, continuous innovation, a bias for action, coupled with thoughtful experimentation.

What You’ll Do
Build end to end user experiences: Discovery and concept ideation, flows and wireframes, full-fidelity prototype designs, functional specs. Transform customer and business objectives into engaging social products that are feasible to build. Innovate across a range of products, platforms, and devices with a bias for action and crisp management of multiple priorities. Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other designers.Create designs, prototypes and artifacts to facilitate user testing and apply learnings to designsChampion invention and innovation to unite a growing suite of products Clearly present your design process, inspiration, and decisions Collaborate with engineering to ensure visual quality and finesse of the product and user experienceNurture Chewy's culture and principles within the group, and set new standards for executional and operational excellence. 
Qualifications
5+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role. 1+ years of experience leading large-scale mobile initiatives Most recent 2+ years designing interactive UGC social experiences for iOS and Android A track record of designing high-quality digital products that delivered results and demonstrate the depth of your design leadership skills; illustrated in a portfolio or case studies. Achieved mastery of a core set of design skills in interaction design, information architecture, and user interface design. Demonstrated communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills that communicate complex concepts clearly A proven ability to evaluate the customer and business impact of your design decisions inside and outside of your own product area. Bachelor's degree (or an equivalent degree) in Design, HCI, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience with the design field. 
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing complex UGC mobile products and experiences Demonstrated ability to manage end to end process from discovery to delivery Thrives in fast paced, start-up environment Can flex in other areas such as IA or UX/UI or VD 
Deliver Results

As an expert in user experience design, you turn your deep knowledge of our customers into products that deliver compelling value for the customer and the business. You carefully plan and drive the creative process for large, complex products to make sure that design delivers and continuously raises the bar. You use customer outcomes and business metrics to hold yourself accountable at every step of the process.

Earn Trust

You build trust across the organization by helping others achieve their goals. Those trusted relationships help you push the boundaries of design and product innovation to benefit the customer. Your proactive communication style and openness to collaboration across the organization influences people inside and outside the design organization. The knowledge you build enables you to make effective, high-quality, high-judgment decisions.

Operate at Depth

You recognize opportunities for design to drive change, and you have the judgment to choose between evolutionary and revolutionary solutions. Your judgment allows you to make smart trade-offs and compelling arguments to ensure the best outcome for the customer. When you see an issue, you take ownership and build a plan to resolve it.

Build High-Performing Teams

You partner with leadership to develop high-performing teams through modeling and mentorship. Your work and style encourage innovation and calculated risk-taking in a safe environment to drive team learning. You build well-structured plans that ensure high-quality designs are delivered on time. You identify performance issues and help leadership address them quickly

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.

If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.

companyDescription:
At Chewy, our mission is to be the most trusted and convenient destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. We view pets and pet parents as family, and are obsessed with meeting their needs and exceeding customer expectations through every interaction. Behind the scenes, our talented teams are made up of innovators, delighters, big-thinkers and of course, passionate pet people—creating a place where you'll be empowered to build, growand unleash your fullest potential.

Launched in 2011, we offer the personalized service of a neighborhood pet store alongside the convenience and speed of e-commerce. Customers love shopping our wide selection of products of more than 100,000 products (including our Private brands and prescription Rx food and Rx medication products), which we offer at competitive prices, fast 1-2 day shipping and around-the-clock convenience that only e-commerce can offer.

Chewy’s commitment to customer service is the core of our brand, and our customers love us for it. We “WOW” pet parents through 24/7 assistance, advice and encouragement every day of the year. We make pet parenting easy with our convenient Autoship subscription program—which allows our customers to schedule their orders, so they never run out of their pet food, supplies and medication they need.

As an e-commerce company, product innovation drives our operations, and our team is constantly striving to find new and better ways to improve our customers’ experience. From an easy-­to-­navigate website and highly rated mobile apps, to detailed order tracking and personalized “Pet Profile” features, we are transforming the way pet parents shop.

Founded by a team of gaming industry veterans and serial entrepreneurs, our team includes veterans of Zynga, Facebook, Microsoft, Marvel, PlayStudios, Big Fish Games and many other high profile tech companies. We are a remote-friendly company, with a current team primarily based in San Francisco, Austin, and New York City.

jobDescription:
The Horizon Team at Meta is building a social User Generated Content (UGC) platform where people can find people, places, and things they care about -- a Metaverse without constraints where people have freedom of identity and expression and can experience living virtual worlds that could not exist in the real world. Our vision is to build a global-scale UGC platform where the world’s creators, performers, and more will be able to create their place, and enable their communities to connect, engage and play in all kinds of ways. We are driven to create a safe and compelling metaverse for never-ending exploration -- our journey is just the beginning, come join us.As a Game Designer on the Meta Horizon team, you’ll be at the forefront of prototyping, designing, and shipping VR-best experiences for the ever-expanding Horizon metaverse. You will work with teams of designers, artists, engineers and more to explore innovative core mechanics and game loops for first-party content across Horizon Worlds.
Game Designer on Horizon Worlds Responsibilities:
Help establish preliminary processes to align cross-functional teamsContribute to strategic decisions, working with the Design and Product teamsDesign end-to-end experiences with satisfying and novel core mechanics and loopsGive and solicit real time feedback from other designers to continually raise the quality and craftsmanship of the productPartner with PMs, engineers, researchers, content strategist & QA, overseeing the implementation of the user experience from product conception to launch - as well as post-launch design supportQuickly solve issues with your cross-functional leads including user research, data science, and product managementClearly articulate design decisions to a vast set of internal stakeholdersAdvocate for game design and help us build a great, welcoming, and inclusive game design community within Reality Labs and throughout Meta

8+ years of game design experience or a minimum of 2 shipped titles on any platform that have been successful (highly rated, critically acclaimed, award-winning, etc.)Experience using or making games with a 3D engine (Unreal, Unity, etc.)Experience leading end-to-end development efforts and designing games from concept to launchExperience coordinating and collaborating with diverse cross functional teams to bring a vision to lifeExperience inspiring teams with your vision, but also actively getting into executing - prototyping and tuning the feel of the gameA portfolio that features some games you have prototyped or shipped, and showcases your game design skills

companyDescription:
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.

We want to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. To do that, we ask that you help create a safe and respectful online space. These community values encourage constructive conversations on this page:

• Start with an open mind. Whether you agree or disagree, engage with empathy.
• Comments violating our Community Standards will be removed or hidden. So please treat everybody with respect. 
• Keep it constructive. Use your interactions here to learn about and grow your understanding of others.
• Our moderators are here to uphold these guidelines for the benefit of everyone, every day. 
• If you are seeking support for issues related to your Facebook account, please reference our Help Center (https://www.facebook.com/help) or Help Community (https://www.facebook.com/help/community).

For a full listing of our jobs, visit https://www.metacareers.com

jobDescription:
Digital Marketing Manager for E-commerce Fashion Brand
We are a rapidly growing e-commerce fashion brand that specializes in selling bra tops. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Digital Marketing Manager to develop and execute our digital marketing strategy. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing all digital marketing channels, including website, social media, email marketing, SEO, PPC advertising, and content marketing. The Digital Marketing Manager will work closely with internal teams and external agencies to ensure that all digital marketing efforts are aligned with the company's overall business objectives and achieve a positive ROI.
Responsibilities:• Develop and implement a comprehensive digital marketing strategy that aligns with the company's overall business objectives, with a focus on driving online customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.• Manage the company's website, ensuring that it is user-friendly, optimized for search engines, and up-to-date, with a particular focus on optimizing product pages and driving sales.• Create and manage social media campaigns across multiple platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok, with a particular focus on generating user-generated content (UGC) and increasing brand awareness.• Plan and execute email marketing campaigns, including newsletters, promotional emails, and automated email sequences, with a focus on increasing customer engagement and retention.• Create and manage pay-per-click (PPC) advertising campaigns, including Google Ads and social media advertising, with a focus on driving sales and increasing return on ad spend (ROAS).• Optimize content for search engines (SEO) and manage the company's search engine optimization strategy, with a focus on driving organic traffic and increasing search visibility.• Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments, with a focus on identifying emerging fashion and lifestyle trends.• Analyze data on customer behavior, website traffic, social media engagement, and other key metrics to optimize digital marketing efforts and increase ROI.• Work with internal teams, including sales, product, and customer service, to ensure that digital marketing efforts are aligned with overall business objectives, with a particular focus on improving customer experience and driving sales.• Manage digital marketing budgets and ensure that campaigns are cost-effective and achieve a positive ROI.• Collaborate with external agencies, such as web designers, SEO specialists, and PPC consultants, to ensure that all digital marketing efforts are coordinated and effective.• Keep up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends and technologies and share knowledge and insights with other team members to continuously improve the company's digital marketing strategy.
Qualifications:• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.• Minimum of 3 years of experience in digital marketing, with a focus on e-commerce and/or fashion brands.• Proven track record of developing and executing successful digital marketing campaigns.• Strong understanding of e-commerce metrics and KPIs, including conversion rate, AOV, and ROAS.• Experience with e-commerce platforms, such as Shopify or Magento, and email marketing platforms, such as Klaviyo or Mailchimp.• Experience with social media advertising platforms, such as Facebook Ads Manager and Google Ads.• Strong analytical skills and experience with web analytics tools, such as Google Analytics.• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and external agencies.• Passion for fashion and lifestyle trends, with a strong understanding of the fashion industry and consumer behavior.
companyDescription:

Our inclusive range of brami (bra + cami) tops provide stylish solutions so that you can have full coverage and support, without any bra lines.

jobDescription:
Team Jeni’s is searching for a Social Media Manager who has talent, hustle, guts, resilience and empathy—and a proven track record of adapting to any situation. The Social Media Manager will develop and execute Jeni's social media strategy across all owned media channels, with the goal to increase brand awareness, drive traffic and engagement, and find ways to authentically connect with customers. The ideal candidate is scrappy, open-minded, creative, collaborative, and understands the best practices when it comes to social (but is just fine with breaking more than a few rules). This person will be responsible for creating the strategy across platforms and working with both our internal creative team and external agency partner to deliver creative that addresses the brief.
Responsibilities:
As Social Media Manager, you will strategize, plan, develop, and analyze storytelling content across all Jeni’s Splendid Ice Creams owned social channels. You’ll work as a seasoned and collaborative liaison between Jeni’s in-house creative team and external partners to ensure content is spot-on and delivers on campaign objectives and project briefs. Success in this role requires the following:
Creating social media strategy that drives engagement and is aligned with senior level-management/directors (including project briefs and campaign objectives)Creating content that is engaging, authentic, personal AND on-brand for Jeni’sManaging multiple social media channels, including Instagram, Twitter, Tik Tok, and FacebookWorking collaboratively with in-house creative and external partners, including assigning and refining work Building, testing, publishing, and analyzing posts on all social channelsIdentifying and interpreting social media trends, platforms, and toolsEngaging with customers and influencers to build relationships and passionCommunicating in our brand’s voice with a deep passion and understanding for Jeni’sDeveloping social media reports and analyzing campaign and content results to share insights and recommendationsUsing trends, data, and metrics to drive innovative concepts that improve the business and social platformCapturing LIVE social media content and producing on-the-fly content (visual and copy) for live eventsDeveloping and executing UGC activities, surprise and delight outreach, and contest activationsIdentifying brand-right influencers and tastemakers, developing relationships and creating activations/contentShooting and editing video and photos using in-phone apps
The right candidate must have:
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, preferably in marketing, advertising, business, or related field5-7 years of experience developing and executing social media and influencer marketing communication strategies and campaignsExperience working with and managing external creative partnersThe ability to develop big ideas and bring them to fruitionA deep understanding of social media platforms, including their respective strengths and weaknesses (Instagram, Facebook, Tik Tok, Snapchat, Pinterest, Twitter, etc.)The ability to execute tactical and strategic direction with independent judgmentA high level of critical thinking ability and curiosityStrong written and verbal communication skills Design fluency coupled with excellent typography and visual design sensibilitiesStrong organizational and time management skillsThe ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously and efficientlyAn interest in social and cultural trends and fashions
The position is eligible for the following benefits:
Competitive compensationExcellent insurance (health, dental, vision, dental) Paid time off, including sick, vacation, and holiday pay 401k participation and 4% match on 401k contributions after 3 months of employment A one-month paid sabbatical after 3 years of continuous service Annual paid day to volunteer for a non-profit organization that matters to you 50% discount at Jeni’s Scoop Shops and online
companyDescription: Jeni’s Splendid Ice Creams was founded in 2002 by James Beard Award-winning cookbook author Jeni Britton Bauer. Britton Bauer’s ahead-of-the-trend vision—using whole ingredients and dairy from grass-pastured cows, rather than synthetic flavorings and commodity ice cream mix—coupled with inspired flavors, sparked the artisan ice cream movement more than a decade before it would become a top food trend. Today, Jeni’s is a certified B Corporation with 33 scoop shops, an online shop at jenis.com, and distribution in top groceries across the country.

jobDescription:
We’re on the hunt for a highly creative Social Media Content & Community Manager to join our team. In this role, you’ll own our day-to-day social content strategy, balancing an equal mix of creativity and strategic execution to help bring the Clare brand to life through our social presence. You’ll have an opportunity to flex your creative storytelling muscles daily to create compelling content that converts. As our Social Media & Community Manager, you’ll wear many hats and play a critical role in driving growth, brand awareness and engagement across our social channels, while supporting our marketing and overall company objectives. The ideal fit for this role has a strong mastery of written and visual storytelling, and a proven track record of driving growth through organic social content.

Who you are
A content creator at heart—You have stellar copywriting skills, a knack for storytelling, and a talent for producing stunning visual content in a variety of formats from photo imagery to graphics, GIFs, Instagram stories and reels, TikTok videos, Pinterest guides, and more.A social media nerd—You live and breathe social media. You’re up to date on the latest social trends, you understand channel specific best practices and geek out on testing the newest platforms and features the second they launch.Organized and detail-oriented — You can’t operate without a plan and a process, need a calendar to guide your work and are highly organized and detail-oriented, ensuring that projects are executed in a timely manner and in alignment with business goals.A data-driven decision maker — You love getting into the weeds of the data, using insights to understand what content is performing best and strategizing how to deliver more of it. Highly entrepreneurial — You’re a proactive self-starter who loves tackling new challenges big and small, is undeterred by ambiguity and thrives in a fast-paced environment where you’re constantly learning and wearing many hats. Moreover, you have a bias for action and know how to get sh*t done.A highly accountable owner— You take full accountability in your role and feel a deep sense of ownership over your work and the results you drive. You maintain high standards in every aspect of your work and continually raise the quality bar.A decor and lifestyle champion—You love all things decor and lifestyle, follow home influencers and design shows, publications like Domino, AD, and Apartment Therapy and have a great sense of style.

What You’ll Do

Social Media
Own social calendar and content planning, ensuring alignment with our broader marketing calendar and business goals.Produce daily posts in accordance with our social strategy aimed at driving brand awareness, traffic, and sales.Write engaging social copy with a focus on product and brand storytelling and with a high level of creativity and information accuracy.Create double-tap-worthy Instagram reels, Tiktok videos and more. Design social assets for IG & Pinterest story formats following templates and style guides. Bring our brand’s personality to life via social ensuring alignment with our brand voice and channel best practices.Analyze social media metrics to ensure we’re meeting or exceeding performance benchmarks and making adjustments and recommendations to optimize performance over time.Continuously adapt to emerging trends, new features and shifts in the ever-changing social landscape.

Community & Content Management
Lead day-to-day community engagement across social channels, turning everyday commenters into authentic brand fans and building relationships with influencers and enhancing our brand reputation through best-in-class community management.Source high-quality UGC and projects to feature in our content, as well as creators to partner with.Own the curation and internal organization of user generated content for our marketing channels.Work cross-functionally with our creative team to identify content that can be leveraged across our marketing channels, in alignment with our calendar. 

Qualifications
3-5 years of relevant experience creating content and growing social channels at a brand, agency, or editorial media outlet (a focus on decor, design, and lifestyle preferred).Passion for all things home with a finger on the pulse of the latest trends in home design, and a keen awareness of the most influential designers, tastemakers and content creators in our space.Proficiency in Photoshop, Canva and/or basic video editing software.Proficiency in social management tools such as Sprout Social and Pixlee.Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment, meeting clear deliverables and timelines.Strong organizational skills.Strong copywriting skills with a knack for storytelling.Demonstrated ability to execute projects on time & work collaboratively with a team.

What we offer
Competitive compensation commensurate with experience plus equity in the companyComprehensive health benefits and access to a 401K savings planA fun, dynamic working environment with a small, energetic and diverse teamFlexible remote working Unlimited PTOA diverse and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome
