companyDescription: Worn With Pride

jobDescription:
About Nisolo

Nisolo is a rapidly growing sustainable fashion e-commerce brand made up of smart, creative, and thoughtful people who are passionate about using their work as a force for good. We are working together to grow a household name brand and push the fashion industry in a more sustainable direction.

About The Role

Nisolo is seeking an experienced, dynamic e-commerce marketer to lead our e-commerce team and CRM marketing efforts. This is a unique opportunity for a strategic, analytical leader to develop and execute best-in-class strategies that drive results. You will be responsible for developing innovative approaches to increasing conversion and AOV as well as driving significant LTV (lifetime value).

About You
You thrive in an environment that allows you to focus on leading high-impact growth strategy alongside day-to-day campaigns. You are hardworking and resourceful. You have an insatiable thirst for knowledge, seeing every challenge as an opportunity to learn. You have a deep understanding of Shopify+ and a sharp and technical eye to support CRO (conversion rate optimization) and website optimization. You are data driven and view things with a mobile first approach. You are passionate about testing and iterating to find efficiency at every stage of the funnel. You are excited to create a best-in-class site experience for Nisolo customers. You are a collaborative leader who can work with cross-functional teams at all levels of the organization. You can set strategy and vision, but you are not afraid to execute at a tactical level. There is no task too small or too big for you. You are highly motivated and are able to think strategically and independently. You are an exceptionally organized self-starter who can prioritize well in a high growth, "hands off" environment. You are attentive to detail, and can also manage a tight deadline. You respond positively to constructive feedback and adapt quickly to change. You are a great team player, leader, and individual contributor. You are humble, hungry, and smart (in that order). You know what you're good at while still continually striving to improve and grow in all areas. 

Responsibilities
E-CommerceLead development and ongoing iteration of our e-commerce strategic roadmap including scoping, prioritization, execution and measurement. Maximize online sales through constant testing, site optimization, UI/UX and improving online customer experience. Collaborate with brand marketing to present brand and product stories online in a compelling way that delivers a rich brand experience to the consumer and integrates with other brand channel messaging. Spearhead CRO, UX and visual merchandising efforts through site enhancements and marketing calendar objectives. Manage outside agency partners for design, development, and SEO (search engine optimization). Develop onsite lead generation, including developing strategies to drive "shallow conversions", e.g., sampling, quizzes, etc. Be the expert on e-commerce best practices and competitors to gain an understanding of trending behaviors in the marketplace. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide guidance to grow engagement, revenue and to optimize the overall customer experience. CRM (Email/SMS)Apply a data-driven approach to identify, evaluate and prioritize strategic initiatives that increase engagement and optimize lifetime value. Lead development and ongoing iteration of our CRM strategic roadmap including scoping, prioritization, execution and measurement. Own large email marketing channel, including batch, lifecycle programs, triggered, and transactional emails. Spearhead the growth of a customer-centric SMS strategy that enables Marketing and CX to improve the customer journey. Conceptualize, build, and iterate on a best-in-class loyalty program and drive enrollment, engagement and retention/reactivation of our customers. Apply learnings from consumer-level data and behavior to develop segmented audience-based campaigns, journeys and automations. 
Skills & Qualifications:
7+ years e-commerce and CRM marketing experience, primarily in D2C or start-up environments. BA/BS degree or equivalent life experienceTrack record of success in hiring, managing & developing talent to be high-performing and high-committed teamProven achievement in creating data-driven strategies and solutions to support increases in conversion, AOV and LTV business objectives. High-level of proficiency in using relevant tools, such as Shopify Plus, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Pixlee (or other Social/UGC platforms), Okendo (or other review platforms), Klaviyo (or other email platforms), HotJar, and OptimizelyStrong understanding of web design and development, e-commerce systems integrations, SEO and UI/UX best practices. Strategic, analytical and creative thinker. An entrepreneurial mindset with the rigor and discipline to build the business and creative competencies that will allow us to stand out in the market. Proven experience in managing multiple functions in a fast paced, changing environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and thirst for collaborationStrong grasp of business strategy and the ability to prioritize opportunities. Able to maintain high standard of confidentiality and professionalismUnderstanding of sustainable fashion, ethical fashion, and/or social enterprise preferred

Compensation: Based on previous experience and expertise.

Timing: Applications are accepted on a rolling basis. Only candidates who pass through to the interview round will be contacted.

Location: Nashville, Tennessee
companyDescription:
Classic design. Everyday function. Next-level comfort. Sustainable shoes and accessories that do it all.

Nisolo’s vision is to convince the fashion industry to value our planet and the producers who make the clothes we wear just as much as the industry values the dollars of end consumers.

We believe in a fashion industry where success is based on more than just offering the cheapest price—a future industry that not only values exceptional design, but the producer and the planet.

- Certified B Corporation | 100% Living Wages
- Climate Neutral Certified | 0 Net Carbon

Intentionally Designed
We believe style should be effortless and design versatile to complement your everyday.

Ethically Made
All Nisolo producers receive beyond fair trade wages, healthcare, and a healthy working environment.

Fairly Priced
We sell directly to you. No middlemen needed, so you receive the highest quality at a fair price.

Every purchase provides living wages in the factory Nisolo owns in Peru, enables Nisolo to pursue living wages within the rest of its supply chain, and combats climate change by protecting trees from deforestation in the Amazon Basin.

jobDescription:
Liftoff is the leading growth acceleration platform for the mobile industry, helping advertisers, publishers, game developers and DSPs scale revenue growth with solutions to market and monetize mobile apps.
Liftoff’s solutions, including Accelerate, Direct, Influence, Monetize, Intelligence, and Vungle Exchange, support over 6,600 mobile businesses across 74 countries in sectors such as gaming, social, finance, ecommerce, and entertainment. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in Redwood City, CA, Liftoff has a diverse, global presence.
At Liftoff Influence, we are helping build the creator economy by providing creators with the tools they need to grow, monetize and thrive in the digital advertising ecoystem. Today, this means building a best-in-class platform that provides creators with monetization opportunities and content development tools to drive long term growth and performance outcomes for our advertising partners.
As a Senior Account Manager on our Advertiser team you will be at the crux of our growth efforts as we continue to scale sources of demand for our creator platform. You will work cross functionally with professionals across Liftoff to expand our advertiser base and help grow the number of Liftoff clients benefiting from Influence services. You will partner closely with clients and act as the connective tissue between our campaign implementation and our clients needs. You will use a surplus of data to strategically identify, onboard, and build relationships with our next wave of advertising partners.
Location:
This role is eligible for remote work in the following states:
California, Colorado, Idaho, Illinois, Florida, Georgia, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Missouri, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Oregon, Rhode Island, Texas, Utah, and Washington
Key Responsibilities:
Partner with cross-functional sales & creative teams to build a strong pipeline and manage the full campaign execution pipeline from pitching to successful campaign implementation Become highly knowledgeable about our product, clearly articulate our value prop, and be able to explain the key differences between traditional influencer marketing and our solution Build and maintain strong relationships with key partners, acting as a liaison between them and the internal teams to ensure their needs are metSuccessfully manage a book of business, including client retention and upselling opportunities, while maintaining a high level of client satisfactionProject manage across internal teams, ensuring that campaigns are executed smoothly and efficiently, with regular check-ins to ensure that projects are on track and any issues are resolved in a timely mannerDevelop a deep understanding of UGC and creator economy trends in order to successfully sell and onboard performance advertisers Create pitch materials, lead pricing negotiations, close deals, drive successful implementation, and developing business cases using research and analysisDrive programs and initiatives to improve advertiser engagement and business outcomesMaintain a deep understanding of Liftoff’s underlying technology, products, and servicesUse internal BI and analytical tools to drive business decisions and process improvements
Key Requirements:
You will need to be a persuasive closer with a high degree of emotional intelligence, scrappy sales skills, and an eye for opportunityGrit; able to embrace challenges and willing to work hard in a fast paced-environment to achieve goals 4-6 years of a demonstrated track record of exceeding targets and driving new business growthExperience, fluency, and knowledge within the mobile ad tech ecosystem and creator economy Detailed understanding of the enterprise sales cycle and a methodical approach to getting opportunities across the finish lineA quick learner with a data-driven mindset who can harness available data to drive client retention and growthHighly analytical and comfortable performing analysis market trends and business data to identify new opportunities for growthStrong communication, problem-solving, writing, negotiation, presentation, and time management skills
Liftoff is committed to providing and maintaining a work environment where all employees and candidates are treated with dignity and respect and that is free of bias, prejudice, and harassment. Liftoff is further committed to providing an equal employment opportunity for all employees and candidates for employment free from discrimination and harassment on the basis of sex, gender (including sexual harassment, gender harassment, and harassment due to pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, gender nonconformity, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, ancestry (including association, affiliation, or participation with persons or activities related to national origin, English-proficiency or accent, or immigration status), physical or mental disability, medical condition(s), genetic information of an individual or family member of the individual, marital or domestic partner status, age, veteran or military status, family care status, requesting or taking pregnancy, parental or disability leave, requesting an accommodation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law, regulation, or ordinance. All such discrimination and harassment is unlawful and will not be tolerated. Liftoff maintains a continued commitment to equal employment opportunity and expects the full cooperation of all personnel.
Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice:
Liftoff does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers or Recruiting Team. All candidates must be submitted via our Applicant Tracking System by approved Liftoff vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Recruiting Team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Liftoff Recruiting Team and such a candidate was submitted to the Liftoff Recruiting Team via our Applicant Tracking System.

Liftoff’s solutions, including Accelerate, Direct, Influence, Monetize, Intelligence, and Vungle Exchange, support over 6,600 mobile businesses across 74 countries in sectors such as gaming, social, finance, ecommerce, and entertainment. Liftoff created Mobile Heroes, the industry’s best-known global community of over 3600 app marketers, monetization experts, and game developers whose mission is to advance the mobile marketing sector. 

Liftoff has been named to the prestigious Inc. 5000 “Fastest Private Companies” list for six consecutive years and is a repeat winner of the Stevie® American Business Award for Fastest Growing Tech Company. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in Redwood City, CA, Liftoff has a diverse, global presence.

jobDescription:
Job Description
JOB TITLE: Growth Director
DEPARTMENT: Marketing & Sales
REPORTS TO: CEO
Company Overview
Hamama is a rapidly growing e-commerce company making it easy for customers to eat more greens by growing superfood microgreens at home! We are looking for people who want to be part of a world class team so if you are aligned with our mission, passionate about making a difference, and motivated and excited to execute in a startup environment we cannot wait to hear from you.
Summary
We are looking for a Growth Director to take Hamama to the next level through sales partnerships, marketing campaigns, and creative storytelling. You will be driving Hamama’s next phase of growth and expansion as the leader in the organization responsible for hitting revenue targets.
Responsibilities
You and your team will be ultimately responsible for strategy & execution in the following:
Social and Owned Channels 
Content, copy, and calendar for existing social platforms (FB, IG, Pinterest)Build strategy and scale the brand on new platforms (YouTube, TikTok, Snapchat, Streaming services, Podcasts)Own the marketing calendar and ensure alignment across social, sms, email, growth, customer serviceManage and leverage the community Create UGC content pipelineContinue to build and manage a technology team that ensures excellent site performance, conversation rate, and other KPIs
Brand Partnerships
Develop partnerships with like-minded brands on content, new products, and cross-promotionManage and grow influencer/ambassador program
Sales Partnerships
Build and maintain lasting relationships with B2B customers through thoughtful CRM funnels and direct communications that lead to hitting sales goalsCreate and maintain accurate records and sales reportsBuild and hold accountable a great sales team that achieves our sales objectivesOwn the omnichannel strategy informed by business, industry, and customer insights
Media Buying and Advertising Campaigns
Manage external performance marketing agencySpearhead new brand marketing channels such as billboards, linear/connected tv, pop-up physical experiences, direct mail, PR, and moreAdvertising campaigns including offers and product, landing pages and creative assets Work with the appropriate groups to deliver paid social assets, product photography, and landing pagesProvide regular channel reporting and post-campaign analysis, leveraging data to optimise future campaigns and improve digital advertising performance
Other
Build and develop a team covering verticals including creative, sales, social, digital advertising, PR and websiteDrive engagement through homepage and web content management, aligning to SEO best practicesDrive signups, subscriptions, and continual site optimization to improve conversion and customer journeyUse web analysis and other data sources to identify actionable website improvements to drive conversions and target sales partnersKeep up to date with industry trends and emerging technology to identify opportunities to grow the eCommerce channel and drive online sales performance
Required Skills / Abilities
An obsession with brand, creative, story-telling, growth and retentionHigh attention to detail, ensuring all internal and external communications reflect the highest standardsData driven approachA love of all things healthy living, food, fitness, wellness, green living, and startupsHigh EQ with an ability to work with many different personality types and positively influence othersWillingness to get your hands dirty and build from the ground upExcellent written and verbal communicationWorking knowledge of standard analytics tools (example, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager, Spreadsheets)Excellent with project management tools like Asana and communication tools like Slack and email. Ability to work quickly and effectively across a remote team environment.
Education & Experience
5+ years of experience in DTC physical productsExperience at a DTC brand that has adopted an omnichannel sales and distribution strategy (ideally in the CPG, natural products, or grocery category)Experience at a brand that has gone through high growth (ideally from 0 to $50mm+)Experience building and leading a team, fostering a great work environment, and helping your direct reports achieve success at the company
Pay & Benefits
Competitive salarySubsidized low cost medical, dental, and vision insurance after 60-day waiting periodFree $50,000 life insurance policy, long term disability insurance and EAPPaid vacation and sick timeProgressive work-life balance policies 
WORKING CONDITIONS
This is a remote positionLight travel to support business and planning activitiesIf preferred you are welcome to work onsite at our headquarters in West Sacramento
JOB TYPE
Full-time

jobDescription:
Grace Loves Lace is the largest direct to consumer bridal fashion brand worldwide. With 25 showrooms across the globe and a huge online presence across US and Europe, GRACE has become a global leader in the modern bridal world. Due to continued growth, an opportunity has become available for an Influencer & Content Specialist to join our in-house Marketing team.
The Role
For this US-based role (Los Angeles) we are searching for a well-connected, social media obsessed, influencer specialist to help grow our global presence focusing on driving influencer outreach and content.
Reporting to the Social Media & CRM Manager this role will be responsible for driving our global influencer outreach program working closely with the PR Specialist to increase brand awareness in the US & Canadian markets. This role will also include content creation for TikTok and Instagram brand channels working within the brand guidelines. The Influencer & Content Specialist will have a keen eye for trends & a thorough understanding of platform-relevant content.
Key Responsibilities
 Connected and experienced in the influencer space to execute all partnerships, conduct outreach to new influencers and brand partners that are aligned with our brand pillars  Build integrated influencer partnerships that create brand awareness, increase traffic, and highlight our products  Support internal marketing team in identifying and obtaining talent relevant to market; develop tailored programs per market consistent with brand messaging  Manage incoming partnership inquiries, and develop a strong knowledge of our brand to evaluate opportunities  Manage key event opportunities and relationships of influencer bridal dressing and opportunities from first contact to post wedding  Work with the Social Media Manager on content briefs for paid opportunities  Present innovative approaches to extend influencer relationships into social campaigns, events, and PR/press opportunities  Manage and conduct influencer seeding and gifting strategy that is in line with brand strategy  Drive, track and report on influencer and celebrity social and editorial coverage  Monitor influencer activity execution internally and across external PR agencies ensuring all deliverables are met  Optimize current and future showrooms by creating communities, content, events and influencer & VIP relationships in collaboration with the PR specialist  Coordinate all influencer showroom visits across GRACE showrooms to drive awareness in all showroom markets  Work closely with Customer Experience Manager and Pre-Production Coordinator to manage and resolve any influencer/celebrity orders or fit issues  Measure ROI and impressions across initiatives in order to gauge success and inform future initiatives  Invoicing (keeping track of influencer invoices) for all influencer campaigns  Filing and organizing of all influencer content for use across digital channels  Capture original social content to assist the Social & Brand teams (UGC, reel, Tik Tok style)  Attend showrooms to assist in filming content for creators & GRACE social media 
Essential Knowledge/Behaviors
 Must be influencer & social media obsessed  2+ years of PR/ influencer marketing experience within the fashion/beauty/ecomm industries  Motivated self-started with the ability to work both independently as well as a collaboratively with a team player mindset  Ability to capture organic/UGC style social content  Based out of LA you must be able to easily commute to our LA Showroom located on Abbot Kinney Blvd.  Must be highly organized and demonstrate effective time management  Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment  A high attention to detail with impeccable written and oral communication skills is essential  Ability to meet daily goals and deadlines  Intermediate skills in Microsoft Suite  Alignment with the Grace Loves Lace Mission and Values 
Perks & Benefits
 Company Sponsored 401K Plan  Paid Parental Leave Scheme*  Health, Dental and Vision Plans*  30%-50% of product discounts for you, your direct family & friends!*  Global career development and progression opportunities as we continue to grow  4 weeks of annual leave for full time employees or pro rata for part-time employees  10 days of sick leave per annum for full time employees or pro rata for part-time employees  Company supported Employee Assistance Program  Work with a passionate, and driven team that know how to work hard and have fun doing it!  Work in our beautiful showrooms that offer a peaceful yet luxurious private setting  Work with brand that holds ethical and sustainable manufacturing at its core  Continued development support and learning opportunities 
You must have unrestricted US working rights. Please send through your cover letter and current resume outlining why you would be perfect for the role.
We thank you in advance for your interest in working with us but only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.
Grace Loves Lace has always been, and always will be, committed to provide an environment free of discrimination and harassment to our candidates, employees, customers, and suppliers. We are committed to equal opportunity and recruitment decisions are based on merit and business needs. We do not base decisions on any classifications protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable adjustments are available to qualified individuals.
companyDescription:
Grace Loves Lace is the largest independent bridal brand in the world. All wedding dresses are ethically & sustainably made using the finest stretch laces and luxury silks. Grace Loves Lace has a relentless determination to deliver high quality, unique, comfortable bridal gowns to their dedicated following of brides around the world.  

Launching online over 10 years ago, the team at GRACE are digital innovators and have grown their service offering to extend from just an e-commerce platform to now including 24 showrooms across Australia, The United States of America, Canada, The United Kingdom & Australia.    

The award-winning team at GRACE love what they do and pride themselves on the reputation they’ve built as the industry leader in unique bridal. Customers are at the core of everything Grace Loves Lace does as the brand looks to their many brides as their ultimate muses.

jobTitle: Director of Machine Learning & Computer Vision
jobDescription:
Genies is Gen Z’s leading avatar technology company empowering humans to create their own avatar ecosystems. Genies provides tools that allow users to create their own avatars, avatar wearable fashion lines, avatar worlds, and avatar interactive experiences in web3. The company has 99% celebrity avatar market share through its partnerships with Universal Music Group and Warner Music Group as their “official avatar and digital goods provider with thousands of Genie creators including Justin Bieber, Migos, Cardi B, and J Balvin. Our avatar marketplace “The Warehouse” built with Dapper Labs, allows creators to design and sell their avatar ecosystem creations (i.e. avatar fashion lines) to the masses. Genies has raised $200M from investors such as Silver Lake, BOND, NEA, and Breyer Capital.

Genies is looking for an experienced and creative technologist to join us as the Director of Engineering for our growing AI, ML and Computer Graphics team.  Reporting to the CEO, this Director of Engineering will drive the growth and development of our R&D division, extend the functionality of our UGC tools, and oversee the integration of Machine Learning & Computer Vision into our product experience. You’ll play an integral role in determining which systems, tools and technologies Genies will invest in, and help the leadership team strategize on where the introduction of emerging technologies will advance the product suite and user experience. Our ideal candidate thrives in complex, highly technical, and creatively ambiguous environments that push the boundaries of innovation to deliver dynamic and equitable user experiences. You have extensive experience using technologies like machine learning, AI and computer graphics; and have wondered how the confluence of these technologies can amplify a user journey and experience.

Genies mission is to empower consumers to own their own avatar ecosystems, and we believe that the addition of this strategic technical leader will allow us to achieve our goal of empowering consumers to do just that; while also becoming the future of consumer social interactions and experiences. If you've ever dreamt of owning the future of avatars then this is the ideal role for you.

What You’ll Be Doing
 Strategize the research and development of user facing tools for avatar ecosystems  Work with leadership and product to develop a company-wide technical vision and strategy  Evaluate emerging technology and recommend innovative solutions  Combine technical and business decision making skills in charting the technical vision.  Integrate novel ML/CV technologies into creative tools and products  Build a team of ML and graphics engineers and mentor their development  Develop technical equity and a library of IP to leverage across applications 
What You Should Have
 MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience  10+ years experience designing and integrating new technologies into tools and products  5+ years building and managing large teams of engineers and technical artists  Deep knowledge of ML, specifically neural network modeling and data aggregation and grooming  Expert understanding of high end computer graphics, real time engines and mobile hardware.  Highly organized with a strong ability to take initiative and work collaboratively  Past experience building 0 to 1 products or technologies  Experience building teams from the ground up - you’re a talent magnet with a broad technical network  Huge Plus: Authored patents, publications, industry presentations 
How Genies Will Support You

Genies is a well-funded, growing start-up that cares deeply about each of our employees' growth and success. Our roles and their responsibilities are created with a breadth of scope that introduces each employee to exciting new challenges and opportunities that a growing start-up encounters. The actual base pay is dependent upon a number of factors, including: professional background, training, transferable skills, work experience, education, location, business and product needs, and market demand. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. Full-time employees may also be eligible for equity compensation, in addition to a robust health, wellness, and benefits package.

Starting Salary Range: $250,000.00 to $325,000.00 USD

Here's Why You'll Love Working At Genies
 You'll work with a team that you’ll be able to learn from and grow with, including support for your own professional development  You'll be at the helm of your own career, shaping it with your own innovative contributions to a nascent team and product with flexible hours and a work from home policy  You'll enjoy the culture and perks of a startup, with the stability of being well funded  Comprehensive health insurance for you and your family (Anthem + Kaiser Options Available), Dental and Vision Insurance  Competitive salaries for all full time employees  Unlimited paid time off, sick time, and paid company holidays, in addition to paid parental leave, bereavement leave, and jury duty leave for full-time employees  Health & wellness support through programs such as monthly wellness reimbursement  Working in a brand new, bright, open-environment and fun office space - there’s even a slide! 
Genies is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting an inclusive work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We value diversity, inclusion, and aim to provide a sense of belonging for everyone.

jobDescription:
Every day, tens of millions of people come to Roblox to explore, create, play, learn, and connect with friends in 3D immersive digital experiences– all created by our global community of developers and creators.

At Roblox, we’re building the tools and platform that empower our community to bring any experience that they can imagine to life. Our vision is to reimagine the way people come together, from anywhere in the world, and on any device. We’re on a mission to connect a billion people with optimism and civility, and looking for amazing talent to help us get there.

A career at Roblox means you’ll be working to shape the future of human interaction, solving unique technical challenges at scale, and helping to create safer, more civil shared experiences for everyone.

Work with the most passionate and team-oriented people you'll ever meet in your life. Community is the heart and soul of Roblox. Over 30 million active players engage on our platform every day!

The impact that you can have at Roblox is boundless! Much like our platform, the possibilities here are limitless. We're looking for someone who's eager to take on a meaningful role in the ongoing success of Roblox on a massive scale.

Are you ready to take Roblox – and your career – to the next level?

Roblox App is the gateway for the hundred millions of the users to experience the millions of Roblox Experiences across many popular platforms including iOS, Android, Mac, Windows, Xbox and more. What your browser window is to the internet, the Roblox App is to the metaverse: a single portal that unlocks immersive, social interaction with an endless array of UGC experiences.

As a Technical Director (Individual Contributor) on the Roblox App Team, you'll define the technical vision and execution for the Roblox App, our cross platform technology that enables the development of features across all of the Roblox supported platforms. Our goal is to provide users anytime, anywhere access to the Roblox Metaverse. We care deeply about architecture, performance, security/privacy and user experiences.

You Are
Experienced: You have 10+ years of industry experience. You have a BS in Computer Science, Masters are a definite plus. Always ready: You have already built and deployed client-side that support millions of users and are not afraid of any part of the technical stackVersatile: You have mastered several languages (e.g. ObjC, Java, etc) and technologies (e.g. iOS, Android, Windows, etc); .Knowledgeable: You can go deep in any required areas from fluid animations, threading, caching, networking to automation testing and CI/CD pipeline. You can recommend one route versus another and bring a team of engineers to agreement. You also love to pick up new technologies as the landscape evolves.Creative: You take a creative and strategic approach to solving hard problems and driving new tools/functionality for our developers. Team-oriented: You always put the community, company, and team priorities ahead of personal goals, and you are used to leading technical teams in any situation.
You Will
Manage the technology to help Roblox scale our application development with a growing number of teams and engineers.Lead the technical direction and implementation necessary to increase the Universal App architecture across our tech stack of native code, C++ and Lua.Envision the tooling and build infrastructure that are necessary to support frequent features delivery from many independent engineering teams.Stay on top of the new functionalities from the 3rd party platforms that Roblox supports and introduce and promote them as new capabilities into our products. Work with the industry and 3rd party vendors to satisfy necessary compliance requirements.Communicate with the industry and communities where applicable for our open source footprints. 
For roles that are based at our headquarters in San Mateo, CA: The starting base pay for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, location, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All full-time employees are also eligible for equity compensation and for benefits.

Annual Salary Range

$383,910—$440,190 USD

You’ll Love
Industry-leading compensation packageExcellent medical, dental, and vision coverageA rewarding 401k programFlexible vacation policyRoflex - Flexible and supportive work policy Roblox Admin badge for your avatarAt Roblox HQ: Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacksOnsite fitness center and fitness program creditAnnual CalTrain Go Pass
Roblox provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
companyDescription:
Roblox's vision is to reimagine the way people come together. Our mission is to connect a billion people with optimism and civility.

What is Roblox?

Roblox is a platform where people come together virtually to share experiences. Every day, tens of millions of people from around the world come to Roblox to learn, work, play, connect, communicate, and socialize in immersive digital experiences all built by a global community of creators.

Powered by Creators

Roblox is powered by a global community of millions of developers and creators who produce their own immersive multiplayer experiences each month using Roblox Studio, our intuitive desktop design tool. Any experience imaginable can be created on Roblox.

How Popular?

Roblox is ranked as one of the top entertainment platforms for audiences under the age of 18 based on average monthly visits and time spent (Comscore). Our popularity is driven purely by the community with millions of people signing up through word of mouth every month.

jobDescription:
Midnight Society is a AAA game development studio building a PvPvE online multiplayer game that leverages a platform focused on providing early access to our pre-launched titles, ability to trade and sell entitlements earned in games (NFTs) and a robust user-generated content (UGC) marketplace where creators can create and publish skins, maps, mods, and content to the community for purchase.

Our early Access Pass model, currently in its Founder’s stage, has over 400k users signed up within a week to participate with 10k already approved and playing early Snapshot builds. The ideal candidate will work with the platform and game team to conceptualize and help build the model for how our early access players, UGC creators, and NFT holders work together to evangelize, expand, and extend the games within the Midnight Society ecosystem.

Our approach and studio is currently backed by founders who are veterans of the game industry with multiple past exits, several prominent venture capital firms, angel investors, and influential strategic partners.

We support fully remote development and offer highly competitive salary and benefits packages for team members and their families. We are focused on building a 'Day Zero' Community, incorporating player involvement at all stages of development.

In this role you will
Work with the executive team to define, develop and market our vision of the platform layer that can drive community initiatives and reward them for their evangelism.Develop end to end strategy that supports community initiatives, mods, modes and UGC content and plan timeline to align development with our flagship game.Build and/or partner with web3 and gaming tools to inspire and incorporate UGC content within games and gaming content including graphical content, mods, modes, community tools, video content, bots etcIdentity build opportunities around four pillars that our community loves to engage in - game play, content, creating UGC content and evangelizing Work with gaming team on design mechanics which drive community to evangelize and/or build in game assets, enabling players long-term goals to invest in the world and their character and tuning the live systemWork with data analytics team to understand usage patterns and manage platform’s community retention, engagement, and reengagement metricsMust be able to continuously balance the above motivation systems to create a fun and retaining metagame experience for community membersHave a deep understanding of game monetization including knowledge of live KPIs and how to use them to measure incentive structures for contributorsKeep up to date with live service and metagame design trends within video game development and share solutions that will innovate both the community experience and the creative development of the platformDefine, uphold and communicate live service and metagame principles to the teamTake initiative in working with a high-performing team at executing initiatives, communicating and collaborating

The ideal candidate will possess
Excellent understanding of the changing landscape within the world of gaming especially cross platform nature of high fidelity games, influencers, short form videos, esports, content proliferation around gaming and how that shapes community narratives. Very good understanding of existing platform tools used for modding like Steam, Curse and community management like discord bots as well as platforms for UGC games like Roblox, Minecraft, Core, Epic Create. Good understanding of web 3.0, NFT’s, and tokenomics. Out of the box thinking on how core web3 principles can drive evangelism, ownership, p2p trading and UGC ecosystem and use of NFT’s across games within an ecosystem Been involved with at least one gaming studio / esports / gaming companyAbility to wireframe concepts into actionable itemsAbility to communicate complex metagame and concepts to the entire teamMastery of utilizing spreadsheets to design, model inventory and progression systems that are directly related to shaping UGC contentStrong communication and collaboration skillsBonus – Experience with web3 tooling is a big plusBonus – Action/Shooter game experience is a plus
companyDescription:
Midnight Society is a new kind of AAA game development and publishing studio over a decade in the making. We see a future in which developers no longer create experiences in a vacuum and players share in a game’s success.Built from the ground up in Unreal Engine 5,  we are focused on delivering our new title - Deadrop as the most community-focused, online PVP multiplayer experience the world has ever seen.

We are a group of ambitious game industry veterans headed by Sumit Gupta (multiple gaming and esports exits ), Guy Beahm (DrDisRespect one of the biggest gaming influencers), Robert Bowling (Creative Strategist Call of Duty) and Quinn DelHoyo (Lead Sandbox Designer Halo) and backed by several prominent venture capital firms, angel investors, and influential strategic partners. Since launching Dec 2021, we have grown to 35+ including some of the veteran leaders within the AAA Gaming industry.

Our Day Zero Community exploded from the moment we announced our intentions - within 8 months of launch we have over 500k Midnight Society accounts and followers across social media confirming that the gaming community shares our vision for what’s possible.

jobDescription:
Dorian is a venture-backed social creator platform that enables fiction writers to easily turn fiction into games, stream them and make money from their hobby!
We’re looking for a growth-minded community builder who will help us grow our community of creators and their fans. You’ll be responsible for our community communication channels and run regular community events and outreach programs. You’ll help creators amplify their games on Dorian and build their own fandoms by using our best in class tools for game writers and streamers.
Responsibilities
Develop and execute unifying community strategy across different communication channels (Discord, blog, email etc.) and social media (Instagram, TikTok, Twitter)Deeply understand motivations and goals of creators on Dorian and develop programs that help them achieve their goalsTranslate insights into actionable materials that help creators delight their fans and grow on DorianSupport and consult creators on using creative and monetization tools on DorianIdentify and recruit potential power users and develop programs for them Drive platform adoption and community growth through regular events Measure the effectiveness of the programs and events against the creator success metrics and adjust your approach accordinglyDevelop and enforce community guidelines to prevent harassment, abuse and toxic behaviors Recruit moderators to promote friendly and collaborative communityProactively collect and prioritize creators’ feedback for the product team

REQUIREMENTS
Demonstrable experience of building and scaling communities for gaming companies or UGC platforms using community tools such as DiscordExperience of working with cross-functional teams at gaming or tech startupsYou love learning new technologies and are adept at thinking across different media formats, knowledgeable of creator platforms and their value propositionsYou have bias towards overcommunicating You have high awareness of popular culture and can identify trends early You thrive in the proverbial fast-paced startup environment and take pride in a fast turnaround Excellent communication and writing skills 

BONUS POINTS
Games-as-a-service experienceFiction and fanfiction writing experienceInfluencer marketing experienceExperience of working with licensed media & Hollywood IPs 

BENEFITS
Competitive compensation and equityFlexible location
companyDescription:
At Dorian we’re building a no-code platform that unlocks new superpowers for fiction writers. Our unique social medium allows writers to truly connect with their fans and offer personalized interactive content to everyone! 

We believe that talent is everywhere so our creation and discovery tools are designed to help diverse and often underrepresented creators get heard and understood through their stories.

jobTitle: Sr. Specialist Digital Optimization, Fabric & Seasonal
jobDescription:
Summary

The Sr. Specialist, Digital Optimization role supports the online and mobile product / inspiration content and visual presentation strategy that differentiates JOANN brand from the competition and provides a best-in-class experience. This role initiates the content plans determined by the overall strategic initiatives, to drive shopper conversion and increase sales, customer engagement and support an omni-channel shopping experience. This person is aware of digital best practices and applies them when optimizing for the best customer experience.

This role will lead and champion the site and app experience for their specified categories of business by actively working to improve the customer experience, stay up-to-date on best practices and partner with cross-functional teams to drive increases in revenue and conversion. Leads ratings & reviews and other user-generated experience programs and champions new ideas to cross-functional partners to drive increases in review volume. Develops, tests, and implements the strategy for rule-based merchandising and product recommendations. This role will require continual learning of brand priorities, opportunities, and challenges, as well as adapting to new technology, new digital marketing strategies, ongoing consumer insights and a fast-evolving online channel.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES
 Responsible for planning and executing the site experience strategy for the Fabric/Sewing and Seasonal divisions, as well as any special projects related to these categories of business. This includes visual presentations for content such as product/category landing pages, site banners and any new additional placements to support product education and inspiration. This role will be responsible for submitting all creative requests that support marketing campaigns and launches, proofing of assets and the QA of all creative content for accuracy before launch. Partners with merchandising team to drive big ideas and ensure content is fresh and up to date. This role will also work with the SEO lead to drive improvements to existing and new categories. Contributes to the development and enhancements of processes and timelines to support efficiency among cross functional teams. Ensure standards for web content are developed, communicated, and adhered to. Leveraging data, test and optimize to drive future content/experience decisioning and optimize your creative approach to drive better results. In partnership with our digital agency, analyze on-site and app behavior and provide recommendations for experiments and personalization that improve engagement and conversion. Leads UGC through the ratings & reviews program and champions new ideas to cross-functional partners to drive increases in review volume. This role will also support the optimization of all UGC modules. Maintains relationships with vendor and partners on best practices and executes. Drives product recommendation zone strategy throughout the JOANN website and JOANN app. Develops and reports out on metrics and tests and optimizes experiences to drive conversion. Develops, tests, and implements the strategy for rule-based merchandising. Ensures the best customer experience through support of email proof, customer reviews and performs QA on the site to ensure an error-free and optimal customer experience; resolves issues or partners to resolve. Keeps current with the latest eCommerce trends and technology to keep the site at the forefront and ahead of competition.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

 Flexible Team Player Detail Oriented Ability to work quickly and accurately in a fast-paced environment Ability to manage many projects at once; change priorities as needed Quick, clear verbal and written communication skills Ability to collaborate with all levels of an organization Self-starter; able to work independently when necessary Highly motivated; Consistent in work ethic Commitment to quality; Open to learning

Education & Experience

Education Minimum: Bachelor’s Degree Major - Merchandising, Business, Marketing, Communication

Education Preferred:

Experience Minimum:

5+ years of retail experience in eCommerce, Omni-Channel, Merchandising or Marketing

Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) and Google Docs

Basic Photoshop Skills Is Preferred

Basic HTML knowledge is preferred

Previous eCommerce content / platform management and / or PIM experience is preferred

This position will be located at:

5555 Darrow Road Hudson, OH 44236

Eligibility for benefits and incentives is dependent upon employment status. JOANN offers the following benefits and incentives to eligible Team Members:
Medical, Dental and Vision benefit plans Company-paid basic, Optional, and Dependent life insurance Long-term disability and Company-paid Short-term disability Paid Time Off and Sick Time 401(k) Retirement Plan with an employer % match and Employee Stock Purchase Plan Tuition Reimbursement Team Member Discount

For more details on benefits and eligibility requirements, Click Here or visit https://joann.myben.site/

JOANN is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. This job summary is intended to be brief and does not list all duties for this position. Nothing in this job description should be construed as an express or implied contract of employment. JOANN is an at-will employer, which means that your employment may be terminated by JOANN or yourself with or without notice or cause unless the at-will arrangement is modified by a written agreement signed by both you and and authorized representative of JOANN.
companyDescription:
At JOANN, we’re creating a happy place — for our customers, and for one another. We are growing our people as we grow our company, creating new opportunities to stretch and shine. Rooted in Cleveland since 1943, we are now more than 870+ stores strong. We work together, embracing challenges and rewarding success, as we create a happy, handmade world.

We’re crafters, yes – and we are also trend forecasters, store planners and caring helpers to all hearts, hands and minds. We’re a patchwork community of real people, stitched together by one common goal: inspire others who like to create with their hands, hearts and minds. 

What is your happy place? Come create it here!

jobDescription:
Looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the lives of first-generation students? National Louis University is seeking enthusiastic and energetic History Adjunct Instructors to join our team! As a member of our dedicated group of educators, you will play an integral role in delivering our HIS 103 History Across the Globe course to undergraduate students.

At National Louis University, we believe in a student-focused educational model that expects excellence, provides personalized support, and fosters a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are seeking candidates who are passionate about teaching and learning in higher education and are committed to offering an unparalleled experience to our diverse student body.

As a successful candidate, you will facilitate blended classes that utilize technology and data to drive instruction. You will work collaboratively with a team of coaches, content experts, and data analysts to personalize the learning experience for your students. You will also promote growth mindset, non-cognitive skill development, and academic confidence.

In this role, you will demonstrate excellence in teaching by delivering engaging instruction in a blended or remote, synchronous classroom environment. You will empower students to develop competency by sharing your passion for the subject and skills being taught. You will also utilize technology-based teaching platforms, including an adaptive courseware engine, to aid students in the development of competencies.

As an active team member, you will demonstrate and share a passion for postsecondary success for diverse learners and for teaching. You will be flexible in your delivery and work schedule to provide personalized student support, including office hours. You will identify gaps between student needs and existing resources and services and generate creative resolutions. Additionally, you will engage in data-driven instruction and student support planning, participate in the continuous improvement of the UGC curriculum, and commit to continuous improvement of self and colleagues through professional development opportunities.

Qualifications

Master's degree or higher in History or a closely related field; or Master's degree and 18 graduate semester hours in History or a closely related field

Experience with digital tools for teaching, teaching in either online or blended/hybrid formats, and teaching to students of diverse backgrounds and abilities is strongly preferred

Spanish-English bilingual or experience teaching English Language Learners a plus

At National Louis University, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive community and strongly encourage all qualified individuals to apply. Join us and be a part of the meaningful innovation that changes lives every day!

jobDescription:
Tombras, a 475+ person, full-service, national advertising agency with a digital mindset, is seeking a Social Brand Manager.
Location: Knoxville or Remote
Who you are: The Brand Manager, Social Media is the role responsible for owning and managing one (or multiple) brand social presences online through content ideation and planning, social strategy development, monthly/quarterly reporting including learnings and insights, project management, real-time client + internal POVs, and more.
You'll be responsible for growing a brand's social media impact while aligning with their social goals and objectives. This is a highly collaborative role that will have you working closely with Social Media Community Manager, Sr. Social Media Brand Managers, creative teams and account teams.
What you'll be doing:
 Creating, owning and sharing social media calendars with clients in collaboration with creative teamsOwning all performance reports including data analytics, post recaps, learnings, insights and opportunities/recommendationsCollaborating with Sr. Brand Managers and Associate Social Media Directors to develop impactful social strategies that can strengthen and grow your brandPartnering with Social Media Community Managers on real-time opportunities and audience-based learning from UGC, engagement and trendsDirectly interacting with clients to provide expertise and social-first solutionsStaying up to date on social algorithm changes or emerging platformsProviding holistic thinking and recommendations that might include influencer opportunities, boosting recommendations and more

What you bring:
3+ years of experience in a social media role, can range from client-side or advertising agency experienceA comprehensive understanding of social media marketing ranging from content calendar building to social strategy developmentStrong data and reporting skills to provide strategic insights and actionable recommendations that align with overarching goalsAbility to own projects from start to finish, this includes asking the right questions to best understand asks and define a path forwardAdvanced proficiency in native social media platforms and third party tools for content management/social listeningDisplays the ability to lead the calendar creation process, from strategic planning to client review and final productProactively follows competitive and real-time trends through a socially strategic lensPossesses an advanced understanding of reporting metrics and the ability to provide strategic recommendations based on social communications planDisplays competence to navigate more complex, strategic needs in client-facing role Demonstrates an understanding of paid social strategy and capabilities

Why you’ll want to work at Tombras:
You’ll be joining one of the top independent agencies in North America. Connecting Data & Creativity for Business Results® is working for our clients and creating a flywheel affect fueling both client and agency growth. You’ll be a part of a highly creative agency that has been recognized by AdAge, Adweek, Communication Arts, Fast Company, Forbes and Fortune. Tombras was named a 2022 AdAge A-List Standout Agency and Adweek's 2022 U.S. Agency of the Year Shortlist.
Tombras Benefits:
Family - It comes first, on every list. Tombras has been family-run since day 1, we strive to facilitate a family-oriented environment rooted in supporting one another.
Dog-friendly office(Knoxville)
Unlimited PTO
Generous parental leave for primary and non-primary caregivers.
Medical (PPO or High Deductible option) for employee + dependents
401(k) Participation + 3% employer match
Employer-paid Dental & Vision
A company culture of promotions from within and an atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development.
New, Modern building in Downtown Knoxville
Want more reasons to work at Tombras? Check out the latest Tombras News and Our Values.
Tombras is proud to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. jobDescription:
Plural is a multidisciplinary marketing company. Our team’s mission is to bring a culture of creativity, a posture of possibility, and an abundance of craft to the world. We are practitioners of a craft, facilitating a strategic social-first approach to modern media.

As a 'Content Strategist II' at Plural, you will primarily lead partnerships for our cannabis partnerships and other partnerships Plural manages.

A Content Strategist II is an innovative, dynamic and strategic communicator who is highly experienced at building platform-specific social strategies that ladder back to enterprise level marketing objectives and have proven business impact.

The Content Strategist II is responsible for leading the success of our partner social media channel strategies and campaigns by providing thought leadership on campaign strategies and optimization, and building strong relationships and establishing clear lines of communication with partners and internal team members. The Content Strategist II is analytical and uses problem-solving capabilities to assure flawless social execution to meet and exceed partner objectives.

The ideal candidate is a creative marketer at heart and experienced in crafting and leading visionary brand storytelling that drives channel engagement and awareness. You understand that social and influencer are constantly evolving, highly creative channels, but are also the most direct line to our partner’s audience and leverage this understanding to develop deep one-to-one relationships. This role is tasked with developing social-first strategies and programs that fit within our overall marketing strategy, and then working with other Content Strategists, Graphic Designers, and Video Editors on our team that will execute on them at scale.

This is a key role on the Plural team and will report to our Senior Manager, Partner Strategy and Operations. This role will be a hybrid work structure working out of our NYC studio up to a few days a week.

Responsibilities Client Communications (15%)Facilitate client-company communication (lead communications, respond to questions, organize calls and ideation sessions)Build strong client relationshipsProject Management (15%)Provide end-to-end project management for our retainer partnershipsCommunicate and ensure all members are on board with delegated tasksManage the scope of projects and retainers to stay within budget and scopeContent Strategy (50%)Lead social media strategies for multiple platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, and TikTokDesign social marketing strategies and set short-term and long-term goalsContent Calendar ManagementIdeate and develop content calendarsManage, create, and publish engaging, original, high-quality contentIdentify gaps in content and recommend new topicsLead UGC sourcing and influencer relationshipsCopywriting:Write clear, attractive copy with a distinct voiceEdit, proofread, and improve contentScheduling, Posting & Engaging:Schedule and post content to social using Social Monitoring tools such as Sprinklr, Sprout, Dash Hudson, etcActively engage and build communities on social for each respective partnershipReceive strategic feedback and generate ideas to increase engagementPublish posts to partner social accounts daily (including weekends)Data Analytics and Reporting (10%)Reports:Prepare and lead delivery weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports to partners on social media insights and best practicesAnalysisMonitor, analyze, and report on content and campaigns using data from Sprout Social, Dash Hudson, Sprinklr, and Google AnalyticsEffectively translate data into understandable and actionable insights to drive strategyProactively perform desk and field research of ‘best in class’; view and experience marketing strategies and tactics online and IRL Creative & Production (5%)Create creative briefs for Plural production team based on strategic recommendations for partnerships and content calendarsContinued Development & Pitching (5%)Best Practices on Social:Stay up-to-date with new digital technologies and social media best practicesContinue education in marketing, social media, etc; take courses and attend workshopsRemain informed on trends in the social and digital media industries and communicate them to the teamSeek opportunities for improvement and suggest new projectsNew Business & Pitching:Provide presentation and RFP support as needed for Plural pitches
Requirements
Proven interest in the cannabisPassion for social media and creativityPrevious work experience (2-3 years) as a Social Media Strategist, Digital Project Manager, or role equivalentDigital marketing, social media management and strategy, brand management, creative direction, and partnership experiencesExperience with leading client communications and project management timelinesExperience with organic social media strategies and campaignsPrevious experience with any social data analytics and reporting tools (Hootsuite, Sprout Social, Sprinklr, Dash Hudson a plus)Experience with strategic narrative development Experience managing social media engagement 

Nice-to-Haves:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations, or a relevant fieldExperience working with creative talent, and a portfolio of creative work and content development across a range of purposes, engagement channels, and formatsExperience with paid social media campaigns is a plusPrevious agency experience a plus 

Qualifications and Skills:
Collaborative spiritCreative problem-solving skillsExcellent organizationTime-management skillsComfortable with multitasking in a deadline-driven environmentAbility to communicate well with others and maintain a professional demeanorAn ability to identify target audience preferences and build content to meet themStrong written and verbal communication skills in EnglishAbility to be a punctual, considerate, and team-oriented coworker

Benefits

You’ll love working at Plural because:
We take time to rest. We encourage you to take time to recharge outside of the office. You’ll have generous PTO to explore new places and experiences, Summer Fridays, and End of Year Rest week (Christmas through New Year's) for the entire team.We value our team as people, not just employees. We offer insurance coverage (health, vision, and dental), tax savings plans for retirement (401k and Roth IRA with matching), commuter benefits, and a kitchen stocked with snacks and beverages. We want you to take care of your mental health. We offer a monthly health & wellness stipend to our team to use for mental health services or anything that makes our team feel strong mentally, physically, or emotionally. We’ll invest in your career. Plural is growing quickly, and we’ll give you the opportunity to do the same. You’ll have access to professional development opportunities so that you can keep up with the company’s evolving needs.We’re creating a team culture where everyone can thrive. Through our Studio Talks in our studio in the Lower East Side and growing company initiatives, Plural values diversity and opportunities for everyone to grow and be a part of the creative environment we’ve built. And so much more! We host team events. We organize ways to give back to our local communities. We grow and learn together. 

Role Details
Salary for Role: $72,000 - $75,000This role is starting in late early February 2023Minimum of 40 hours per weekNYC-based hybrid in-studio in our Lower East Side studio 

Plural DEIS Statement

Plural is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate our inclusive work environment and encourage folks of all backgrounds and perspectives to apply. At Plural, we're committed to having an inclusive and a transparent environment where every voice is heard and acknowledged. We embrace our differences, and know that our diverse team is a strength that drives our success.Plural is committed to developing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. If you require any accommodation, please email us at leadership@plural.co and we'll work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

About Plural

Plural is a multidisciplinary marketing company. Our team’s mission is to bring a culture of creativity, a posture of possibility, and an abundance of craft to the world. We are practitioners of a craft, facilitating a strategic social-first approach to modern media.

Based in the Lower East Side of NYC, we cultivate and celebrate communities, strengthening our partner’s digital presence as well as create captivating creative content that resonates and inspires the communities we connect with.

We form long-term relationships with our partners built on mutual respect, healthy creative collaboration, inspiration, and sustained growth. We partner with a wide variety of brands and organizations bringing pivotal value as an extension of the partner team.

Plural’s partnerships range from local businesses to global brands, organizations, nonprofits, and personalities. Our partner list includes Seven Seven Six Fund, AERIN Beauty, AllModern, Cash App, EarlyBird, Deseret Wellness, DKNY, Jack Conte, Joss & Main, NAPAWF, Pure Utah, The Grand, Tom Ford Beauty, and Turf Design.

We act as a business partner, not a supplier.

We lead with business empathy.

We believe our unique perspectives make us stronger.

We are human-centered and empathic.

We encourage collaboration and play.

We create together.

We learn together.

We grow together.

We are Plural.

companyDescription:
Why is finding the right gift so hard?

Every time people go to look for a gift it takes so much time and energy. People have to ask themselves “will they like it” or “do they already have it?"

With all the stuff going on in life, it’s hard to spend so much effort and time picking out the perfect gift. Going store to store, website to website, looking for the perfect gift is just too time consuming and downright draining. And let’s all agree to just skip those lame “best gifts for your boyfriend” guides on Google already.

That’s why Make It Mine began - to create a place where you can get truly unique gifts that are easy to personalize and fun to give. Gifts that create memorable experiences for others without requiring so much time and energy.
