jobDescription:
The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection is an exciting extension of the Ritz-Carlton brand - redefining ultra-luxury hospitality at sea. As a “Lady or Gentleman” of The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection your role will be to ensure that the “Gold Standards” of The Ritz-Carlton are delivered graciously and thoughtfully every day.
The Gold Standards Are At The Heart Of That Culture And Consist Of The Following Elements
The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton. It is our philosophy and the standards which set us apart in our industry. This philosophy has earned The Ritz Carlton an enviable reputation as a global brand leader in instilling the very highest company values and culture across the organization.
 The Credo  Motto  Three Steps of Service  Service Values  The 6th Diamond  The Employee Promise 
THE CREDO
The Ritz-Carlton is a place where the genuine care and comfort of our guests is our highest mission.
We pledge to provide the finest personal services and facilities for our guests who will always enjoy a warm, relaxed, yet refined ambience.
The Ritz-Carlton experience enlivens the senses, instills well-being, and fulfills even the unexpressed wishes and needs of our guests.
THE MOTTO
Service at The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection is an extension of The Ritz-Carlton motto — “We are Ladies and Gentlemen serving Ladies and Gentlemen.”
This motto exemplifies the anticipatory service provided by all Ladies and Gentlemen.
The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection experience will be creating exceptional meaningful journeys that will redefine luxury at sea. With unparalleled hospitality that begins the second a guest reserves an experience, the Ladies and Gentlemen of the Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection will deliver a level of service that has no equal, providing guests with gracious anticipated hospitality throughout every moment of their stay.
THREE STEPS OF SERVICE
 A warm and sincere greeting. Use the guest’s name.  Anticipation and fulfillment of each guest’s needs.  Fond farewell. Give a warm good-bye and use t he guest’s name. 
OUR SERVICE VALUES
 I build strong relationships and create Ritz-Carlton guests for life.  I am always responsive to the expressed and unexpressed wishes and needs of our guests.  I am empowered to create unique, memorable and personal experiences for our guests.  I understand my role in achieving the Key Success Factors, embracing Community Footprints and creating The Ritz-Carlton Mystique.  I continuously seek opportunities to innovate and improve The Ritz-Carlton experience.  I own and immediately resolve guest problems.  I create a work environment of teamwork and lateral service so that the needs of our guests and each other are met.  I have the opportunity to continuously learn and grow.  I am involved in the planning of the work that affects me.  I am proud of my professional appearance, language and behavior.  I protect the privacy and security of our guests, my fellow employees and the company’s confidential information and assets.  I am responsible for uncompromising levels of cleanliness and creating a safe and accident-free environment.
THE SIXTH DIAMOND
Mystique
Emotional Engagement
Function
THE EMPLOYEE PROMISE
At The Ritz-Carlton, our Ladies and Gentlemen are the most important resource in our service commitment to our guests.
By applying the principles of trust, honesty, respect, integrity and commitment, we nurture and maximize talent to the benefit of each individual and the company.
The Ritz-Carlton fosters a work environment where diversity is valued, quality of life is enhanced, individual aspirations are fulfilled, and the Ritz-Carlton Mystique is strengthened.
We invite you to explore The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection.
Job Summary
The successful lady or gentleman in this role is passionate about The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection brand and introducing the unique opportunity of our yacht vacations to potential guests using social media channels at scale. The Social Media Specialist will develop and execute social campaigns to captivate potential guests and nurture their interest through the establishment of a relationship with the brand. This position will also oversee our community management discipline, interacting with stakeholders throughout the business to ensure we cultivate meaningful interactions and relationships with our guests throughout the social media ecosystem. In keeping with the cross-functional nature of our digital marketing team, this position will also support ladies and gentlemen responsible for analytics, email marketing, paid digital advertising and digital product management.
Essential Functions
Social
Create, workflow and publish content for The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection social media properties across Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and LinkedInDevelop social media content calendar and workflow to socialize proposed content with stakeholders throughout the businessManage guest responses on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and LinkedIn within the response matrix, or escalate exceptions for responseProvide thought leadership on social media best practices, collaborating with paid digital advertising and other stakeholdersPerform A/B and other relevant content testing as appropriate and apply learnings throughout digital ecosystemEvaluate and propose social strategy realignments monthlyOwn user-generated content platform (Social Native) and strategy to disseminate UGC content across digital channelsGenerate creative briefs to align with proposed content strategy, as neededFollow and enact brand safety and sensitivity guidance as issued by brand partnersReport on relevant social media KPIs for monthly executive dashboard and ad hoc operational improvementEngage third party resources (e.g. video editing, photography) in conjunction with creative services team, as appropriate.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of this contactor. Functions, duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with a written scope of work provided.
Competency
Education: BA or equivalent experience required
Experience: Previous experience in digital marketing, preferably two or more years in hospitality/travel and leisure.
Skills
Digital marketing experience, particularly in the social media spaceStrong writing and grammar skills, proofreading abilities, copywriting abilitiesKeen eye for visual aesthetics and ability to verbalize visual content opportunitiesDetail and deadline orientedSelf-starter, works well independently, high-energyComfortable generating reports from Google Analytics, native social media platform and/or social media management toolsSkilled in Microsoft Office suite, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and ExcelExcellent organizational and follow-up skillsAbility to prioritize multiple tasks and complete them on a timely basisExperience with user-generated content platform such as Social Native (Olapic), Crowdriff or Pixlee a plusExperience with community management platform such as Sprout Social, Hootsuite or Sprinklr a plus
Supervisory Responsibilities
N/A
Key Performance Indicators
Meet digital-origin lead goals within defined budget and timelineMeet content impression/traffic (awareness building) goals within defined budgetComplete reporting tasks both accurately and on timeMeet community management engagement and response time KPIsWorkflow and disseminate user-generated content within defined plan
Work Environment
This is a hybrid position, working at least 2 days a week from our Fort Lauderdale office. The office environment is typical, with quiet-to-moderate noise generated by computer printer, fax machine and light traffic. Occasional overnight travel may be required.
Physical Demands
Requires sitting, standing, walking, bending, and reaching. May require lifting or pushing up to 25 pounds. Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office machines such as computers, fax machines, calculators, the telephone, and other office equipment.
Expected Hours of Work
The position is fulltime and frequently requires working additional time outside of normal business hours.
companyDescription: Designed to combine the luxury lifestyle of The Ritz-Carlton® and the casual freedom of a yachting vacation, The Ritz-Carlton Yacht Collection will offer voyages on three custom-built yachts. Calling on unique and distinguished destinations alike, most voyages range from seven to ten nights, offering many overnight calls and uniquely curated experiences ashore. Each yacht will feature 149 suites, each with its own private terrace, and accommodate up to 298 guests in a relaxed, casually elegant atmosphere. As with The Ritz-Carlton® on land, each yacht will feature personalized service, elevated dining and luxury amenities. The yachts are also available for private charter.

jobDescription:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
About Our Client
Our client is a gaming startup building an Anime-themed massively multiplayer dungeon building RPG game, blending the best qualities of top-notch action games, role-playing games, and game creation tools into one beautiful social experience. They have raised over $17.5M in seed and Series A funding from a16z GPs. Our client is currently seeing an explosion of interest in Anime in the US: Attack on Titan, Genshin Impact, League of Legends (Battle Academia skins) are early indicators of a greater long-term trend. As Anime fans themselves, they are incredibly excited to be building a 2.5D multiplayer world with an Anime-inspired theme, where players can make their own islands and games (starting with dungeons!) within a single shared world, and add custom art and stories to their creations.
 About the Role: 
As a Lead Technical Artist, you will:
 Work closely with the engineering and art teams to help turn their artists’ vision of a beautiful, anime-themed world into reality  Create tools and pipelines for artists and game designers that will enable artists to efficiently test their ideas and implement their artwork in-engine  Build the no-code tools and interfaces that players will use to create their own dungeons, levels, and mods in their game world 
 Responsibilities: 
 Set the foundation for the tools and workflows that will enable their art and engineering teams to implement their art vision in-engine  Help determine how we can best transform internal technology into user-friendly UGC game creation tools for players to use  Collaborate with engineers, artists, and designers to build tools and pipelines in Godot Engine  Write specific plugins and tools for external software such as Maya and Blender  Finish your mission and tasks with autonomy, occasionally taking on the role of a project lead or producer if necessary 
 Desired Qualifications: 
 5+ years of combined experience in technical art or software engineering roles  3-4+ years on a single project  Character R&D/innovation skills  Specific experience creating user-friendly tools and pipelines tools & pipelines for non-technical artists and designers  Past experience with Maya or Blender, especially Maya art pipelines for game development  Understanding of modeling, texturing, VFX, and animation fundamentals  Expertise in modern programming languages such as C++, Python, and Go  Strong communication and collaboration skills across engineering and art disciplines  Love of games, especially isometric action games such as Hades, MMORPGs like Lost Ark, or games in the sandbox/sim genres 
 Nice-to-Haves: 
 8+ years of experience in technical art  Significant C++ programming experience  Experience with Godot Engine  Abilities in any secondary areas such as modeling, rigging, animating, VFX, or lighting  Past experience working on cross-platform titles or MMORPGs  Familiarity with UGC game platforms and tools like Roblox, Rec Room, Halo Forge, RPG Maker, or Mario Maker  Love for anime and stylized cel-shaded 3D and 2D art styles, and past experience working on projects with kind of look 
Perks
 Unlimited paid time off with 2-week vacation minimum  100% employer-paid medical, vision, and dental insurance for the employee  Competitive tech industry pay  Flexible and remote work culture 
Base Salary: $120,000 to $140,000
companyDescription: Recruiting from Scratch provides recruiting services for companies that need to hire the best talent in software engineering, hardware engineering, product design, product management, and web3.

jobDescription:
Day-to-Day:As a VFX Technical Artist on the Horizon Technical Art team, you will design and implement creative, exciting and dynamic special effects that add depth to our platform. With your experience, you will create aesthetically outstanding visual effects that help communicate essential features to our users and creators.
A VFX Technical Artist is responsible for the technical aspects of art and VFX asset development. This entails working closely with Art and Engineering to develop and support the VFX asset pipeline, animation and rigging tools, materials and textures pipeline, and real-time effects using PopcornFX on a mobile VR platform.
Job Responsibilities:· Partner closely with the engineering, design, and art teams to create various VFX assets, and systems.· Use your artistic skills to draw, paint, model, and animate all the assets that go into final polished VFX.· Find creative and technical solutions that eliminate difficult problems in our unique production environment.· Be a communication bridge between Art, Design, Engineering, and Production· Optimize runtime performance without sacrificing artistic integrity· Design, manage and maintain the vfx pipeline from artists and designers through to deployment.· Quickly solve issues with cross-functional leads.
Basic Qualifications:· Must have experience shipping games using Unity or Unreal, in a professional environment.· Ability to work independently and manage one's time and tasks in an ambiguous environment.· VFX experience using Houdini, C4D, Maya, Unity VFX graph, or Unreal Niagara. (Embergen or Bifrost is a plus).· Experience shipping products with stringent runtime performance constraints, such as complex mobile or 3D applications or games.· A visual portfolio of your VFX work, ideally with technical breakdowns.· Experience profiling and optimizing VFX assets in a real-time engine (Preferably Unity)
Preferred Qualifications:· Hands-on artistic work with VFX & 3D generalist background, Mobile VR experience a plus.· Strongly preferred to have experience in working on a UGC product.· Experience using PopcornFX to create VFX in a professional environment.· Hands-on experience using procedural software such as Houdini or Substance Designer· Experience debugging game content
companyDescription:
Insight Global is a national staffing and services company dedicated to empowering people. We relentlessly pursue opportunities for others, because when we all work together, anything is possible. 

We specialize in sourcing information technology, accounting, finance, and engineering professionals, and delivering service-based solutions to Fortune 1000 clients. Our team spans across more than 67 offices throughout the world and has pledged to place more than 80,000 people in jobs in 2023. 

Insight Global's services extend far beyond just filling roles. In addition to staffing services, we provide culture consulting, diversity, equity and inclusion guidance, specialized health care staffing and resources, and an array of managed services through our managed services division called Evergreen. To learn more about Insight Global, visit insightglobal.com.

jobDescription:
Job Title: Assistant Manager, eRetail Consumer Experience

Division: ACD

Location: New York

Reports To: Senior Manager, eRetail Consumer Experience

Who We Are

For more than a century, L'Oreal has devoted its energy, innovation, and scientific excellence solely to one business: Beauty. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

At L'Oreal Active Cosmetics, our mission is to help everyone in their quest for healthy and beautiful skin. Our division is the world leader in dermo-cosmetics by adding health to beauty. Our brands portfolio includes CeraVe, La Roche-Possay, Vichy, SkinCeuticals offering a range of skincare and haircare products to respond to all expectations linked to beauty and health of the skin.

What You Will Learn

The Active Cosmetics Division (ACD) is looking for a passionate, pro-active and detail-oriented candidate to join the Digital Consumer Experience team responsible for the eRetail.com Skincare business (includes Walmart, Target, Ulta, Walgreens, CVS, and other up-and-coming food/drug accounts).

As a member of the DCX team you will be customer obsessed, focused on delivering digital experiences that enhance our customers' lives across various touchpoints; Curious and pro-active about specific retailer capabilities, leveraging data and customer insights to strategize how content is used across multiple channels/audiences & develop custom playbooks; Results-oriented and excited to build measurable impact with our retail partners and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams.

The role will be responsible for ACD consumer centric content strategy creation, execution, merchandising and other consumer experience projects to meet ACD's objectives and drive best-in-class user experience & business growth. The candidate must have marketing, analytical, digital, writing and research skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and manage internal and external resources to effectively bring projects to life.

Responsibilities

Accountable for the quality of all consumer experiences on specific eRetail businesses

Identify opportunities to optimize or fulfill new customer & partner needs across journeys, to drive customer loyalty, business results, and improve the retailer online and in-store experience

Identify content needs and opportunities. Develop, manage, syndicate, audit & optimize all content: images, videos, enhanced content, product description, attributes, UGC, Ratings & Reviews, diagnostic tools, brand stores, and device optimization.

Ensure the establishment of clear goals and objectives through a content brief for content creators & graphic designers.

Maintain all created content in internal digital asset management system (Opera)

Collaborate with Brand liaisons in the US and international teams to ensure alignment and that all content needs are met. Share best practices within ACD & L'Oreal USA.

Develop and manage a content and merchandising calendar, ensure deadlines are met.

Collaborate with Sales & Media teams to ensure your content strategy and media/promo plans are working together for optimal sale and conversion and identify opportunities to increase awareness and visibility for ACD Brands.

Collaborate with internal teams to ensure PDP copy (above the fold & below the fold) are optimized for SEO to achieve ranking and visibility

Product catalog management for internal and external tools (OPERA, Edge, and other systems as needed)

Have ambition to pursue new projects and drive new ideas to evolve responsibilities

Data & Reporting

Track, analyze, and communicate program performance; recommend action plans to address variances in performance against annual plan

Analyze retailer reporting dashboards, run relevant reports, and measure & present findings on content performance, sales, conversion, engagement, consumer sentiment, AB tests and competitors in the beauty category.

Identify and monitor the latest trends in content marketing and consumer insights. Analyze & translate consumer insights into meaningful actions and data-driven plans

Publish reports summarizing your CX Wins, Opportunities, & Initiatives to senior management on a weekly basis.

Requirements

What We Are Looking For:

2+ years of digital, marketing, or content creation experience

Strong understanding of the Digital Industry. Beauty/skincare and content experience a plus

High proficiency in MS Office: Excel and PowerPoint are a must have skill. Ability to create high impact presentations and proficiency in telling a cohesive story

Must be skilled at executing within tight timeframes with excellent attention to detail, accuracy, and a sense of urgency.

Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet multiple, competing deadlines

Strong Communication skills

Must demonstrate strong analytical, organizational, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills

Able to pull, mine, and synthesize across multiple data sources to formulate insights

Promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork across organizational functions

A no task is too small attitude

Process-oriented mindset along with high level of curiosity

Ability to take initiative, act proactively & drive projects to the finish line

Must be comfortable with high degree of virtual ways of working

What's In It For You

Salary Range: $81,300-$113,800 (The actual compensation will depend on a variety of job-related factors which may include geographic location, work experience, education, and skill level)

(Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Pension Plan)

(Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Vacation Buy Program, Volunteer Time, Summer Fridays & More!)

VIP Access to L'Oreal's Internal Shop for Discounted Products, Monthly Mobile Allowance)

(Unlimited Access to E-learnings, Lunch & Learn Sessions, Mentorship Programs, & More!)

(Think Tanks and Innovation Squads)

Access to Mental Health & Wellness Programs

Don't meet every single requirement? At L'Oreal, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and innovative workplace. If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the qualifications listed in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways! You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.
 If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time.
Our Safe Together Plan: Your safety is our highest priority. We will proceed with caution and adhere to enhanced protection standards to ensure our sites are safe for all employees. We must all operate with the shared responsibility for each other's health & safety in mind.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.
companyDescription: L'OREAL USA S/D, INC. is a pharmaceuticals company based out of 133 TERMINAL AVE, Clark, New Jersey, United States.

jobDescription:
Who We Are
Chomps’ is reimagining best-for-you snacking with its signature meat snacks, made from the highest quality humanely raised proteins, no sugar, and containing only natural ingredients that doesn't compromise on taste. The Chomps mission is to inspire, educate, and fuel our community with accessible, sustainable, real food that tastes great. Chomps is the fastest growing all-natural meat snack brand and can currently be found in over 15,000 stores nationwide with a strong e-commerce presence.
Who You Are // What You Will DoWe are looking for someone who knows how to cut through the noise of CPG. We want to build a brand that doesn’t check the boxes, but one that focuses on storytelling that works.You understand how to work with senior leadership to ideate, concept, and wireframe activations that go beyond driving “awareness” but rather driving brand recall.We believe that marketing is no longer a one-size-fits-all approach for our channels. You should understand how to think of the big idea/picture but then work with our channel managers across organic and paid media to figure out how that messaging and communication comes to life in each of their respective worlds.You will be the SME in all things:Marketing Planning and Budgeting,Big Picture Brand Development (Chomps on the moon?)Brand Campaign Briefing and DevelopmentMarketing Calendar OwnershipChannel Strategy EvolutionConsumer InsightsYou will set the vision for your growing team (internal and external) that owns:Trade + Shopper MarketingSocial & CommunityContent CreationOwned MediaInfluencer MarketingPR & PartnershipsExperiential MarketingEvents MarketingYou will work hand in hand with innovation to ensure consumer and market insights are at core of our work.You will spearhead marketing research agenda to turn those insights into meaningful work in packaging, product, and channel innovation.As the brand team lead, you will build a culture and mindset within your team that allows everyone the appetite to test, fail, pivot and identify what is working so that we can scale those activities up.
This person will be reporting to Stacey Hartnett, VP of Marketing and E-Commerce, and working closely with our founder, Pete Maldonado. This role is open to being 100% remote within the US.
Traits of a Chompian
You are self-motivated and action oriented, with a team player mindset. You are curious, creative, and agile
especially when it comes to the ever-changing landscape of marketing and consumer behavior. You have no problem being an independent problem-solver. You are a critical thinker and when it comes to managing multiple tasks at once, you know how to get the job done. You take complete ownership of everything you do and drive initiatives to completion. You have an “entrepreneurial” mindset and go the extra mile for your company and customers. You have a hunger to learn and passion for continuous improvement. You are a competitor by nature and have a track record of success. You take a keen interest in health, fitness, and nutrition and love sharing that with others through your creative ideas.
ResponsibilitiesLead annual brand planning and development, including consistent ownership of consumer data and competitive landscapeOwn and enhance brand architecture, voice, and visual identity to ensure all consumer and trade touchpoints, in digital, POS, and packaging design, are connected and uniquely ChompsBridge brand work to marketing strategy, leading omnichannel initiatives and working cross-functionally on executions that break through the noiseDirect oversight of narrative in all owned marketing channels (social, influencer and partnerships, experiential, website, email, PR and earned media etc.)Shopper marketing and consumer promotions, collaborating closely with wholesale and ecommerce sales teamsOwn annual marketing budget, quarterly reforecasts, and real-time execution. Work in lock-step with the finance team on brand investment strategy and impact.Foster and execute a learning agenda through research, evaluation, and testing across all function levers (channels, tactics, targeting / audiences, creative / copy, partners, etc.)Play a critical role in our innovation strategy by being our connection to the consumer from both a quantitative and qualitative perspective.Consumer Insights, Trends, Campaign ideation etc.Present results and insights including recommendations and process enhancements to leadership and management teamsOwn resource planning for the brand function across internal and external teams. Lead current team of 3 FTE's. Collaborate with the e-commerce, performance marketing, creative, sales and category management teams and third-party agencies to ensure all content needs are met and optimized, yet consistentAs part of the Chomps leadership team, you will help support critical strategic business initiatives and top-to-top meetings and presentation support.
Who You Are
BA Required7-10+ years of experience in brand management and brand development with high growth, omnichannel consumer brand5+ years of experience in CPG, food or beverage requiredBroad range of marketing knowledge growing a consumer brand, with expertise from brand management and development to media buying and channel strategyThrough experience you have created a successful marketing "playbook", but have the ability to carve your own path, test and learn, and stay at the forefront of the latest and greatest brand/content/marketing strategies.Experience with budget ownership with understanding of how investments impact business results across core brand metrics and sales KPIs360 Thinker: You understand the power of combining media + messaging and have experience developing content for paid and owned channels, including video, content, social media, OOH, packaging, email, and eventsDemonstrated creative and idea leadership with desire to pioneer (comfortable with ambiguity and “finding a way”)Culture, news, and industry obsessed. Ability to translate consumer behavior and trends into impactful marketing contentExperience working directly with both internal and external creative partners, copywriters, and UGC partners to execute brand and creative visionExperience building a team and resource planning. Know how to lead internal and external teams in a positive, productive, and efficient manner.Results oriented. Highly analytical and data-driven mindsetOutstanding communication (both verbal and written) and relationship management skillsComfortable leading multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, ever changing environment
What You’ll Get
Make an impact: Join a rapidly growing and entrepreneurial-spirited team at a pivotal point to positively impact the food industryUpward mobility: Grow within Chomps quickly based on outstanding performanceCompetitive pay: We offer competitive compensation packages to top talent. We win together.Comprehensive benefits: Health/vision/dental, 401K matching, unlimited time off, wellness stipendEnough meat sticks such that if you wanted to eat your body weight in them you could (and with no judgment from anyone)

companyDescription:
Chomps is a better-for-you meat snack brand with products made from the highest-quality, sustainably sourced proteins and no hidden, harmful ingredients. Chomps beef and venison are 100% grass-fed and finished, our turkey is free range, and all of our proteins are hormone free, antibiotic free, and humanely raised.  Chomps meat snacks never contain added sugar, artificial preservatives or colors, MSG or fillers and are free from the top 8 allergens. Our mission is to inspire a healthier way of snacking by providing high-quality, protein-packed snacks with simple, real food ingredients. At Chomps, there are no compromises or cutting corners - our products are delicious and nutritious. 

Find us on Amazon, Thrive Market, Chomps.com. With exciting new retail launches, you can now find us in the aisles of Whole Foods, Sprouts, Kroger and Walmart in addition to Trader Joe's, Safeway, Albertson's and other retailers across the country.

jobDescription:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
About Our Client
Our client is a gaming startup building an Anime-themed massively multiplayer dungeon building RPG game, blending the best qualities of top-notch action games, role-playing games, and game creation tools into one beautiful social experience. They have raised over $17.5M in seed and Series A funding from a16z GPs. Our client is currently seeing an explosion of interest in Anime in the US: Attack on Titan, Genshin Impact, League of Legends (Battle Academia skins) are early indicators of a greater long-term trend. As Anime fans themselves, they are incredibly excited to be building a 2.5D multiplayer world with an Anime-inspired theme, where players can make their own islands and games (starting with dungeons!) within a single shared world, and add custom art and stories to their creations.
 About the Role: 
As a Lead Technical Artist, you will:
 Work closely with the engineering and art teams to help turn their artists’ vision of a beautiful, anime-themed world into reality  Create tools and pipelines for artists and game designers that will enable artists to efficiently test their ideas and implement their artwork in-engine  Build the no-code tools and interfaces that players will use to create their own dungeons, levels, and mods in their game world 
 Responsibilities: 
 Set the foundation for the tools and workflows that will enable their art and engineering teams to implement their art vision in-engine  Help determine how we can best transform internal technology into user-friendly UGC game creation tools for players to use  Collaborate with engineers, artists, and designers to build tools and pipelines in Godot Engine  Write specific plugins and tools for external software such as Maya and Blender  Finish your mission and tasks with autonomy, occasionally taking on the role of a project lead or producer if necessary 
 Desired Qualifications: 
 5+ years of combined experience in technical art or software engineering roles  3-4+ years on a single project  Character R&D/innovation skills  Specific experience creating user-friendly tools and pipelines tools & pipelines for non-technical artists and designers  Past experience with Maya or Blender, especially Maya art pipelines for game development  Understanding of modeling, texturing, VFX, and animation fundamentals  Expertise in modern programming languages such as C++, Python, and Go  Strong communication and collaboration skills across engineering and art disciplines  Love of games, especially isometric action games such as Hades, MMORPGs like Lost Ark, or games in the sandbox/sim genres 
 Nice-to-Haves: 
 8+ years of experience in technical art  Significant C++ programming experience  Experience with Godot Engine  Abilities in any secondary areas such as modeling, rigging, animating, VFX, or lighting  Past experience working on cross-platform titles or MMORPGs  Familiarity with UGC game platforms and tools like Roblox, Rec Room, Halo Forge, RPG Maker, or Mario Maker  Love for anime and stylized cel-shaded 3D and 2D art styles, and past experience working on projects with kind of look 
Perks
 Unlimited paid time off with 2-week vacation minimum  100% employer-paid medical, vision, and dental insurance for the employee  Competitive tech industry pay  Flexible and remote work culture 
Base Salary: $120,000 to $140,000
companyDescription: Recruiting from Scratch provides recruiting services for companies that need to hire the best talent in software engineering, hardware engineering, product design, product management, and web3.

jobDescription:
Tombras, a 475+ person, full-service, national advertising agency with a digital mindset, is seeking a Social Brand Manager.
Location: Knoxville or Remote
Who you are: The Brand Manager, Social Media is the role responsible for owning and managing one (or multiple) brand social presences online through content ideation and planning, social strategy development, monthly/quarterly reporting including learnings and insights, project management, real-time client + internal POVs, and more.
You'll be responsible for growing a brand's social media impact while aligning with their social goals and objectives. This is a highly collaborative role that will have you working closely with Social Media Community Manager, Sr. Social Media Brand Managers, creative teams and account teams.
What you'll be doing:
 Creating, owning and sharing social media calendars with clients in collaboration with creative teamsOwning all performance reports including data analytics, post recaps, learnings, insights and opportunities/recommendationsCollaborating with Sr. Brand Managers and Associate Social Media Directors to develop impactful social strategies that can strengthen and grow your brandPartnering with Social Media Community Managers on real-time opportunities and audience-based learning from UGC, engagement and trendsDirectly interacting with clients to provide expertise and social-first solutionsStaying up to date on social algorithm changes or emerging platformsProviding holistic thinking and recommendations that might include influencer opportunities, boosting recommendations and more

What you bring:
3+ years of experience in a social media role, can range from client-side or advertising agency experienceA comprehensive understanding of social media marketing ranging from content calendar building to social strategy developmentStrong data and reporting skills to provide strategic insights and actionable recommendations that align with overarching goalsAbility to own projects from start to finish, this includes asking the right questions to best understand asks and define a path forwardAdvanced proficiency in native social media platforms and third party tools for content management/social listeningDisplays the ability to lead the calendar creation process, from strategic planning to client review and final productProactively follows competitive and real-time trends through a socially strategic lensPossesses an advanced understanding of reporting metrics and the ability to provide strategic recommendations based on social communications planDisplays competence to navigate more complex, strategic needs in client-facing role Demonstrates an understanding of paid social strategy and capabilities

Why you’ll want to work at Tombras:
You’ll be joining one of the top independent agencies in North America. Connecting Data & Creativity for Business Results® is working for our clients and creating a flywheel affect fueling both client and agency growth. You’ll be a part of a highly creative agency that has been recognized by AdAge, Adweek, Communication Arts, Fast Company, Forbes and Fortune. Tombras was named a 2022 AdAge A-List Standout Agency and Adweek's 2022 U.S. Agency of the Year Shortlist.
Tombras Benefits:
Family - It comes first, on every list. Tombras has been family-run since day 1, we strive to facilitate a family-oriented environment rooted in supporting one another.
Dog-friendly office(Knoxville)
Unlimited PTO
Generous parental leave for primary and non-primary caregivers.
Medical (PPO or High Deductible option) for employee + dependents
401(k) Participation + 3% employer match
Employer-paid Dental & Vision
A company culture of promotions from within and an atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development.
New, Modern building in Downtown Knoxville
Want more reasons to work at Tombras? Check out the latest Tombras News and Our Values.
Tombras is proud to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. Job may require traveling overnight, driving long distances as required and sitting for extended periods of time with occasional walking and standing and occasionally lifting or carrying articles weighing less than 10 pounds.
Remote employees must be based in the United States.
companyDescription:
Tombras is a 400+ person, full-service agency with a digital mindset. We are one of the top independent agencies in North America. We are united by our philosophy: Connecting Data & Creativity for Business Results.®

2020 ADWEEK Fastest Growing Global Agencies
2019 Ad Age A-List Agencies to Watch
2018 Effie Index #3 Most Effective Independent Agency in North America
2018 Fast Company World's Most Innovative Companies
2017 Forbes Marketing Success Story of the Year 

Clients include Orangetheory Fitness, MoonPie, BUSH's Beans, Pernod Ricard, Big Lots, Mozilla Firefox, Samsung, Zaxby's and ESPN

jobDescription:
👋 In case we've never met before, we're WebMechanix - an award-winning digital marketing agency based in Columbia, MD. We run high-impact performance marketing programs for over 65+ clients, which means we manage a lot of advertising campaigns across a lot of brands that need our creative support.

As a Designer, you are responsible for all basic digital design tasks, including but not limited to: video ads (animated and UGC), social media ads, banner ads, and landing page designs.

You will work independently or alongside art directors and creative directors to create relevant concepts and then execute those concepts once approved. It will be important for you to absorb and retain key information about our client’s brands, target audiences, and other mandatories and apply those to your work.

In addition, this role is responsible for responding to other creative tasks to support our clients (e.g., revisions, fixes, re-sizing, etc.).

Here's what you'll do:
Execute full-cycle visual design stages from concept to final hand-offDesign ad creative for major digital ad networks (Google Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, etc.)Design and produce videos that helps drive customer engagement and conversion, including concepting and editing of UGC creativeDirect and work with talent for UGC content and voice actorsUse data-driven decisions to improve designs over timeReceive and incorporate critical feedback regarding design decisionsPresent and defend designs and key deliverables to peers and other stakeholders, including clientsSupport and align with design guidelines, best practices and standardsStay up-to-date with the latest trends, techniques and technologiesProvide guidance and mentorship to junior team members when requested

Requirements

Here is what you have: Working knowledge of creative production:Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro)Visual Design Tools for the web (Figma)Researching brands and products to inform creative conceptingDemonstrated proficiency in executing classic design principlesWorking knowledge of digital advertising:Platform advertising specs and best practices (e.g., for Google Display Network, Facebook ads, LinkedIn advertising, etc.)Media platform requirements (and where to find and apply them)Thorough knowledge of usability practices:Other Wireframing and Visual Design Tools (Miro, Adobe XD, etc.)User Accessibility and ADA principlesDesigning and building to cross-browser compatibilityThorough knowledge of workflow management & optimizationExcellent time management skills and strict adherence to deadlinesOperating in the best practices of our core workflow systems (eg. Asana, Slack, Google Workspace, Harvest, etc.)
Benefits

Here’s what we offer: 🌴 Unlimited Paid Time Off (w/ a 2-week minimum usage per year)👶 8 Weeks Paid Family Leave (for the birth of a new child or to treat yourself or family members for an illness)👩‍⚕️ Health InsuranceCareFirst Advantage HSA & Non-HSA OptionCarefirst Dental and VisionWeighted contributions covering varying portions of individuals and families💰 401(k) and 401(k) Roth Retirement Plans w/ 3% employer match🖥️ $500 initial equipment stipend w/ additional $250 per year🕝 Flexible working hours based on your timezone💻 Fully remote (but we have an office in Columbia, MD if on-site is important for you!)📅 13.5 Paid Holidays💡 Knowledge Bomb Training (We encourage employees to present on topics they feel passionate about and also present on employer-sponsored topics)👩‍🏫 Monthly Mentorship Meetings to ensure there is always time dedicated to you with your manager...and more! Ask us about our favorite benefits! ❤️ 

Here’s where to learn more:
See what employees have to say on GlassdoorSee what clients have to say on ClutchShoot us an email at jobs@webmechanix.com if you have any questions! 

WebMechanix is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other category covered by the law.

U.S. Residents only

The estimated salary range for this position is $50,000 - $70,000.

If you don't feel that you meet all of the requirements listed in this job description, don't worry! Even if your past experience doesn't match up perfectly with the job description, we still encourage you to apply. Research indicates that women and people of color are less likely to submit job applications unless they feel they meet all the requirements. At WebMechanix, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. Therefore, we encourage you to submit an application if you are interested so we can keep you in mind not only for this role and similar roles but for future openings, as well.
companyDescription:
Hi, we're WebMechanix 👋

The performance marketing agency that makes you smarter. 

Inspired search, social, UX & data strategies for brands that get it. 

How can we help you win today?

☑ Data
☑ Creative
☑ UX/CRO
☑ Media ...

Welcome to Revenue-Driven Optimization.

Go to WebMechanix.com & signup for our email list to get the latest Podcasts, videos, guides, tear-downs & innovations hot off the press.

And when you sign up, you'll unlock our FULL gated content vault, including over $795 of paid courses & content products. 

PS -- we only send stuff we'd enjoy consuming ourselves :)

jobDescription:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
About Our Client
Our client is a gaming startup building an Anime-themed massively multiplayer dungeon building RPG game, blending the best qualities of top-notch action games, role-playing games, and game creation tools into one beautiful social experience. They have raised over $17.5M in seed and Series A funding from a16z GPs. Our client is currently seeing an explosion of interest in Anime in the US: Attack on Titan, Genshin Impact, League of Legends (Battle Academia skins) are early indicators of a greater long-term trend. As Anime fans themselves, they are incredibly excited to be building a 2.5D multiplayer world with an Anime-inspired theme, where players can make their own islands and games (starting with dungeons!) within a single shared world, and add custom art and stories to their creations.
 About the Role: 
As a Lead Technical Artist, you will:
 Work closely with the engineering and art teams to help turn their artists’ vision of a beautiful, anime-themed world into reality  Create tools and pipelines for artists and game designers that will enable artists to efficiently test their ideas and implement their artwork in-engine  Build the no-code tools and interfaces that players will use to create their own dungeons, levels, and mods in their game world 
 Responsibilities: 
 Set the foundation for the tools and workflows that will enable their art and engineering teams to implement their art vision in-engine  Help determine how we can best transform internal technology into user-friendly UGC game creation tools for players to use  Collaborate with engineers, artists, and designers to build tools and pipelines in Godot Engine  Write specific plugins and tools for external software such as Maya and Blender  Finish your mission and tasks with autonomy, occasionally taking on the role of a project lead or producer if necessary 
 Desired Qualifications: 
 5+ years of combined experience in technical art or software engineering roles  3-4+ years on a single project  Character R&D/innovation skills  Specific experience creating user-friendly tools and pipelines tools & pipelines for non-technical artists and designers  Past experience with Maya or Blender, especially Maya art pipelines for game development  Understanding of modeling, texturing, VFX, and animation fundamentals  Expertise in modern programming languages such as C++, Python, and Go  Strong communication and collaboration skills across engineering and art disciplines  Love of games, especially isometric action games such as Hades, MMORPGs like Lost Ark, or games in the sandbox/sim genres 
 Nice-to-Haves: 
 8+ years of experience in technical art  Significant C++ programming experience  Experience with Godot Engine  Abilities in any secondary areas such as modeling, rigging, animating, VFX, or lighting  Past experience working on cross-platform titles or MMORPGs  Familiarity with UGC game platforms and tools like Roblox, Rec Room, Halo Forge, RPG Maker, or Mario Maker  Love for anime and stylized cel-shaded 3D and 2D art styles, and past experience working on projects with kind of look 
Perks
 Unlimited paid time off with 2-week vacation minimum  100% employer-paid medical, vision, and dental insurance for the employee  Competitive tech industry pay  Flexible and remote work culture 
Base Salary: $120,000 to $140,000

jobDescription:
WE DEVELOP INNOVATIVE BEVERAGE BRANDS FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF DRINKERS.

Born in Austin, TX. BeatBox Beverages is a collection of millennial founders and established industry veterans developing innovative beverage brands for the next generation of drinkers. BeatBox Beverages was founded on the belief that future generations will continue to demand products that authentically connect with their lifestyle. Our mission is to create cutting-edge beverage brands that speak to innovative individuals.

Director of Content

at BeatBox

Remote

About BeatBox

BEATBOX IS THE ORIGINAL PARTY PUNCH BRAND - WE BRING THE PARTY! 

Born in Austin, TX. BeatBox is a collection of millennial founders and established industry veterans developing innovative beverage brands for the next generation of drinkers. BeatBox was founded on the belief that future generations will continue to demand products that authentically connect with their lifestyle. Our mission is to create cutting-edge beverage brands that speak to innovative individuals.

BeatBox is one of the top selling Ready-to-Drink Alcohol Brands in the U.S and the #1 Fastest Growing Alcohol Brand on Social Media. Currently sold in over 45,000+ retailers across the U.S., including Kroger, 7-Eleven, Circle K, GoPuff, Walmart, and many more. We are looking for problem solvers, innovators, and dreamers who are looking for anything but business as usual. Like us, you're a high performer who's an expert at your craft, constantly challenging the status quo.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly creative and experienced Director of Content to lead the development and execution of our online content strategy at BeatBox. The right candidate will work closely with BeatBox internal marketing team to conceptualize and create impactful digital content that connects with our target audience and drives brand growth online. The ideal candidate is equal parts a storyteller and an editor - versed in popular platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, podcasting, and more.

Responsibilities:
Develop and execute the short-form and long-form content strategy for all social media channels - Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, podcasting, Twitter, and moreConceptualize and execute creative video and content briefs for social media to support new market launches, new flavors, and major marketing eventsPartner with Digital & Social teams and Field Marketing to capture original content and UGCShoot social-first native content, interviews, viral videos, music festivals, etc. Edit and coordinate content delivered by videographers and freelancers into high-performing social contentWork with internal teams, influencers, and freelance partners to develop content plansWork closely with our Influencer Manager and influencer partners to drive the BeatBox brand narrative through their social platformsStay current on high-performing and trending content formats across social media platformsHire and manage a roster of digital production crews, producers, videographers, and editors for out-of-house content productionMaintain production schedules and route content for approvals to internal stakeholders and management

Requirements:
7+ years of experience in a content creation role, with a strong focus on social mediaExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExpert knowledge of high-performing and trending content formats across social media platformsAbility to lead and manage a team of creatives and production crews

If you are a passionate and driven content creator with a proven track record of creating impactful content, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join the Beatbox Beverages team and help us bring our brand to life through creative and engaging content.

BeatBox Beverages provides a fair and equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, marital status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. BeatBox Beverages hires and promotes individuals solely based on qualifications for the position to be filled and business needs.
companyDescription:
BeatBox - The World’s Tastiest Party Punch 🎉 Drawn together by their love for music and the entrepreneurial spirit of Austin, Texas, the founders of BeatBox always believed experiences are more fun when they are shared with friends. So began their journey to mix friends, fun, and flavor into something that could help everyone party beyond basic. The result? The World’s Tastiest Party Punch, for those who are determined to beat boring.
#PartyBetter

jobTitle: Native Mobile UX Design Lead - Social & Community
jobDescription:
Our Opportunity

We are seeking a Native Mobile UX Design Lead - Social & Community in Bellevue, WA | Boston, MA | Minneapolis, MN | Plantation, FL or potentially remote. Chewy is dedicated to being the most trusted and convenient online destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. The New Verticals Team is a newly founded start-up organization within Chewy that is tasked with building novel businesses and experiences that have the potential to drive Chewy's future growth. Our goal is to innovate from within Chewy, crafting experiences that aim to delight and connect pet parents.

We are seeking a foundational product designer to join the New Verticals team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and visionary thinker adept designing innovative, well-crafted, customer-centric mobile experiences. You know how to create large scale community powered UGC products that delight, engage, and inspire pet parents in the most elegant and enjoyable way possible. This requires thinking big, continuous innovation, a bias for action, coupled with thoughtful experimentation.

What You’ll Do
Build end to end user experiences: Discovery and concept ideation, flows and wireframes, full-fidelity prototype designs, functional specs. Transform customer and business objectives into engaging social products that are feasible to build. Innovate across a range of products, platforms, and devices with a bias for action and crisp management of multiple priorities. Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other designers.Create designs, prototypes, and artifacts to facilitate user testing and apply learnings to designsChampion invention and innovation to unite a growing suite of products Clearly present your design process, inspiration, and decisions Collaborate with engineering to ensure visual quality and finesse of the product and user experienceNurture Chewy's culture and principles within the group and set new standards for executional and operational excellence. 
What You'll Need
7+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role. 4+ years of experience leading large-scale mobile initiatives Most recent 2+ years designing interactive UGC social experiences for iOS and Android A track record of designing high-quality digital products that delivered results and demonstrate the depth of your design leadership skills; illustrated in a portfolio or case studies. Achieved mastery of a core set of design skills in interaction design, information architecture, and user interface design. Demonstrated communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills that communicate complex concepts clearly A proven ability to evaluate the customer and business impact of your design decisions inside and outside of your own product area. Bachelor's degree (or an equivalent degree) in Design, HCI, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience with the design field. 
Bonus
Experience designing complex UGC mobile products and experiences Demonstrated ability to manage end to end process from discovery to delivery Thrives in fast paced, start-up environment Can flex in other areas such as IA or UX/UI or VD 
Deliver Results

As an expert in user experience design, you turn your deep knowledge of our customers into products that deliver compelling value for the customer and the business. You carefully plan and drive the creative process for large, complex products to make sure that design delivers and continuously raises the bar. You use customer outcomes and business metrics to hold yourself accountable at every step of the process.

Earn Trust

You build trust across the organization by helping others achieve their goals. Those trusted relationships help you push the boundaries of design and product innovation to benefit the customer. Your proactive communication style and openness to collaboration across the organization influences people inside and outside the design organization. The knowledge you build enables you to make effective, high-quality, high-judgment decisions.

Operate at Depth

You recognize opportunities for design to drive change, and you have the judgment to choose between evolutionary and revolutionary solutions. Your judgment allows you to make smart trade-offs and compelling arguments to ensure the best outcome for the customer. When you see an issue, you take ownership and build a plan to resolve it.

Build High-Performing Teams

You partner with leadership to develop high-performing teams through modeling and mentorship. Your work and style encourage innovation and calculated risk-taking in a safe environment to drive team learning. You build well-structured plans that ensure high-quality designs are delivered on time. You identify performance issues and help leadership address them quickly.

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.

If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.

To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.
companyDescription:
At Chewy, our mission is to be the most trusted and convenient destination for pet parents (and partners), everywhere. We view pets and pet parents as family, and are obsessed with meeting their needs and exceeding customer expectations through every interaction. Behind the scenes, our talented teams are made up of innovators, delighters, big-thinkers and of course, passionate pet people—creating a place where you'll be empowered to build, growand unleash your fullest potential.

Launched in 2011, we offer the personalized service of a neighborhood pet store alongside the convenience and speed of e-commerce. Customers love shopping our wide selection of products of more than 100,000 products (including our Private brands and prescription Rx food and Rx medication products), which we offer at competitive prices, fast 1-2 day shipping and around-the-clock convenience that only e-commerce can offer.

Chewy’s commitment to customer service is the core of our brand, and our customers love us for it. We “WOW” pet parents through 24/7 assistance, advice and encouragement every day of the year. We make pet parenting easy with our convenient Autoship subscription program—which allows our customers to schedule their orders, so they never run out of their pet food, supplies and medication they need.

As an e-commerce company, product innovation drives our operations, and our team is constantly striving to find new and better ways to improve our customers’ experience. From an easy-­to-­navigate website and highly rated mobile apps, to detailed order tracking and personalized “Pet Profile” features, we are transforming the way pet parents shop.

jobDescription:
We're looking for a talented Content (UGC) Creator to create short-form videos for Crossrope, a unique jump rope fitness brand. The ideal candidate is well-versed with creating unique short-form Instagram Reels and TikTok videos, has a passion for health & fitness, and has the skills to capitalize on new trends.

Who We’re Looking For
 A creator who has passion for health & fitness  You love jumping rope  Based in the Raleigh, NC area  Comfortable in front of camera  Experience building brand personality  Ability to meet deadlines and work independently  Understanding current trends on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube  Ability to create videos with knowledge of lighting, camera angles, and compelling hooks 
To be considered for this role, please make sure to complete our application which includes:
 Share your social media channels where you’re most active (IG, TT, YT)  Why you're interested in creating content for Crossrope  What experience you have with fitness and jumping rope  Examples of content you’ve created that you’re proud of 
This is a paid contract position: $2,000-3,000 per month, with a goal of 40+ videos each month

Why Crossrope?

Crossrope is a fast-growing fitness brand that delivers an engaging jump rope workout experience to customers around the globe. Our products inspire people to find joy and confidence by getting fit in a different and accessible way. Through jump rope fitness, you can help create a meaningful impact on millions of lives.

Crossrope’s fitness app has been rated with thousands of five-star reviews by people worldwide and has been featured in top fitness and mainstream publications including Shape, Business Insider, and The Wall Street Journal.

Crossrope provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
companyDescription:
At Crossrope, we believe everyone deserves a fun and accessible workout. We’re on a mission to inspire millions of people to experience a different way to get fit through jump rope fitness.

We are a dedicated, energetic team focused on showing people there is a different way to get fit. For more information on our culture and current opportunities: https://www.crossrope.com/careers

It's time to join the movement.
#wejump

jobDescription:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:  
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
About Our Client
Our client is a gaming startup building an Anime-themed massively multiplayer dungeon building RPG game, blending the best qualities of top-notch action games, role-playing games, and game creation tools into one beautiful social experience. They have raised over $17.5M in seed and Series A funding from a16z GPs. Our client is currently seeing an explosion of interest in Anime in the US: Attack on Titan, Genshin Impact, League of Legends (Battle Academia skins) are early indicators of a greater long-term trend. As Anime fans themselves, they are incredibly excited to be building a 2.5D multiplayer world with an Anime-inspired theme, where players can make their own islands and games (starting with dungeons!) within a single shared world, and add custom art and stories to their creations.
 About the Role: 
As a Lead Technical Artist, you will:
 Work closely with the engineering and art teams to help turn their artists’ vision of a beautiful, anime-themed world into reality  Create tools and pipelines for artists and game designers that will enable artists to efficiently test their ideas and implement their artwork in-engine  Build the no-code tools and interfaces that players will use to create their own dungeons, levels, and mods in their game world 
 Responsibilities: 
 Set the foundation for the tools and workflows that will enable their art and engineering teams to implement their art vision in-engine  Help determine how we can best transform internal technology into user-friendly UGC game creation tools for players to use  Collaborate with engineers, artists, and designers to build tools and pipelines in Godot Engine  Write specific plugins and tools for external software such as Maya and Blender  Finish your mission and tasks with autonomy, occasionally taking on the role of a project lead or producer if necessary 
 Desired Qualifications: 
 5+ years of combined experience in technical art or software engineering roles  3-4+ years on a single project  Character R&D/innovation skills  Specific experience creating user-friendly tools and pipelines tools & pipelines for non-technical artists and designers  Past experience with Maya or Blender, especially Maya art pipelines for game development  Understanding of modeling, texturing, VFX, and animation fundamentals  Expertise in modern programming languages such as C++, Python, and Go  Strong communication and collaboration skills across engineering and art disciplines  Love of games, especially isometric action games such as Hades, MMORPGs like Lost Ark, or games in the sandbox/sim genres 
 Nice-to-Haves: 
 8+ years of experience in technical art  Significant C++ programming experience  Experience with Godot Engine  Abilities in any secondary areas such as modeling, rigging, animating, VFX, or lighting  Past experience working on cross-platform titles or MMORPGs  Familiarity with UGC game platforms and tools like Roblox, Rec Room, Halo Forge, RPG Maker, or Mario Maker  Love for anime and stylized cel-shaded 3D and 2D art styles, and past experience working on projects with kind of look 
Perks
 Unlimited paid time off with 2-week vacation minimum  100% employer-paid medical, vision, and dental insurance for the employee  Competitive tech industry pay  Flexible and remote work culture 
Base Salary: $120,000 to $140,000

jobDescription:
FUGA provides forward-thinking music distribution, technology, and marketing services to forward-thinking music companies. Working at the heart of the music industry with more than 800 clients, including Beggars Group, Epitaph, Naxos and Ninja Tune, FUGA is the world's leading full-service B2B music distributor.

FUGA works at the forefront of music distribution technology, connecting its clients with digital service providers like Spotify, Apple Music, and Amazon Music while helping them get the most from their music, whether that's with award-nominated label services, industry-leading revenue accounting, or using FUGA's suite of best-in-class products.

Owned by Downtown Music Holdings, FUGA is an independent company and is one of the very few distributors to sit on the highest preferred partner tiers for all the major DSPs.

We are looking for a Client Integrations Coordinator to support our Operations team and our growing global client base. You will work directly within the Americas Operations team, who are the first point of contact for record labels and distributors in that region and abroad.

What You Do:

You will have a front-facing role with new partners and clients, working within a team that guides them as they move their catalog onto FUGA's platform, as well as investigating and escalating issues within our operations team on their behalf.

Main components of the day-to-day are:
Assisting Client Integration Managers during the client integration process (account creation, platform introduction and training, DSP connections, catalog migration)Taking part in the planning, coordination and delivery of required work to support our client's business needsHelping manage the escalation and resolution of client issues to the development and global operations teams, when requiredProviding email support to both new and existing clientsInvestigating, troubleshooting and where possible solving technical and content-related issuesCreating support documentation and training guides

Who You Are:

We are looking for someone who is passionate about music and has a functional understanding of digital supply chain operations.
Experience in a client facing support roleBilingual in English and SpanishIndependent worker / plannerStrong communication, analytical and investigative skills, and motivated to develop these skills furtherOrganized and comfortable tracking and prioritizing multiple issuesWillingness to learn and comfortable receiving constructive feedbackAble to work under time pressureComfortable working in an AGILE environmentKnowledge of the digital music consumer landscapeAn understanding of how FUGA, or a similar music delivery platform, worksAn understanding of YouTube Content ID and further UGC servicesAn understanding of music metadata issues

Who We Are:
A growing company with strong ambitionsThis role is part of a growing and resourceful international team, split between our head office in Amsterdam; satellite offices in New York, London, Los Angeles, Paris, Rome, Berlin and Seoul; with representatives in Rio de Janeiro, Bogota, Mexico City, Buenos Aires, Stockholm, Sydney, Singapore and TokyoAn international business environment made up of colleagues and clients around the world with diverse backgrounds in music and tech

FUGA provides base salary ranges for all positions located in the United States at the time of posting. The hiring range for this role is $50,000 - $54,000 annually. As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon various factors including, but not limited to, work experience, geographic location and relevant skills.
companyDescription: The world’s leading B2B distributor. Forward-thinking music distribution and marketing services. Industry-leading technology.

jobDescription:
Location: In Office 5 days/week in LA office
Who We Are:
Thrive Causemetics is Bigger Than Beauty™: We are an independent, female-owned beauty brand that creates high-performance vegan cosmetics and supports a community of giving. All of Thrive Causemetics' products are free of parabens and sulfates, in addition to being 100 percent cruelty-free. Through its Bigger Than Beauty™ program, every product purchased results in a donation to help communities thrive.Thrive Causemetics is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and cross-functional workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We are committed to being pioneers in creating a culture of wellness. Together, we prioritize a strong work ethic while maintaining a positive, exciting environment where people are passionate about what they do.
Who We Are Looking For:
A digital marketing leader who will drive strategy for two brands; Thrive Causemetics (cosmetics) and Bigger Than Beauty (skincare), on owned social media content, influencer and community management, as well as eventing and outreach. This person will oversee the planning, execution and measurement of brand owned social and advocacy channels, help build content plans for all owned channels, and identify new social opportunities and execution. Collaboration is key in this role, which sits within the Marketing team and will work closely with the growth, creative, product marketing, giving, and customer service teams to fuel the digital conversation with our community. This person will be an integral part of the team, with great leadership skills, and will bring innovative thinking to all marketing campaigns by playing a pivotal role in the overall growth and awareness of the brand. There will be a team of 5 direct reports under this role.
What you will be doing:
Lead the consumer engagement strategy on all social media channelsDevelop overall strategy for social media, content, influencer marketing and community managementDevelop KPIs and reporting to analyze performance and ROIBuild and support holistic marketing plans for new launches and maintaining coreCreate internal partnerships with cross functional teams to maximize on consumer engagement and content (i.e. Customer Experience, Produce Marketing, Product Development, Creative, Giving)Manage the development of the content calendar across all social platforms to support “always on” evergreen content, campaigns needs, giving programs and partnership needsStrengthen all social, influencer and PR outlets by developing engaging content specific to Thrive CausemeticsCreate and lead media and PR programs and relationships to increase engagement and awarenessLead eventing on all channels to develop effective relationships to drive brand love and enhancing Develop a stream of UGC for organic contentStay up to date on trend and competition - especially in new platform innovationsManage strategic partnership activations, including sourcing, negotiating, implementation, activation and press coverageOversee development of all press materials

What will make you stand out:
Passionate about the Thrive Causemetics brand and mission7+ years experience in social, brand-building, content and digital experience (within beauty a plus)Accomplished in leading strategy on social marketing, influencer marketing, and brand awareness activationsStrong content development experience with ability to discern and plan content needs by channelComfortable flexing between high-level planning and detailed executionMust be a leader with proven track record in managing a team efficiently and effectivelyExtremely detail-oriented, with a strong creative sideOrganized with operational knowledge of planning tools, such as Dash Hudson or AsanaStrategic thinker with a keen understanding of analytics and social reporting, such as Traacker and Melt WaterExperience across all social media platforms including emerging channels and international platforms including but not limited to: TikTok, etcAbility to work in a fast-paced, startup environmentBA/BS required or equivalent experience

Thrive Causemetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
The base pay range for this role is $150,000 - $200,000, with the following factors determining the base pay at offer: skills, qualifications, experience. This range provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. Additionally, this role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance. Thrive Causemetics provides a competitive benefits package, including but not limited to: comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, a 401(k) plan with employer matching, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks, life insurance, disability insurance, and employee assistance programs.

This range provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. companyDescription:
We’re Changing the Beauty Industry for Good.

Thrive Causemetics was born out of a friendship. Makeup artist and product developer, Karissa Bodnar, lost her dear friend Kristy to cancer at just 24 years old. Kristy’s compassionate and vivacious spirit inspired Karissa to establish Thrive Causemetics, a beauty brand and philosophy that goes beyond skin deep by empowering women.
Thrive Causemetics is Bigger Than Beauty™️: For every product you purchase, we donate to help a woman thrive. We believe changing the world starts with a single ingredient, and that’s why we create vegan, 100% cruelty-free formulas containing proven ingredients without the use of parabens or sulfates. All of our high-performance cosmetics are developed at Thrive Causemetics Lab—we control every step of the product development process, and a large part of it involves you.
